Summary: Stayed for 3 night stay with family of 5. Room was spacious and comfortable. Having (2) queen beds and bunk beds was more convenient that having a sofa sleeper. The bathroom was very large with dual sinks, a tub/shower and separate room with stand-up shower and toilet. This made it very easy and accommodating for everyone to get ready.  The pool area and water park was nice but geared more for the younger kids (12 and under). There was plenty of seating and a nice sized hot tub.   The hotel is very nice and newer. Check in/out was easy, on-site valet parking was convenient and there was a large lobby with store and restaurant. The location is perfect, walking distance to Disney but much more affordable that staying on Disney Grounds yet offering similar amenities.
Manager Response: We're so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us! We're truly in a wonderful location, and we're happy to hear that it helped you and your family make the most of your visit. We look forward to having you back in the future!

Summary: This hotel had a good family feel to it.  The rooms were great as was the pool (with its slides).  The location was very very close to Disneyland, making it super easy to stroll over to the front gate.  We could also watch the Disney fireworks from out balconey.   I found the onsite self-serve laundry very very convenient.  Staff were very friendly and everything was very clean.  I would definately stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay, our favorite hotel when we go to Disneyland!
Summary: Very clean rooms, comfy beds, and friendly staff. Fairfield was our go to until we stayed here! The bistro is super convenient with yummy choices, and Janell at The Bistro is always so friendly and helpful :)
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear this! Thank you for taking the time to submit this kind, 5-star review, and share your experience with us. We look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Great family base camp for Disneyland and California Adventure!
Summary: I have never written a review before but the amazing combination of service and amenities compelled me to recommend this property. As a frequent business traveler, I have high expectations of hotels but did not know what to expect with this property. I was surprised and delighted at every turn - the Bistro is amazing and can meet the family food (and bar) needs from early morning to late night. The splash pad provides a great respite from the day at the park before the short walk to return for the evening. The bunk beds are a hit and the shower plus a separate bath/shower makes getting ready for the day much more efficient. The proximity to the park cannot be beat. Most of all, the employees made the experience - their service and demeanor is on par with top luxury hotels. They
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great family hotel close to Disney Land.  We are a family of 5. Rooms are very spacious. Bathroom is large and very clean. Hotel amenities are great. Staff are helpful and friendly. Pool area is more suited to younger children. Our 8 year old loved the pool but the 14 & 15 year not no much. Highly recommend this hotel if you are a family wanting to stay close to Disney Land.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful recommendation, Fred! We're thrilled your family enjoyed their stay with us. Hopefully, when your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we have the chance to host you again for another 5-star visit.

Summary: I just spent 7 days at this Courtyard.  It is very clean and comfortable. The water pressure isn’t great, but it’s standard for California. The rooms are very large, designed with families in mind.  I was solo on this trip, but if I had my family with me we would have all been very comfortable.  The staff is really awesome. Much better than a normal Marriott staffer. Very helpful, responsive and always saying “hello” with a big smile.  Lots of common areas to relax and enjoy socializing with friends. Great food on site - tons of restaurants all around. It’s central to plenty of places to walk to within a few minutes.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here with our two kids for our most recent Disney trip. The rooms are great! The kids loved the bunk beds and the splash pad, we loved the little restaurant (mostly the bar) and the great service. The rooms had a mini fridge and microwave. There were 2 showers, 1 with a tub, and a little nook to eat at/let the kids color. I also loved that the alarm clock had a connector for newer IPhone. This allowed us to charge and play music while we watched the fireworks from our room. We walked to Disney both days we went. I timed the walk and we were in California Adventure in 13 minutes. We stayed at the Disneyland hotel last year, which we also loved, but this will be our go to spot from now on!
Manager Response: Thank you for this fantastic review! From our convenient location to room amenities, and view of the Disney fireworks, it sounds like your family enjoyed all that the hotel had to offer. We can't wait to have you back with us on your next visit!

Summary Heading: Will never stay at courtyard Marriott theme park enterance again
Summary: We normally stay at the Grand Californian hotel but Thought we would stay at a Marriott as we enjoy them in Canada  Well never again Our truck got infested with ants and when husband told vallet they just were like yeah it happens and we were left to deal with it  When we were checking out i let them know and they really did not seem to care I then asked to talk to manager and he gave me a card and told me to call him in a couple days I was like yeah right and called him and he was already at hotel  They ended up detailing and waving vallet fee which was appreciated but did not fix ant issues as our 26hr ride home we was awful as we had to keep killing ants. I did get a email from manager saying that detailing and waving fee should be good enough for our 7 day stay ( really) and
Manager Response: Greetings Nanjamommyt40: Thank you so much for staying at our hotel on your recent visit to the Disneyland Resort area and thank you very much for your detailed trip report. I sincerely apologize that we let you down and did not provide a great experience for you. I regret the response that you received from our valet team when you reported the problem with ants in your vehicle. They should have immediately expressed their concern, investigated the problem, reported it to senior management, and resolved the situation to your satisfaction.   Your experience was not typical for our hotel and demonstrates that success is never final; as a hotel manager this keeps me humble and reminds me that training must be continuous and that communication can always been improved. Please contact me if I can be of additional assistance to you.

Summary Heading: By far the best hotel EVER
Summary: We have stayed here so much the staff basically knows our whole family. Service is top notch. It’s clean. The rooms are HUGE and for our family of 7 COMFORTABLY which is no easy feat. Every room has two showers and a large double sink bathroom. Anytime we have any requests they are always taken care of. Carrie, Bobbie and Madison are an absolute joy to work with. They always help us with reservations and booking. Prices on food and water are high but let’s be real people, nobody comes to Disney for the low prices. Plus, you can have instacart deliver. Each room has a fridge and microwave ! The starbucks is not a “real starbucks” but the coffee is just as good. Super convenient to get coffee in the morning.   Valet is easy to use. Just text and your car is ready to go. It is a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean spacious and close hotel to the park.  Plenty of room for entire family in the suites.  A little further of walk than I expected but still not bad at all.  Themed very well and easy to park.  Would recommend for families of 4 or more.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this kind review and recommendation, Jennifer! We hope to have you with us again in the future. 😊

Summary Heading: Great location for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: I stayed here for 3 nights with my family of 2 kids to visit Disneyland. It was my first stay here, but I plan to return. The location is great and super convenient to bring my son back to the room to nap. The decorations for halloween time were fun and of high quality. My kids were scared at first, but by the end of the trip they found the spooky decorations to be a source of amusement.   I want to also highlight that the staff at Courtyards by Marriott are all very friendly and professional. Additionally, Noah in the gift shop, stood out to my family as being refreshingly polite and helpful every day and especially the evenings. After a long day at Disneyland, Noah has just the right level of energy and professionalism to make me smile, even when getting kid’s fever
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Awesome hotel and perfect for a family Disney stay!
Summary: We stayed here for 5 nights while visiting Disneyland and it exceeded all of our expectations! We had a family bunk room, with 4 kids, and it was perfect. Big bathroom and an easy 5-10min walk to Disneyland. Service was outstanding and kids loved the water park. Would absolutely recommend this hotel!!
Manager Response: Wonderful, Carly! Thanks for the fantastic review. We hope to have you and your family back again in the future!

Summary: While we frequent Disney World this was our first trip to Disneyland and it could not have been better. I attribute a lot of this to the hotel. After reading many 4 and 5 star reviews I chose this based on guest satisfaction and location to the parks but I could not have expected the level of luxury that came with it. It is absolutely beautiful inside and smells divine! The staff may not be employed by Disney but they absolutely provide top notch Disney guest service! We stayed in a room that had 2 queen beds and one set of twin bunk beds (which were like heaven!!) along with a small nook table and bench seating with not one but TWO showers and a giant sink area which made a week with 3 adults, a teen and a tween absolutely fantastic. Many of the rooms provide a view of the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Would fully recommend this hotel. Rooms are very clean and spacious. Bathroom and shower all very clean. Centrally located and easy walking distance to Disneyland. Around 10 mins walk. The pool area is great for the kids.
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Liz. We appreciate your recommendation and look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary: The hotel was very clean and had everything we needed. The breakfast that was included exceeded our expectations. Especially Joanna, she was so kind and helped us with our choices from the great menu selection.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is fresh-looking, clean, across the street from Disneyland and has friendly and helpful staff. Our King Bed room was spacious and offered everything we would need. Our theme park view is really a view of the parking lot with the very top of Disneyland view. The extra view is definitely not worth the money. The only other issue I found about the hotel was that the valet staff always made us feel as if we were bothering them.
Manager Response: WanderlustHrts:  Thank you for staying at our hotel on your recent visit to the Disneyland Resort area. We are very happy that your enjoyed your stay and thank you for your feedback we can share with our Valet team to improve our service for all future guests.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel during our vacation to Los Angeles as we were visiting Anaheim/Disneyland for 3 days and it was an wonderful experience. The hotel was not that far from Los Angeles International Airport and the hotel is in 5 minute walking distance to the entrance of Disneyland/Disney Califorina Adventure. The rooms were very clean and provided beautiful views of Anaheim and the Disneyland area. The hotel was also in driving distance from and In N Out and a CVS Pharmacy and the Anaheim Convention Center. But the heart of the hotel was the waterpark. With 2 slides and a wonderful kiddie play area, the waterpark was the icing on the cake for this hotel. If you need a great place to stay in Anaheim, Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim Theme Park Entrance is for you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is the worst we have ever stayed in. Rude and unhelpful staff. Our room has not been cleaned and our bed unmade (we will do it) when i asked why seeing we paid just on 9000 dollars for 3 rooms for 6 nights, he said it had been cleaned and maybe we came back during the day. We have 2 soggy paper cups as we reuse them  the policy is no crockery and cutlery no toaster and he asked me to show him where it says family friendly. Just saw it on this website.it is only my husband and i in this room and chilren and grandchildren in the others.He told me it was policy for all marriots not to include such facilities. We were led to believe it was family orientated. Families stay away from this place.
Manager Response: Dear Holiday:  Thank you for choosing to stay at the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance and providing your feedback.  As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept my sincere apologies for not meeting your expectations concerning the expectations of crockery and cutlery availability in rooms. We do advertise as family friendly as we do offer bunk beds, two showers, mini-refrigerators, microwaves and Keurig coffee makers in every room but unfortunately we do not provide toasters or cutlery as we do have a full Bistro restaurant in our lobby available to all guests for breakfast, lunch and dinner. I know how satisfying it is when you find the perfect hotel for your individual needs; one that offers all the services and amenities you want and none of the ones you don't. I apologize that we did not meet your expectations but hope you will consider other Marriott hotels for your future travel needs. Marriott has 30 hotel brands in its collection which range from luxury hotels such as the Ritz Carlton to economy hotels such as the Fairfield Inn - I hope you will find the perfect Marriott hotel for your future travel needs.

Summary: Exceeded expectations! Service SO BEYOND what we just received @ the Ritz Laguna. From the housekeeper to lifeguards- so nice and helpful. Quiet place the week of our late spring break. Pool area safe and clean. Even yummy bistro in lobby. So grateful it’s not too Disney. Very affordable and easy trip w two elementary schoolers. Was recommended by some avid Disney cousins.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this 5-star review! We're glad the team made your visit special and we look forward to having you back with us in the future. 😊

Summary: Stayed 4 nights to visit Disneyland and the hotel was perfectly situated, I timed it one night and it only took 7 minutes to walk from Main Street to the room.  We arrived early but were shown straight to our room which was much larger than expected with 2 very comfortable double beds and also bunk beds. The spacious bathroom had a large walk in shower plus a separate shower over the bath which is great for families. Lots of storage space and a great fridge . Very quiet air conditioning too. The staff we encountered were excellent and very friendly, always happy to help, highly recommended hotel.
Manager Response: We're thrilled to hear this! Thank you for this wonderful review. We're very glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us and we hope to host you again in the near future.

Summary: I spent ages researching where to stay that was easy walking distance to Disneyland. Courtyard by Marriott definitely ticked that box. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was spacious and clean. All very adequate. If you’re looking for a few extras eg. Room service, a stocked mini bar, breakfast then this isn’t the hotel for you. After a 12 hour flight it would have been nice to have a cold beer in the fridge! So it comes down to what you’re looking for.
Manager Response: Dear Sarahbickerstaffe:  Thank you so much for being our guest; we hope you made many magical memories while visiting the Disneyland Resort area. We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay and found our rooms to be spacious and clean and that the hotel staff were helpful and friendly. I know how satisfying it is when you find the perfect hotel for your individual needs; one that offers all the services and amenities you want and none of the ones you don't. I apologize that we do not offer room service, stocked mini-bars, or complimentary breakfast but hope you will consider other Marriott hotels for your future travel needs. Marriott has 30 hotel brands in its collection which include hotels such as the Ritz Carlton, JW Marriott, Westin, and other luxury brands which offer these types of services - I hope you will find the perfect Marriott hotel for your future travel needs.

Summary: The Courtyard by Marriott Anaheim Theme Park Hotel basically serves the purpose it is there for, for you to sleep at to get ready for Disneyland. We stayed for 3 nights and it was nothing spectacular to write home about. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean, but that was about it. I wish there was a room with just two beds and no bunk beds. I know you cater to families, but this trip was just my daughter and I and we had no use for all the extra beds. It made the room look crowded.   It was a nice surprise that I was able to check in early, instead of having to leave my bags at the counter and come back later to take them up to my room. That was a big plus.   The bistro food leaves a lot to be desired.   And I’m sorry, but seriously $4.50 for a bottle of tea.. That is
Manager Response: Greetings Selynab2015:   Thank you for being our guest and thank you for your review. I am pleased that you were able to check-in early and that you enjoyed our evening Bistro service. I regret that there was construction noise from a nearby hotel; fortunately they should be finished with the exterior construction soon.   I apologize that we were not the right hotel for you but hope you will consider other Marriott hotels for your future travel needs. Marriott has 30 hotel brands in its collection which range from luxury hotels such as the Ritz Carlton to economy hotels such as the Fairfield Inn - I hope you will find the perfect Marriott hotel for your future travel needs.  Best regards,

Summary Heading: excellent weeks stay at the courtyard
Summary: Stayed here for a week at the beginning of August. Hotel is a good neighbour hotel for Disneyland. Smooth check in - room given on the second floor ( thats the first floor for us english!!!). Large room 2 queen beds and bunk beds( which my 14 year old son loved ) . the room had a seating area and table which was very handy , as well as a desk area and chair. There was a coffee maker, fridge and a microwave. very happy with the room , cleaned to a high standard . There was on site coffee bar/snack restaurant that did breakfast items and also sandwiches and pizza. reasonably priced . There was also a shop that sold disney items again reasonably priced. it had its own on site water park that looked fab - they provide pool towels.The staff on reception were always cheery and happy
Manager Response: This is wonderful to hear, Deborah. We're thrilled that you and your family enjoyed your time with us, and we truly hope to have the chance to host you again in the future. Thank you for this fantastic review!

Summary Heading: Very close to Anaheim Convention Center
Summary: We chose this hotel for our visit to D23 at the Anaheim Convention center. The room was very nice and the maid service was excellent. The location was very convenient for walking to the Center and the price was great. Out only disappointment was the cafe. Twice when we went to eat there, it was closed. It had a very limited schedule that it was open. When we did find it open one evening we sat down and the same three employees walked by multiple times without evening acknowledging us. Finally I stopped one of them and said can we see a menu, and she told me, "You have to order at the counter." Someone could have pointed this out in one of the times they walked by, but they just didn't seem to care.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Convenient Hotel to Convention Center - Would Stay Again
Summary: Two adults stayed here late August while at the Anaheim Convention Center for 4 days.  The place is clean and the staff friendly.   We enjoyed the Bistro for breakfast each morning.  They serve Starbucks coffees and have a menu of some yummy items.  We particularly enjoyed the Avocado Toast and the Bistro Breakfast Sandwich.   I wanted to rate this a 5 but a few minor incidents cause me to rate it just 4 stars.  First, note that there are no in-room safes.   We called the front desk because the TV wasn't working early one morning.  When we returned around dinner time it still wasn't fixed.  Another call to the front desk and when we got back from dinner it was fixed.  Another morning call to the front desk asked for more hangers for the closet. Again, we returned late afternoon
Manager Response: Hello, and thank you for your kind review and recommendation! We're sorry to hear about the incidents you experienced, but we're glad to know the team made your visit special. We hope to have you back in the future for a 5-star stay!

Summary Heading: Mr Stanley was the perfect manager!
Summary: This hotel is run so efficiently. This is my go to place when squeezing in a Disney trip. I was checked in and in my room with my bags in 10 minutes. Whereas I have been in line for 45 minutes at the Disney properties before only to find that a room was not available. From the valet to the checkin process and personally handling the questions of guests through the bonvoy app (my preferred means of communicating), Matt was there to make sure we received the level of service expected of your Marriott status. You can tell that he really appreciates the loyalty from bonvoy members that keep coming back because of the great impression left on previous visit. Matt! Thanks again and we will be returning yet again. If I can only peel my son away from the waterpark so we could get some
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a one bedroom suit that overlooked the pool and park. Great location. Not far to walk to Disneyland entrance. Lots of shops and restaurants near by for food supplies. Staff very helpful and friendly. I will be back.
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear this! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We'll pass along your kind words to our team and we look forward to hosting you again soon.

Summary: So I chose this hotel because of its close proximity to Disneyland. Hey, who wouldn’t want to be a five minute walk to the main gate. The only problem was, my kid didn’t want to leave the hotel. That’s right!! The little waterpark was fantastic. And on such a hot day my four year old found all day splashing in water to be a better choice than standing in line at Disneyland in 92 degree weather. The great part of our trip was that we got to head into the park after the sun finally set and we had an amazing time. Being passport  holders makes it so much easier with flexibility. The next morning we asked for a late check out and if you are an American Express bonvoy elite status then they will hook you up provided that the hotel is not sold out. Matt Stanley, the assistant  general
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: perfect spot for families for Disneyland
Summary: Great hotel beside the theme park entrance. I have stayed in the Disneyland hotel before with family for location purposes but this is easily as convenient and certainly much less expensive. It took 11 minutes from leaving hotel room to get into the park (through security and ticket entrance). Family room with 2 queen beds, and double bunk bed easily accommodated 6. Beds very comfortable. Netflix on TV. The large modern bathroom was beautiful. They have great waterslides and a play area around the pool that my kids (aged 4-9) loved. There is a hot tub as well.Staff incredibly pleasant and helpful. There is a shop in the lobby which sells drinks and bar/restaurant area which looked nice, although closed at 10pm, so if plan to use it factor that into your departure time post
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your 5-star review! We appreciate your recommendation, and we're thrilled you enjoyed your stay. We look forward to hosting you again on your next visit!

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights as part of a Disneyland "Good Neighbor Hotel" package and were very pleased.  The location cannot be beat as you are a 5 minute walk to the entrance of the Disney complex.  This allows you to come and go from Disneyland and take breaks, which is the key to a successful Disney experience.  No shuttles, just a brief walk.  The hotel also is geared to families with 2 showers, 2 sinks, and (in our room) 2 queens plus bunk beds.  There was even a little breakfast bench and table.  The waterpark is nice, although the pool is pretty small.  A huge amenity is that there is a filtered water station right outside the elevators which is important because Disney lets you take water bottles into the park.  There is also coin operated laundry, very helpful for long
Manager Response: none

Summary: My entire extended family stayed here for our epic Disney Adventure. So close to the park with plenty of rerurants and shops around. There is a bus stop right outside and also easy access for parking. Rooms were very clean and the staff fabulous!! The kids in our group ranged in ages from 3 to 19 and everyone loved the water park. Would definitely stay here again as best value if visiting Disney.

Summary: Courtyard Marriott: I chose this hotel bc it was close and had the best slides/waterpark.  We got it with points, so price wasn’t an issue.  I liked the bunk beds and the extra shower.  The waterpark was perfect for my 1 and 4 year old.  They have a small pool that’s 1ft deep for the little ones and a little water play structure with small slides that my 1 year old loved going down.  My 4 year old loved that play structure and the bigger slides.  There’s also a hot tub and a small pool thats 3.5 ft deep.  It was nice bc I didn’t have to worry about my 4 year old, who was able to stand in that pool.  My 7 year old would have liked for the pool to be bigger and deeper (It was about 10x20) but he had fun swimming there anyway.  We swam 2 mornings and 2 evenings and it was never
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review, Anna! We're so happy to hear that the team recovered your lost items and that you enjoyed all aspects of your stay. We look forward to hosting you again soon!

Summary Heading: Very Nice Location Close to Disneyland with it own waterpark
Summary: This is one of the better options for a hotel next to disneyland in Anahiem.  The lobby is very large.  This amenities and lobby are really tailored for family and kids.  The waterpark which is part of the hotel is a unique offering and we very much enjoyed it.  Its not a themepark size waterpark but its clean and well serviced and maintained ans a load of fun for the kids.  Rooms are very large, clean, modern and offer bunk beds as well along with the regular beds!  They messed up my reservation and room upgrade... not something I would expect being a Titanium member with Marriott but it happens from time to time.  Otherwise, they would have recieved 5 stars.  I would stay again if I ever wanted to go to the convention center or any of the nearby theme parks.

Summary: Place was the best to stay at, felt safe and the kids had a blast at the water park, staff was very friendly and helpful, next trip To Disneyland I plan I will definitely come back to this hotel, I travelled from Canada and the laundry facilities were good, ten days on the road we got our laundry done there, the pool always had fresh clean towels, some places we been too it’s a struggle to get towels after dipping in the pool, that was awesome! Gift shop had lots to choose from, it was decently priced which was nice.
Manager Response: This is what we like to hear! We're absolutely thrilled that you enjoyed your visit, and that our team made your stay special. Thank you for this wonderful review, and we hope to host you again in the future.

Summary: The location of the hotel is excellent. You can't get closer to Disneyland without staying at one of Disney's own properties.   I was surprised by how big the basic room was. I was skeptical about it being able to sleep 6 people but it really could. The bathroom is huge as well. Two sinks AND two showers!   The private waterpark and jacuzzi on-site was just an amazing addition to an already wonderful hotel. It was perfect for afternoon breaks away from the parks.   Overall the stay was fantastic and I definitely recommend it!
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind recommendation! It sounds like you truly enjoyed your stay with us, and we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here. We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: If you are looking for a clean, fun and perfect place to stay for a Disneyland visit- this is it!  Our family stayed there for 4 days and it was perfect for us.  Our goal was to find a walkable, clean and nice hotel, allowing us to go back to the two theme parks at will- and this location worked perfectly.  The room size is awesome and the splash park was a nice bonus for our younger son. Proximity to quick easy and faster dining was also a bonus.  We totally recommend this hotel!

Summary: Great hotel, very simple and easy experience.  We went to Disneyland and stayed the night there, the pool and spa are clean and well lit.  The room was already air conditioned when we got there, a very welcome thing on a 89 day.  They have fresh fruit water in the lobby and a movie going for guests. I would stay here again.  We even forgot something and called asking them to hold it, they went to the room right then and got it then held it for us until the end of the day when we could make it back.  Super appreciated Jonathan's help getting a phone charger when we forgot ours too :-)

Summary: Great location, 10 minutes to Disneyland entrance. Check in staff very prompt and helpful. Got there early and left bags with valet, went to part and returned later. Nice pool area, great for kids when not at park. Rooms were very spacious and clean. Two full beds with two bunk beds, sleeps 2 adults and 4 kids easy. Two showers in bathroom. Rooms were quiet with good view of pool area and partial view of Disneyland. They do not have full service bar and restaurant, but have a bistro that serves wine and beer and a simple food selection. Lots of eating place close to hotel.  It was the ideal place to take family for Disneyland vacation.
Manager Response: Thank you for your fantastic review, Bill! We're happy to know that the team provided top-notch service, and we appreciate you sharing your experience here.

Summary: The staff was extremely helpful & friendly.  The location is great as it is very easily walkable to Disney.  The kids loved having a waterpark right outside and it was also pretty cool to be able fo catch the Disney fireworks out there in the evening.  The room was spacious and had the bonus of a bunkbed for the kids.  The only downfall of the room was that the tiled part of the floor gets wet & slippery due to the condensation from the AC so we had to spread out towels on the floor.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 4-star review! We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your time with us, but we apologize for your experience with condensation on the tile. We'll share this with our team for review, and we hope to host you again in the future for a flawless experience.

Summary Heading: Great service and location for Disney
Summary: Really impressed with Courtyard Marriott, and how it is set up to cater for families making the trip to Disney.  We had a room to sleep 6, including a bunk bed. Availability of laundry facilities for families on longer trips really useful. The staff are helpful and friendly, from valet to front desk to gift shop and bistro.  The bistro provides good value breakfasts for families. The location is great, only 10 mins walk to Disney so you can have a break (nap!) and refresh half way through the Disney day. We did that both days. And there is a great little water park that small kids will love.  And a decent restaurant 1 minute away - Mimis, also good value for families.  Highly recommend if looking for a location for Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for this fantastic review, Cecil! It sounds like you truly took advantage of all that the hotel had to offer, from our rooms to our great location. We hope to have the chance to host you again in the future!

Summary: We wanted to stay close to Disney without paying Disney prices, while still enjoying a family friendly and clean place to stay. Courtyard Theme Park Entrance was perfect! It was probably a 10-15 minute walk to the entrance. It was well paved the whole way and easy to pass with strollers. You have to cross a major street, but there's a crosswalk that allows plenty of time to safely cross. We enjoyed having a McDonalds and Panera on the route to the parks so we could quickly grab a cheap breakfast. We also grabbed breakfast at the coffee kiosk in the lobby one day and that worked out well.  The front desk staff was very friendly and welcoming, as were the valet and bell staff. Our room was so much fun for the kids. We reserved a theme park view room that had a large bedroom with a
Manager Response: Thank you very much! We appreciate such a kind review, and we're thrilled you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. Hopefully, we'll be able to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary Heading: Nice Courtyard.. the pool makes it a 5
Summary: No pool, this is more like a 3+ or 4 rating.  We decided to stay here because the Disney property prices were insane (we always stay on property in Orlando, but you can get better pricing there), we were looking at 2x what we paid to stay at this Courtyard.  I typically stay at Marriott properties. This is a decent Marriott Courtyard. It has food service “The Bistro” that has good food options. The valet is very quick with getting the car. The front desk staff are extremely helpful (I had issues printing tickets, they let me use their “work” computer to solve the problem - thanks). The water park is very nice, but more so for the smaller kids and younger/pre-teens. If you have older teens, they might not be as enamored. My young son loved it, he would have stayed there all day.
Manager Response: Thank you for such a thorough review! We truly appreciate you taking the time to share the details of your experience with us here, and we're glad you enjoyed your time with us. We greatly appreciate your feedback and we hope to host you again on your next visit!

Summary: If you've stayed at Courtyard's in other places, you have a certain idea of what you're getting. This is not a Courtyard, or at least it doesn't feel like, because it is so much nicer. The hotel itself is beautiful, the customer service is excellent, the rooms are huge, and the water park is great for kids and adults alike.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words, Mark! We're so happy we made your visit special, and we look forward to hosting you again in the near future.

Summary: From the time of our arrival to our departure, the staff was friendly and  courteous.  We arrived a few hours before our check in and they allowed to check in early.  Our room was clean, sanitary and large enough for our family.  The best feature, which added value to our stay was the water park.  It kept our family entertained before and after our visits to Disney.  It was walking distance to Disneyland and various restaurants and retail.  Overall, a great place to stay that is family forward.
Manager Response: We're so glad to hear this, Jason! We appreciate you sharing your experience in this kind review, and we look forward to hosting you and your family again in the future.

Summary: The hotel lobby and rooms are very nice.  The staff is pleasant. The grandkids absolutely loved the pool and slides to the point  that they much preferred staying at the pool then crossing the street to go to Disneyland.  Need I say more?

Summary: Like the name suggests, the Courtyard Marriott Theme Park Entrance is just steps away from the entrance to both Disneyland and Disney’s California Adventure. It is located on Harbor Boulevard, making for an easy walk to the theme parks. Loved not having to wait to shuttle back to hotel after a long day!  Aside from its fabulous location, the hotel’s biggest draw for families is Surfside Waterpark, a 20,000 square foot water playground. Located on the hotel’s second level, Surfside features four water slides, a 400-gallon drench bucket, water cannons, kids’ wading pool, hot tub and swimming pool.  Definitely our go-to hotel next time we visit Disneyland!
Manager Response: Thank you for this fantastic review! We can't wait to host you and your family again on your next visit. 😊

Summary Heading: Great Marriott property with fabulous staff.  Easy walk to Disney.
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the Marriott Theme park.  The rooms are very well laid out with 2 showers in the bathroom (lovely surprise) and bunk beds in addition to the 2 queens.  Lots of counter space, a table with seating and a fridge and microwave made this the perfect room for a large family.  It's close to Panera, McDonalds, Ihop.  We did not use the water park as it seems it's for younger kids.  I checked and it is 1000 steps from door of hotel to entrance at Disney.  I took away one star b/c of the check in process and internet. I think it was a fluke but it was crazy when we checked in.  No carts available, elevator had a huge line almost going into lobby.  They did comp my parking one night b/c of it.  Internet was very very spotty.  Otherwise I would stay again.

Summary Heading: Great hotel don’t bother paying a premium to stay on site
Summary: Basically the closest thing you can get to the park... 5 min walk. Big rooms, clean, good food at the bistro downstairs.   A lot of restaurants around to eat at . We loved it considering we always stay in Disney hotels .  This is was a pleasant surprise ! Great stay ... Great value for what you pay!
Manager Response: We're delighted to hear you found our location convenient for your recent Disneyland adventure, and we appreciate you taking the time to share a review with us. We can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our three night stay here while visiting Disneyland.  The staff were all super friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  The valets were always fast in retrieving our car and gave us some helpful advice for nearby restaurants.  Disneyland Park entrance is about a one mile walk from the hotel.  The rooms could use some updating, but overall, the rooms were very clean.

Summary: Would highly recommend this hotel if you're visiting Disneyland. We booked the 2 Queen & Bunk guest room. (2) The location is fantastic. And within walking distance to the park. (3) The price is reasonable and value for money. (4) The bathroom is well designed and two people can shower/bath at the same time.  (5) Staff are friendly and helpful.

Summary: I love coming to visit Disneyland and always look forward to staying at a Marriott property when I’m in town . This has to be my favorite location to visit . The room I stayed in had a wonderful view of the park and very spacious with an outdoor balcony. The staff was wonderful. Summary: My family just returned from a vacation at Disneyland.  We stayed 3 nights at the Courtyard and absolutely loved our rooms and the location. There is a small store inside the lobby with lots of options for snacks and adult beverages.  They have a starbucks café in the lobby as well.  The hotel is very clean and we will definitely return if we come back to Anaheim in the future.

It seems to have everything our family needs: New hotel, family friendly floor plans, incredible water playground and near family.  When I went to reserve the room, none of the room types that would work for us were available for our days.  I immediately called and spoke to someone who really helped us find a decent alternative of having one room for the first night and the room we actually wanted for the rest of the trip.  Then I realized we'd be

Summary: Courtyard Marriott is the spot to go if you want space in your room and Disney level service.  From the moment of arrival, the team treats you with the upmost importance and makes any accommodation possible.  The stand out for us was the size of the room and all the sleeping options.  The kids loved the bunk beds and everyone slept well.  Also the pool and water area was really fun.  The water slides were a hit and all the space in the water area was great for the adults. Summary: Stayed for 3 nights for a large family trip. Beds were comfortable, staff very friendly and easy walk to Disney!! Loved having 2 showers!!! The Christmas decorations complete with a huge bear that gives hugs was a great addition.

Summary Heading: Our favorite Anaheim hotel by far!

I love the bunk beds in the rooms, and the kids slept comfortably in them. The little robot in the hotel lobby is awesome, too! The water park was a welcome respite from the heat in April, and we loved spending a few hours there when the heat and crowds at Disney became too much. This is a wonderful property and we will never stay anywhere else in Anaheim. Look no further, and book here!

Summary: We stayed here two nights. Absolutely loved staying here. Loved the bunk beds and has a shower and bath!!!! Although it doesn’t include a free breakfast, the small water park made up for it. The hotel has a restaurant inside as well as a gift shop that sells lots of Disney merchandise.

Summary: My family and I lodged here for 2 nights in June during the opening of Disneyland's Galaxy's Edge.  I have stayed in multiple Courtyards by Marriott and they never fail to please.   Rooms: Spacious, modern, clean and very comfortable  Location: Less than 5 minutes from Disneyland Parking Lot  Amenities and Services: Fitness Room, Pool, Bistro, Bar, Official Disneyland Neighbor Great toiletries by Paul Mitchel  Negatives: No Disneyland Shuttle, No actual Restaurant   Overall: You really cannot go wrong for $200 per night (extra $20 per night for parking), in such a prime location

The rooftop pool/splash pad is perfect for the little kids!   The hotel is very clean and newly updated. And the bathroom is huge!  Added bonus...walking distance to Disneyland, California Adventure, Downtown Disney, and numerous restaurants

We got upgraded to a room with unbelievable views of the fireworks from our balcony.  The location is fantastic.  An easy 5-7 min walk to the entrance.  Close enough to pop back and forth hotel to park whenever we felt like it.  The staff were incredibly helpful.  Everything was top class and WE LOVED it. Absolutely made our trip staying here. Summary Heading: Exceeded our expectations! Perfect hotel for families!  So many extras!

The water park and pool was clean and so much fun!  The onsite Bistro exceeded our expectations!  The food was delicious, everything we tried was more amazing than the last! Summary: We will highly recommend this hotel to our friends wanting to stay and visit Disneyland. It is a short walk to the parks and has a lot of modern conveniences within walking distance. The hotel staff are very friendly and accommodating upon check-in and arrival. There is only valet service available which is fine since you have to pay for parking anyway. I booked the room about a month out but found the rate went down a week before and I was able to get the cheaper rate for a nicer room with a view. If I didn't get the last minute deal I would of found this hotel a little too pricey. The room is good as it included a kids bunk bed area separated by a hallway to our king bed area. There are also 2 showers, one a bath and shower combo and in the separate toilet area a shower stall.

Summary Heading: Amazing Stay - Should have stayed longer!
Summary: We had such a fantastic stay here over the Memorial Holiday weekend for my daughter's birthday.  We traveled to the area to celebrate my daughter's 4th birthday at Disneyland.  Everything about our stay was amazing.  Michael checked us in and was extremely friendly and helpful.  When he found out it was my daughter's birthday he went out of his way to leave a special surprise in our room for us while we were out of the park.  My daughter was so excited! Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a Disneyland vacation

To be honest I almost like the Courtyard better than the Grand Californian (my husband may disagree) it gets you away from the crowds, it's personal and quiet and I really appreciated that after a day in the park.  The location is great, took us 9 minutes to walk from front door to security gate. Couldn't be happier with customer service, it was above and beyond what I am accustomed to and I really

Summary Heading: A great family hotel for Disneyland!
Summary: This hotel is amazing for staying at while going to Disney for vacation.  The rooms are spacious, the bathroom having 2 showers, and the waterpark for the kids is great!  If you can, ask for a room with a view of Disneyland.  Stand on your balcony and watch the nighttime fireworks. So all that is needed is better lighting in the bathroom. Other than that, everything was great (kids loved the water park).

Summary: My family of 2 adults and 3 children had a fantastic stay at this hotel recently. I did a lot of research and was not disappointed - I wouldn’t hesitate to stay again. Summary: This is our 4th time staying at this hotel when we travel to see the Mouse. We Love this place. Traveled with  my mom and my nieces and nephew- ages 4-8. Summary Heading: Amazing hotel for families and ideal location for walking to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed just one night at this hotel and already planning my next trip back. This hotel is clean, staff is friendly and great location.   We arrived at the hotel early before check in and they allowed us to park our car and head to Disney for the morning. They have a great valet system that allows you to text valet when you are ready for your car, we never waited more than 5 mins for valet to get our car. Not only are the rooms clean but the bunk beds and Netflix access is amazing when your are needing some downtown from the park. The McDonalds next door is convenient for a quick meal. My son loved the pool and the clean restrooms and workout room are another huge plus for this hotel. This will definitely be our go to hotel when we are visiting Disney. Congrats to the hotel staff
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed for 7 nights at the Courtyard by Marriott Theme Park Entrance during our recent Disneyland holiday. I highly recommend this hotel. It is close to Disneyland, being about a 10 minute walk away. There are plenty of places to eat nearby too. The staff are welcoming, the rooms spacious and clean and the amenities are good. Although we didn't use the water park/pool area (we were too busy enjoying Disneyland) plenty of families enjoyed this too. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again if I was to return to Anaheim.
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Michelle! We're thrilled to hear you enjoyed your time with us and we appreciate you taking the time to share such a kind review. We look forward to hosting you again in the future!

Summary: My fiancé and I took a trip to Disneyland this weekend. We stayed for 3 days, on the 3rd day we decided to park our car (with our luggage) at the Courtyard by Marriot thinking it was perfect, the car would be valet under a structure, “awesome”. That was not the case. When we got back valet brought us back our car, I noticed the back window was half way down, I would never roll my back window down because it gets stuck and doesn’t go back up. I didn’t think anything of it and proceeded to get in my car. Than I noticed all of my luggage that was perfectly packed in the backseat was all open all my clothes and items were scattered about. I proceeded to get the manager when I noticed stuff was actually stolen out of my luggage. The manager claimed to watch the security camera and
Manager Response: Dear Ashleyydanae:  I am so sorry for that your possessions are missing. Our valet team takes pictures of all guest cars when they arrive at our hotel and we also have surveillance cameras located throughout our entrance and garage.   When you arrived at our hotel your rear driver's side window was halfway down. We would be happy to provide photographs and film for your review; they have electronic date/time stamps embedded in the pictures  - just contact me and we can make arrangements to send you this information.   When you brought this matter to our attention our valet manager reviewed the surveillance film and did not see anyone near your vehicle during the time which it was parked on our property. When our valet manager informed you about this you reported that you had parked your car at McDonald's and made other stops prior to coming to our hotel. It is my belief that the theft occurred before you arrived at the hotel. Please contact me, I will be happy to assist you in any way I can.

Summary Heading: Family oriented with close proximity to Disney entrance
Summary: One of the nicer hotels within a 5-10 min walk of Disney entrance gates, family oriented, safe vibe. Panera nearly next door was a great fast go-to on the way to the Magic Kingdom. Proximity to the DL entrance gates is ideal. Shallow warm baby pool was great for my 1 year old. Nice sundries store and bistro food was convenient. Booked package through Costco and my Elite status for Marriott got us an outstanding fireworks view and late checkout that allowed an extra morning to enjoy one final day in the park. Only complaints were the kid slide and large pool area had noticeably cold water even in hot weather. And the parking garage spaces are so tight when I wanted to get something out of my car valet had to pull it up or I’d need to pull it forward out of the parking space to be
Manager Response: none

Summary: Extremely excited to stay here; my wife and I wanted a great place to stay without costing a fortune at the same time we do not want a cheap hotel just to save money because the hotel stay is just as important as the time in Disneyland.  Only downside, I tried booking with military discount and not available then tried Marriott member number and would only allow cancellations within 24 hours after booking, after 24 hours I would lose 100% of my money if cancelled.   I have never seen that in any hotel I have ever stayed in.
Manager Response: Hello Pesci1987: Thank you for your post! We look forward to hosting your visit in November.   We do offer several room rate options. Our "standard" rates allow the option of paying when you checkout of the hotel and also permit changes and cancellations up to 48 hours in advance of arrival.   We also offer "Prepay and Save" rates which are discounted from our standard rates but require you to prepay and do allow for changes, cancellations, or refunds. Guests have the option of booking the rate plan which they prefer. Please contact us if you have questions about our rates or if we can assist you in planning your holiday.

Summary Heading: Ideal base for Disneyland **Aussie families we recommend
Summary: This hotel is perfect - very quick walk to the main Disney entrance. Save your money and stay here instead of one of the Disney Hotels. You will be just as close if not closer. Room was recently renovated, spotlessly clean, plenty of space for a family of 5. Pool / waterpark area looked great but was a little too cool for us Aussies and we had much to do at Disneyland anyway. Totally forgot to take photos of the room but it was exactly as shown on the website. If we return to Disneyland we would happily stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our third stay at this property and we had a really great time.   The room is well setup for families visiting the park. The entrance area has extra space for shoes car seats etc. the setup of the bathroom works well with families with kids, especially with two showers.   The food options downstairs also worked well, not to mention the other options close by.   The staff was great, especially the two staffers manning the pool area. They some how managed to memorize most of the kids names and and made our kids feel really special that someone took the time to connect with them. When we were leaving one of the staffers (I feel bad that I don’t remember her name) even came up to tell me what great kids we had which was a really nice way to end the trip.   The property is
Manager Response: What a wonderful review! Thank you very much for sharing such kind words. We appreciate your feedback as well, and we hope to host you again in the future. 😊

Summary Heading: Great for family, close to the park entrance
Summary: This is a newer property around the Disneyland parks.  The girls love the bunkbeds and the diner style eating around next to the sofa.  I chose this place mainly for its closeness to the entrance and being a newer hotel.  We were pleasantly surprised by the big swimming pool area with lots of different features for the girls.  We actually would come back to the hotel after lunch so the girls could swim and cool off a bit before going back to the park.  Overall it was a very enjoyable experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My favorite hotel when visiting Disneyland
Summary: This is by far my favorite hotel to stay at when visiting Disneyland. Great rooms with bunk beds and also a fun pool area for the kids. A short walk to Disneyland and also near several restaurants. I highly recommend this property!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind recommendation, Caroline!

Summary Heading: Best place to stay for Disney
Summary: This courtyard is literally steps away from Disney, very convenient. As Marriott platinum, they gave us top floor room with a balcony to watch the Disney fireworks. The room was clean and new, very nice for a courtyard. If we go back to Disney, it’s clear that we will come back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I loved this property.  It was very clean a pretty short walk to the Disneyland main gates.  My favorite thing about it was the room layout.  I loved that there were bunk beds in the room in addition to the regular bed.  The bathroom was large with a shower/bathtub combo near the sink area (separate from the shower) so kids and adults can bathe at the same time if necessary.  We had a balcony facing the park and the view of the fireworks was amazing.  We didn't experience any problems or issues during our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us, Kelly! We're delighted to hear you had a wonderful stay and found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable for your family. We can't wait to welcome you back during a future Disneyland adventure.

Summary: We stayed here during our recent trip to Disneyland.   Super quick and easy walk to the the entrance of Disneyland.  Clean rooms, plenty of space, loved having two showers, the beds were comfortable enough.  Did not hear other guests coming and going when we were in our room.  We liked the bistro for breakfast, however by 8:30 in the morning they were out of muffins daily, but really that is only negative.  We would definitely stay here again.  The convenience is worth the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Awesome location only 8 minute walk from Disney Gate
Summary: Pretty much located right across the street from Disney. Immaculate front lobby with gift shop, bistro and comfortable spots to sit/lounge. Staff at front desk and at the bistro provided top notch customer service. Easy and quick check in and out. The rooms were very nice and roomy. The rooms, hotel and water park were all very clean and well maintained. The water park was excellent for kids after hours at being at Disney. Good place to regroup. Our room had bunk beds along with two beds - the kids loved the bunk beds and it gave them their own space. The on-site store had all kinds of souvenir items and food/drink items. Request a room facing Disney and the pool as you can see the Disney fireworks from your balcony on floors higher than the 4th.  One of the best Courtyards we
Manager Response: We're thrilled to hear this! Thank you for taking the time to share such a wonderful review. We're so glad that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us, and that our team made your visit special. We look forward to hosting you again soon!

Summary: All in all, very happy with our stay. I wish they offered later checkouts (I'm willing to pay extra) for later checkouts. My family was hoping to get another 1/2 day at the park but had to deal with checking out at noon and changing in the bathrooms before going to airport. Its an inconvenience not limited to this hotel. I wish many hotels to could help solve this. Overall, it was a great hotel. Good luck finding a drink though... You won't find it here.  The hotel went the extra mile with activities for children when it rained. Outstanding staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: BEST Place Imaginable For A Disneyland Vacation
Summary: Our family of 10 (age ranges 2-74) had rooms 403, 404, 405.  They all overlooked Disneyland and we awoke to views of the  Mattehorn every morning.  On Friday night, we had a perfect view of the Fireworks display.   I will not repeat what others have said, but will say this was PERFECT for our family Disney vacation in every way.  I highly, highly recommend!
Manager Response: What a wonderful review! We can't thank you enough for your kind words. We're thrilled you and your family enjoyed your time with us, and we hope to host you again in the future!

Summary: Could not have been happier with choosing this hotel for our family trip to Disneyland. After reading reviews we decided this was a better choice than the Disney hotels. Marriot was new, clean, and less than a 5 minute walk to the front gates of Disneyland. Kids absoulutely loved the waterpark, almost to the point of wanting staying there instead of going back to Disneyland. Food options were very good to go food. Our room faced the park so at night we had the firework display. Its a perfect family option, not upscale, but everything you need for a vacation stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed on our family vacation to Disneyland. Our room was perfect for a family of five. Our room had two queens and bunk beds. The hotel was clean, the staff was attentive, and we enjoyed our stay. It was a close walk to Disneyland and was within walking distance to a Panera if you wanted to grab a quick breakfast on your way to Disneyland. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us in our great location, and we appreciate you sharing your experience with us here. We hope to host you again in the future!

Summary: 10 minute walk to the main Disney entrance.  Spacious suites, reasonably priced, great in-house gift shop.  Super friendly staff with fresh coffee each morning for the early risers/"Extra Magic Hour" crowd.  Would come here again if visiting Disney in the future.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not Your Average Courtyard, Exceeded Expectations - Great For Families Only Though
Summary: If you are traveling as a couple, this hotel is not a good choice for you.  However, if you are traveling with kids, this hotel is quite likely the best option in the area for you.   The rooms may not be luxuriously appointment, but they are very well maintained and very clean. There is a fridge to store food and a table to eat snacks.  Each room has bunk beds (which our daughter loved).  Upper bunk has a bed rail built-in and, if needed, you can request a bed rail for the lower bunk.  Bathrooms are large with two showers.  Getting ready in the morning is so much easier than in standard hotel rooms at other properties.  Water park area is not particularly large, but it provides entertainment for kids of all ages.  Two small slides for very little kids.  Two medium slides for
Manager Response: What a stunning review! Thank you very much for your kind words. We're thrilled you and your family enjoyed your stay with us, and we greatly appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us here. We look forward to welcoming you back again soon!

Summary Heading: Average hotel, good location, worms in the bathroom!
Summary: Stayed here for a family trip to Disneyland. Pros: walking distance to Disneyland, large rooms with two double beds, a bunk bed, bathroom with double sinks, two separate showers one with a bathtub. Cons: We came back to the hotel after our first day at Disneyland and I found a disgusting live worm in the bathroom sink and my husband found another dead one on the floor of the bathroom.  The front desk sent maintenance up to our room and she sprayed bug spray etc to get rid of any other worms.  We asked to switch rooms but were told they didn't have any more of the room type.  Upon checking out we asked to speak to the manager about the worm situation. The manager didn't bother talking to us, but had someone from the front desk call to say that what we saw was just food left
Manager Response: Dear LPDiane:  Thank you for staying at our hotel and thank you to your loyalty to Marriott Bonvoy and for achieving Platinum Elite status. I apologize for not meeting your expectations and for not providing the customer care which you deserve. I regret that I was not at the hotel during your stay so that I could take care of this situation for you. I am happy that we were able to contact you by telephone today and express our sincere regrets and resolve this situation to your satisfaction. Please contact me if I can be of additional assistance to you.

Summary: The rooms were spacious. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The bed was too hard for our taste but when I asked for them to place duvets on the mattress to soften the bed they happily obliged. Has a waterpark that is awesome. Walking distance to Disneyland. Loved the amenities. Outdoor not fault this place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is well equipped: Starbucks, Bistro, Gift Shop, Waterslides, Outdoor patio, Valet parking, Small store for drinks/snacks (very expensive but convenient). Location is great, close enough to Disney that we were able to come back for a midday break to rest. All staff were very accommodating (FD, HSKP, Valet, bistro, pool, everyone!) The grounds are modern kept very clean. We stayed in a standard room on the 2nd floor, w no view. It was big enough for a family of 5 (i think it sleeps up to 6) and well designed: fridge, microwave, Keurig coffee maker, breakfast nook, huge bathroom w 2 showers, lots of storage space. Im glad we chose this instead of the Hyatt  down the street. We were very impressed with our stay. We will definately stay here again for our next Disney trip.
Manager Response: Hi, Jasmine! We're delighted to hear you had a wonderful stay with us and found our location convenient and well-appointed and our guest rooms spacious enough for your entire family. We know how important comfort is while traveling, and we can't wait to welcome you for another stay the next time your travels bring you to Disneyland!

Summary: Well located, about 10 min walk to Disneyland. However, it feels like a lot longer after walking all over Disneyland.  It would be difficult for elderly or people with young children. Wish they had a shuttle. Also wish there was a line of cabs where the shuttle buses park.  Check in was friendly but left room for improvement. I had booked two rooms, the second for my daughter and her family, arriving one day later. When I checked into my own room, I asked that my daughter’s name be added to her room and swiped my  card so she could check in without me being there. The next morning I checked to make sure everything was in order before we left for the park and was told that my card had been attached to the wrong reservation and needed to be swiped again. Then, when we picked up
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No need to pay for a Disneyland hotel
Summary: This hotel was half the price of staying at a resort on the Disney property. It was just two of us, but their rooms would be perfect for a family. We had 2 queen beds, a bunk bed, a shower, and a shower/tub combo. It also has double sinks, and who doesn't appreciate that. I didn't visit the pool so I can't comment on it. It really is a quick walk to the Disney entrance. You will pass some homeless people hanging out at the bus stop but I never felt unsafe, even late at night. My only complaint would be the typical hotel WiFi that is constantly disconnecting and asking you to sign back in.
Manager Response: We're thrilled to read your review and recommendation! Thank you for taking the time to share your experience here. Your feedback regarding wifi is appreciated as well and we'll share it with our team. We hope to host you again soon!

Summary Heading: 25 things you must know about Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance
Summary: 1.  We stayed here 3 weekday nights in mid January, trying to take advantage of Disneyland.com's special winter 4 day pass of $229, blackout dates Feb 12-24, good for visits until May 23, 2019.    2.  Normal one park price is as high as $129 per day, with on demand pricing -prices highest Fridays and weekends, and in the summer.     3.  Went on Rocketpoints.com, put in my Alaska Airlines member number, and looked for hotels near Disneyland.   This hotel rated #1 on Yelp.  4.  More expensive than neighboring Howard Johnson and Fairfield hotels, paying $305.67 a night for 3 mid January weekday nights, before 20% in taxes, including 15% transient occupancy city tax.     5.   $30 surcharge for rooms with view of water slide area, $60 surcharge for rooms with view of Disneyland and
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a really great hotel. I was very impressed with the size of the room, and how clean and well maintained this property is. The lobby is great and has a convenient store as well as a bistro. The rooms have a lot of space and the double sinks and two showers are great for busy mornings getting prepped for the park.   I was very impressed with the staff here. They were great. The service level of the staff is comparable to what we get when we stay at fairmont or pan pacific, five star service from all staff that we encountered. My husband became ill during our stay and they were very accommodating allowing us a 2 pm checkout so he could rest.   We would stay here again 100%. Very quick walk to the park entrance, five minutes tops. Thank you courtyard marriot! We will be back
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us! We're delighted to hear you found our guest rooms spacious, our staff friendly, and our location convenient for your Disneyland needs! We can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary: This is a fantastic family hotel. We had the "basic" room and it still easily fit a family of 3 kids in the room so easily - with 2 queen beds and bunk beds standard plus 2 showers and a large bathroom. The hotel is literally a 10 minute walk to the Disneyland gates and the staff were fantastic in helping us with all our questions. They even helped us organise transfers from the hotel to LAX at short notice. It is a fairly new hotel (I think 3 years) and the facitilites are clean and modern. It also has a great pool and swimming area. Highly recommend.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to Disney and Bunk Beds
Summary: Great for families ...   Bunk beds mean that the kids don’t need to share a queen bed like in most hotels and it is so close to Disney that you don’t need to bother with shuttles and the like.  Not sure about the food service, as we ate in or around the park most days, but there is a Starbucks in the lobby which is a bonus 👍
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us! We're delighted to hear that you and your family found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable for your stay and our location convenient for your trip to Disneyland. We can't wait to welcome you back the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim!

Summary: We loved our stay at Courtyard Marriot. Great location just a couple minutes of walk from Disneyland. The rooms are clean and spacius, huge breakfast area with reasonable prices. I would recommend and definitely stay here again
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here 6 nights with our family of 4. We had the king bed with bunk beds down the hall and balcony view of the theme park. (During the day you could only see the tip of matterhorn mountain). The balcony was great for watching the fireworks though! As our kids were exhausted by that time and walking back into the park and crowds was just not going to work.   The mattress was ok, but the bedding was not to my liking. The top sheet was used to cover the mattress but did not fit well and as a result constantly came undone to where it would move with us when we turned and would be laying on the mattress. The blanket was too short and needed to be untucked also to use, making the bed even messier. This may not bother other people but I like a clean and tidy bed. O dont want to
Manager Response: Dear Sarah S:  Thank you for choosing our hotel and for writing a review. I apologize that you did not enjoy a 5-Star guest experience at our hotel. We will certainly use the information in your review to improve our service and retrain our housekeeping staff.   We strive for 100% guest satisfaction but are not always successful. When we don't get something right we ask that you let us know during your stay so that we can make it right for you. You can let the front desk know on your way in or out, call the front desk, or use the Marriott Mobile application and request a mobile chat with us to let us know if something needs our attention. If you are in a line at Disneyland, at our waterpark, or in your room - just use the Marriott Mobile application to communicate with us.   You can check-in using the Marriott Mobile application (which will alert you when your room is ready), request additional room supplies, or chat with us to easily communicate special requests or areas of improvement.   We hope you will stay with us in the future and give us the opportunity to exceed your expectations. Please contact me directly if I can be of additional assistance to you.   Sincerely,

Summary: After doing a lot of research and much reviewing we picked here and this place is perfect!!  Perfect distance to park entrance, awesome water park, delicious breakfast, and the customer service at the front desk was great- Mark was super accommodating and made us feel right at home front the moment we walked in!  The gift shop is perfect and much cheaper than the park. The room was spacious and very clean and stylish. Thank you so much and see you soon
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A gingerbread smelling home away from home!
Summary: We LOVED our stay at the Courtyard. We visited Disneyland last September and stayed at the Disneyland Hotel but I would rate the Courtyard higher! It is equally close to Disneyland and the staff here are the most friendly and welcoming I have ever encountered. The rooms were spacious and immaculately clean. Our kids loved the waterpark...even in the winter! After a long day in the parks it truly felt like we were coming home when we entered the warm and sweet smelling lobby each evening. Would highly recommend!
Manager Response: We can't thank you enough for your sincere review. We're thrilled your family enjoyed your time with us, and that our team made your visit a special one. We appreciate your recommendation, and we hope to have the chance to host you again in the future.

Summary: The Courtyard is a great hotel in a fantastic location. The rooms are very spacious and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Great family hotel with fantastic pool complete with water slide. Just a couple of minutes walk from the entrance to Disneyland. Can't recommend the hotel enough.
Manager Response: none

Summary: What can I say...this hotel is above and beyond most 5 star hotels we have stayed at in terms of exemplary service. The hotel manager needs to be commended - he is the perfect example of someone who leads a team wholeheartedly well. Everything was amaazing. The rooms are fantastic - spacious, clean & honestly the location cannot be beat. We had a King Room with a Disney View which was amazing. Perfectly quiet with the exception of the amazing nightly fireworks...thankfully the toddlers slept through them! There's a starbucks kiosk in the lobby which did us well for a light breakfast back in our room and then we set off to Disney where we stopped at the Cove for AMAZING espresso third wave coffees by Ray. *Do not miss this* Getting back to the hotel...in all honesty its been a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent modern rooms. High quality all around. Nice bathrooms. No faults with accommodations. Big breakfast area and reasonable prices. Short walk to park entrance and various restaurants/ food options near the hotel. Nice water park on premise provides a alternative from all day at Disney.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have visited Anaheim several times in the last 10 years and we have stayed both on and off property.  Although this hotel is a bit more expensive then some of the other off site properties, I found it worth the money.  The location is perfect, it was 5 minutes to the parks if you are a fast walker and 10 minutes if you are a slow walker.  The service we received from all staff was amazing,  I felt everyone was so welcoming and willing to accommodate requests.   I was really impressed by the staff at the marketplace/deli.  We ordered breakfast one morning to go and the portions were large.  I found it great value for the quality, money and portion.  The room size was incredible.  We had two queens and there was a set of bunk beds.  We were all shocked at what a good size it
Manager Response: Dear sherbus:  Thank you for staying at our hotel and for writing such a nice review. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay and that our location, staff, room size, Bistro, value, and waterpark met with your approval.   We are looking forward to hosting your next visit to the Disney Resort area and request your assistance so that we can make your next experience even better. I would love to hear from you to find out what changes or improvements you would suggest so that we could earn a five star review from you on your next visit.   Best regards,

Summary Heading: Great for families with small children
Summary: Just got back from a stay at the Courtyard Marriott theme park entrance in room 422.  Double queen suite.   The hotel was nice, and a true hotel vs motel.  Things we enjoyed 1.  Everyone we encountered was very pleasant.   2.  I didn't use the water features, but they looked nice.    3.  The room was very clean.  4.  Beds were very comfortable.  The bunks fits adults fine.   5.  The ability to walk to the park was nice.   6.  The coffee maker was nice to have. 7.  The shampoo etc was good quality. 8.  We did not have a problem with noise.  In fact we never heard anything from our neighbors.   9.  My mother was in a wheelchair.  The hotel is very accessible with large elevators.    Things that could have been better  1. Offer free breakfast.  You already have a whole room for it.
Manager Response: Dear AustinsMom:  Thank you for staying with at our hotel on your recent visit to the Disneyland Resort area. We are very happy that your enjoyed your stay and thank you for your suggestions on how to improve our hotel.   Marriott now operates 30 different hotel brands and each brand offers a specific selection of services and amenities. So it is important to choose the right brand for your individual needs. Some hotel brands offer a complimentary breakfast buffet such as the Marriott Springhill Suites or Marriott Residence Inn but other hotel brands are required to have a restaurant or Bistro. The Marriott Courtyard is required to offer a Bistro where we offer fresh made to order menu items which are separately priced. Courtyard also offers a selection of "grab and go" items for sale at the Bistro as well as at "the Market."  I apologize if we were not the right hotel for you but hope you will consider other Marriott hotels for your future travel needs. Our brands range from luxury hotels such as the Ritz Carlton to economy hotels such as the Fairfield Inn - I hope you will find the perfect Marriott hotel for your future travel needs.    Sincerely,

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel For Families Within Walking Distance To Disney - If You Don't Have Young Children Read My ENTIRE Review
Summary: This is a great hotel for families.  The room we stayed in was configured perfectly for traveling families.  We had 2 queen size beds, a set of bunk beds, and small dinette and a bathroom with 2 showers, tub, fridge and microwave.  The bathroom was large with the toilet and 1 shower separated by a door from a double sink and tub/shower in the rest of the bathroom which is great when you want to get many people bathed, dressed, etc. in the morning and night.  There is a waterpark at the hotel for kids to play in.  The hotel is walking distance from Disneyland so you can save the $20 a day parking fee.  Valet is optional.  BUT., BUT, BUT..because this is for families don't expect your room to be quiet.  The walls are paper thin.  We had the opportunity to hear EVERYTHING that went
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review, Shawna! We're very glad to hear that you enjoyed our great location and amenities, and we appreciate you sharing your experience here. We do apologize for the noise that you experienced, and will share this with our management team for review.

Summary: Hotel provided WIFI password without making it clear that it was NOT part of the hotel room charge. $50 surprise bill on checkout. Otherwise the room was nice, the kids had fun in pool and water slide and the staff are pleasant.
Manager Response: Dear OzTraveller-2018zzz:  Thank you for staying at our hotel and thank you for your review. I am happy that you enjoyed your room and that your children had fun in the pool and waterslides and that you felt the staff were pleasant.   I regret that you had issues concerning your hotel bill but wonder if you may be confusing us with another hotel.
