We do not provide our guests with a WI-FI password, our system does not require a password. When you connect to our WI-FI you are directed to a website landing page. The first option is for "Free Internet"; you can select the number of days you would like then click a button to "connect now." If you scroll further down on the landing page there is an option for "Enhanced Internet for $5.50 per day". If you choose this option you have to enter your room number and last name then you enter the number of days you would like to purchase then you click on "connect now".   Please contact me if you have any further questions or if I can be of additional assistance to you.

Summary: We enjoyed our rooms, the view, and the front desk staff.  We even got some bottled water for being Lifetime Platinum Guest in addition to our daily meal credit.  Overall, the staff were very friendly and took very good care of us. The rooms were spacious and even had two twin sized bunk beds, in addition to our two queen beds.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent Family Hotel in Great Location
Summary: My extended family stayed at the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance hotel last weekend.  We were very satisfied and will stay there next time we visit Disneyland.    There were 12 of us, including my wife and I, our two adult daughters and their husbands and six grandchildren.  We got two rooms next to each other.  It worked out very well.    The rooms each featured a pair of queen beds and two bunk beds.  The rooms were large and there was plenty of room to move around despite the queen beds and the bunk beds.  There was a nook in the corner with a table for eating in the room or just sitting.  Each room had a little balcony.  The bathroom was large as well and had two parts.  The larger part had a pair of sinks and a bathtub with a shower.  The smaller room had the toilet
Manager Response: We are thrilled to read this review! Thank you for sharing such detailed feedback and kind words about your recent stay. We'll be sure to pass this along to the team and we look forward to welcoming you back again on your next visit!

Summary: We stayed here for our family trip to Disneyland and it was great. The room was clean and the size is great! 2 queen beds and bunk beds gave everyone space to spread out. The bathroom has a shower and tub with a double vanity, which made getting ready in the mornings much easier. The lobby has games for the kids and the little bistro/cafe has great food.  The kids loved the water park and we loved the hot tub after the long days of walking around the parks.  It is about a 10 minute walk to the entrance of Disneyland.   Only downside is that there was no freezer in the fridge.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel for young families for Disney
Summary: We just stayed here for 3 nights with our 2 young sons.  We had a suite with the bunk beds.  I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.  For a fraction of the cost of a Disney hotel I think we were actually closer to the park.  Even with a 3 year old it only took us 10 minutes to walk to the entrance.  The room was really nice and clean and in good condition.  And it was nice to have the water park to play in when we needed a Disney break.  My only note is that the bunk beds seemed a little smaller than a standard twin - I'm 5'5" and prob could have slept there comfortably but I imagine a taller/larger teen might not be so comfortable.  If we went back to Disney we would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: This is wonderful to hear! We're so happy that you and your family enjoyed your time with us and found our location convenient. We greatly value your recommendation, and we look forward to hosting you again in the future.

Summary: Have stayed in various hotels on previous visits, including disney properties. I must say this hotel wins hands down. Perfect location, easy to walk back for a break during the day eith young children. When i say a break i mean the waterpark, that was the highlight of the trip for my son. Staff are super friendly and helpful, valet super quick and efficient. They all had personalities and not the sterile robot interaction you can get elsewhere. Rooms are exactly like the pictures, no hidden surprises, very clean and well maintained property. I will not stay anywhere else but here on future visits
Manager Response: none

Summary: Super convenient location for Disneyland and California Adventure. We have a 5 and 6 year old and had no problem walking it each day. Many dining options as well. Very helpful staff. Hotel cafe was super slow so not really an option.
Manager Response: We're delighted to hear you and your family found our location convenient for your recent visit to Anaheim! Thank you for letting us know our staff was friendly and accommodating. We appreciate your feedback about the bistro, and we will be sure to discuss this with our team. We hope to welcome you back for another stay the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: Stayed here for a quick visit to the theme parks. Loved that the room had two queen beds and bunk beds. Also our room had two showers!  Very nice and comfortable room. Perfect location and wondeful staff.  Pool amd spa were very clean with clean towels and plenty of seating and lunge chairs.  Never really had to wait for anything except at the Bistro for breakfast. My only suggestion woud be to have a line for coffee orders only as I had to wait for about three famiies to place detailed breakfast orders and al I wanted was a cup of coffee. Valet was always super quick to bring your car around.  Very much enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The rooms are nicely appointed. Our room had two queen size beds, bunk beds, a table with banquette, microwave, fridge and coffee maker. The bathroom had double sinks, tub with shower and a walk in shower. There is an on-site market as well as a gift shop with snacks and beverages.  The staff is very helpful!  The hotel is ideally located to visit Disneyland.  The street in front of the hotel Harbor has quite a few of restaraunts that are an easy walk from the hotel.  Really great!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Kathy. We're pleased to hear you found our guest rooms well-appointed and spacious enough to accommodate your family. We love knowing our staff took excellent care of you, and we can't wait to welcome you back for another stay in the future.

Summary: We initially planned on staying at a Disney resort - but we were quoted $14,000 AUD for 4 nights, so that put and end to that plan. It turned out to be a blessing. This hotel has a lot to offer. Very friendly staff, all the conveniences (Starbucks coffee in the lobby!), large rooms and a fantastic location! My boys also used the waterpark each day, which we didn’t think we would in November, but the weather was amazing. We spent so much time in the Disney parks, but came back to the hotel for a mid afternoon recharge each day, before returning to the parks at night. The hotel was a perfect base camp. Highly recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel. I was impressed by the efficiency of valet on check-in and check-out, as well as the front desk on both occassions.  Everyone had their job nailed down.  Nice work!  They have several room set ups.  We had previously stayed in a one room suite, without the king bed being separated, but this time, the master suite had a privacy door.  This is great...not for the reasons you might be thinking...dad snores.  Having this door means I'm the only one who has to deal with it ;)  I have stayed at several Disney area hotels.  This is at the top of the list.  I prefer it over the Grand Californian...did I mention that we need a privacy door for dad's snoring?  It's price is high for a Courtyard, but the location, and room layout are market price.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this fantastic review! We're very happy to hear that you enjoyed your second stay with us, and we greatly appreciate your loyalty, as well as your time sharing this feedback. We hope to have you with us again on yoru next visit!

Summary: We got let down by the Westin Carlsbad but this Courtyard is really above standards and met all our expectations.  Fast, efficient, convenient, all was great I can't remember waiting for anything.  It didn't feel crowded either.  Housekeeping was especially good and food at "The Bistro" was above average but obviously not gourmet. Our kid enjoyed the waterpark on a daily basis.  The room was also quite large, well distributed and comfy.  I saw the GM running around at least twice a day, it shows that there is attention to many details and the hotel is extremely well managed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We’ve chosen this hotel even thou travel agent was recommending different hotel. We traveled with boys 10 & 14 and the water park was the hit! They absolutely loved the slides and the pool. The hotel was very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. We were always greeted even by the valet guys. Hotel is located only minutes walk from Disneyland and you can enjoy their fireworks even from your room or the pool area. We had great holiday and will definitely return to this hotel on our next trip!
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Sasa! We're so happy to learn that you and your family enjoyed your time with us in our great location and that our team made your visit special. We appreciate your kind review, and we hope to welcome you back again on your next visit.

Summary: Great choice for families with children.  We stayed in the two queen bed room with bunks (our kids won’t share) and were really impressed with the room size.  Microwave and fridge size was great and especially liked having a small booth seating area so we could eat in.  Short 5 min walk to Disney entrance and lots of restaurants to chose from.  Kids waterpark area was lovely, small pool but good sized spa which was nice after a big day of walking.  Good size gift shop but only a small market but we found a bigger one only a few doors down at another hotel with everything we needed.  Easy to get to and we used Uber to get to shopping malls in the area which were close by.  Rooms clean staff super friendly, all in all a great place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Disneyland’s Halloween Party is a tradition we look forward to every year.  Last year we stayed at the Courtyard and loved it.  For 2018 we booked here again and have been overwhelmed with how great the property and the staff have been.  From the moment we walked in we have been treated as the a favorite family member who has come to visit.  We had two families with six adults and five children from 2-9 and everyone had a great time.  Having the water park on site allowed for a great “rest” day before the Halloween Party.  The staff truly enjoys their jobs and transfers that happiness to the guest.    The restaurant is a great change from park food and has a great selection all day long.  Thank you and see you next year!!!!
Manager Response: Hi, Nicholas. Thank you for taking the time to share this delightful review with us. We're thrilled to hear you and your family felt well-cared for during your recent visit, leaving you plenty of time to enjoy Mickey's Halloween Party! We can't wait to welcome you again next year and for many years to come.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel in both December 2016 and October 2017. It’s a fantastic hotel hands down. A little more expensive than the ones on the same road under 5mins from main gates but it’s worth every penny for the massive waterpark and huge spacious rooms that easily accommodate 6 people with 2 queens and bunk beds in every room. The walk in shower in addition to the regular shower and tub is nice.  About 5-6 min walk to main gates, has a few restaurant options and gift shop right in hotel. Free wifi, close to restaurants and McDonalds for quick breakfast or coffee.  Decent size fridge in room as well so we always hit the Walmart 10mins away and stock up on fruits/sand which meat/etc to keep in room.  The waterpark is my big draw as is has it all including 2 full size
Manager Response: none

Summary: I expected a lot out of this hotel, and it mostly delivered.  Here are some pros and cons--  PROS: The hotel is fairly new, clean, and has larger-than-average rooms.  You feel almost like you are in a mini suite, since the rooms truly can accommodate up to 5 people.  The bathroom setup is really cool, as well.  Decor is pretty fresh and modern.  Feels safe.  Some food options downstairs, on site, and many options nearby.   CONS: The WORST connectivity for cell phone and wifi I have experienced at a hotel, maybe ever.  We had Verizon and AT&T with iPhones at the hotel.  In the evenings, within the room, they were almost useless.  I had to go into the hallways to try to place calls, and even then, it was a 50/50 shot whether the call would go through.  Just be aware.  The other
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share this feedback with us. We are pleased to hear you found our guest rooms spacious enough to accommodate your entire family! We know how important comfort can be while traveling. We appreciate your feedback about our wireless service, and we will discuss this with our team. Should your travels bring you back to our area, we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you for another stay.

Summary: We really enjoyed the Courtyard for our Disney trip. The kids loved the room with the bunk bed and the water park. The walk is a little longer than they state on their website, but totally doable, and we got into the park and come back for a nap/pool time each day. Their water park is great, but the pool at the water park is tiny. Kids aging 2-12 loved the hotel. Very convenient having food/drinks/gift shop all in the lobby. The elevator takes FOREVER during busy times of day, and they really should have one or two more considering this hotel is near Disneyland and most of the people staying there have strollers and a great deal of luggage. Their rooms are larger than all of the surrounding hotels I have stayed in.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect Alternative to staying at Disneyland Resort
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised with our experience here and highly recommend it.  It's not a new hotel, but the photos don't really convey how good this place is.  Our family of 4 (2 kids aged 13 & 9) enjoyed our 4 night stay here to explore the Disneyland theme parks.  Spacious and very clean.  Staff very attentive - perhaps the best service at a hotel we got on our 3 week trip to the US. It's only a short walk to the main Disneyland entrance.  All of this for a much better price when compared to staying at the Disneyland Resort.  We didn't feel like we missed out on the Disney experience by staying here at all.  Our bed was comfortable.  The kids slept in a bunk bed, which was in a separate area to the main bedroom.  The only minor complaint came from the kids, who said their
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're thrilled to hear that you were so pleasantly surprised by your experience, from our staff to our location. We hope to be your hotel of choice for future Disneyland getaways!

Summary: tl;dr  Clean room, nice employees, close to Disneyland, good food at The Bistro.  Long review:  We came for a weekend visit to Disneyland.  We stayed in a 2 queen bed room with a view of Disneyland.  The room setup was great with two queen beds and bunk beds. The bathroom had a double vanity and two showers.  There is a small fridge and microwave, as well as a one cup Keurig coffee maker.  There was a small table with a bench seat which was great for eating breakfast before our big day at the park.  The room was really clean which was awesome.  I can't remember the last time I stayed at a hotel and there wasn't something dirty and/or broken when I arrived.  Even in nice, upscale hotels I've found stray hairs or burned out light bulbs.  It was so nice to not have to clean
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at this Marriott at least 10 times. They are right by the Disneyland main entrance which is great. They also have a Mimi’s in the parking lot which is even better. The staff is excellent and very nice. All the employees greet you with Hello and kindness. We had a room that had four bunkbeds and a king size bed with a separate living room. It was perfect for our group of six people. The hotel was decorated in Halloween decor. The kids loved it.  The waterpark they have there is really great for the kids. They played out there for at least 2 to 3 hours and had a great time. I stayed at the Hilton  Anaheim convention center  the night before and was very disgusted with that hotel so I switch to the Marriott. Should have went to the Marriott to begin with LOL
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us! We are so happy to hear our staff took excellent care of you and that you found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable. We love knowing your children enjoyed our water park, and we can't wait to welcome you back again soon.

Summary Heading: Probably the Very Best Place to stay for visiting Disneyland
Summary: My 5 year old grandson and I stayed at this hotel in late August, for a 4 day visit to Disneyland and Disney California Adventure Park. You can't get much closer; the park entrance was exactly a ten minute walk away. The room was spacious and quiet, with a very comfortable king size bed for me, and bunk beds for my grandson. The staff, including the manager, was exceedingly friendly and helpful, the valet parking was convenient and reasonable. There was an excellent bistro for a quick breakfast (you do want to get to the parks early!), a gift/sundries shop open until 11, with snacks available 24/7. All for a third the price of a Disney hotel. BUT, all that is not the reason this is the best place to stay. Instead of a simple pool, this hotel has a massive water park, with simple
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here because we were attending Knotts Scary Farm. We had a great experience with the hotel and staff. The price was reasonable, the hotel was clean and conveniently located to restaurants, stores and Knotts Berry Farm. The staff was friendly and attentive. We will definitely return.
Manager Response: Hello, Ilene! Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review following your recent visit to Anaheim. We're delighted you chose us for your trip to Knotts Scary Farm, and we love knowing our staff took excellent care of you. We can't wait to have you back again during your next visit to our area.

Summary Heading: Fantastic hotel for a Family Disney Holiday
Summary: This is the place to stay for a Disney holiday! Check in was fantastic. We arrived very tired around 1am and Paul was amazing. So lovely to the kids and check in was fast and seamless. We stayed in room 633. The room is clean, with everything you need. The double shower is a great idea. The hair dryer is also fantastic. Loved the pull out clothing line too. We had 3 adults and 2 kids in the room and had enough places for all our luggage without feeling cramped. Beds are comfy and housekeeping always do a great job. The pool area is fun and and can watch the fireworks from the spa! We used the laundry - $2 for washer and $2 for dryer.  The lobby area is really fun at Halloween time - a fun touch for the kids (and me) Walk to Disney is 5 minutes. Ate at Mimi’s Cafe a couple of
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A beautiful hotel that truly cares about its customers
Summary: Our family just found its new favorite Disneyland hotel!!!! After staying at other hotels in the area, we decided to try the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park since it was an extra special weekend- our daughter’s 8th birthday. We had a rough start to our trip, and immediately upon entering the property, from the valet to Katie at check-in, we were put at ease and helped to calm down and start relaxing and having fun.   Alas, the fun would have to wait. Within ten minutes of entering our room, our daughter tripped and fell on the nightstand, cutting her head. She was so excited about going to Disneyland, she was twirling and lost her balance. There was a lot of blood, my son was crying and my husband were struggling to stay calm. After a call to the front desk, Katie and another staff
Manager Response: We can't thank you enough for such a kind and detailed review! Again, we're sorry your little one had to go through an injury, missing a day at the park. We're thrilled all is well now, and we can't wait to welcome the whole family back again in the future!

Summary Heading: Easy walk to Disneyland, fabulous rooms and a waterpark!
Summary: We have made many trips to Disneyland with the family and in recent years we have been mostly staying in the park.  At this hotel, you get the same wonderful friendly service.  The hotel is only three years old and everything that I saw was in good repair.  The rooms we had were generously sized, had two queens plus bunkbeds, and had a lovely shower in the toilet area plus a tub in the vanity area.  A nice refrigerator and microwave plus a Keurig with coffee pods were included.  The kids we brought were thrilled with the free waterpark and the adults loved the gym.  There is a Bistro in the lobby, a good gift shop and a small 24 hour market.  Across the parking lot are Mimi’s Cafe, Panera Bread, and McDonalds and Dennys are close by.  I think we will be staying here often.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Courtyard Anaheim is a perfect place to stay for families going to Disneyland and Disney’s California Adventure Park. It was a short walk from the entrance, with fantastic views of Disneyland from the room (or at least the room we stayed in). Our apartment also had a separate room with bunk beds for the kids - which was another big plus. The hotel also had coin laundry facilities - again, brilliant for families. A great stay overall!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this lovely review with us. We are delighted to hear you had a wonderful stay and found our guest rooms comfortable for your family's vacation. We love being so close to Disneyland, and we're happy to hear our location was convenient for your visit. We look forward to welcoming you again should your travels bring you back to Anaheim.

Summary: There are so many wonderful things to say about our recent stay here... within a very quick walking distance to the park this hotel offered very affordable and pleasant amenities for our entire family (from ages 2 to 75). The clean, modern rooms had a bathroom with both a shower AND a bath. Anyone with with kids knows that after a long day at Disney everyone needs to wash off the sunscreen and churro dust 😂!  Admission to their water park is included. Although many rooms have a park view to watch fireworks before bed, you can also watch them from the water park! The food at tbistro was comparable to the park in quality and price and twice as convenient  for quick breakfast, pre-nap lunches, and dinners. Most importantly there was absolutely wonderful customer service from
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had an amazing stay here. Great waterpark for the kids. Great little cafe on site and restaurant in the car park. Right across the road from Disneyland. Rooms are really nice with free wifi. Highly recommended
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights during our first trip to Disneyland in late August and we were not disappointed!  From the moment we drove up, the service was excellent!  We were greeted by 2 valet employees immediately, one helped with unloading our luggage and getting it on a cart and the other explained about the valet service and how it worked for the duration of our stay.  Chase, the person who helped with our luggage, was awesome!  He helped get our belongings up to our room and then explained where all the amenities were and gave us a run-down of the area.  The front desk employees were always ready to answer any questions and we were greeted with friendly smiles whether we were leaving for the day or returning after the parks.  The room was very spacious, clean, and the beds
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to share this lovely review with us, Becky. We're delighted to hear that you and your family had a wonderful stay and that our staff members took such great care of you. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional customer service, so we're happy to hear you were able to experience our best. We look forward to welcoming you back for another stay the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: This hotel exceeded our expectations on every level. The rooms are very spacious, bunk beds are awesome and our young boys loved this hotel .Having two showers in the room meant a hassle free morning routine as both our boys had their own showers ! Being able to use our own Netflix account was an added plus for our two children .  The boys loved the water park at the hotel and no matter how big our days were , we always had to find time to go to the water park.  Special thanks to the girls on duty at the water slides - they were so lovely to our boys.  Customer service of the year award should definitely be awarded to chase at valet though, he was truly the friendliest most helpful person we encountered.   I absolutely recommend this hotel to any family thinking of visiting
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Duke! We're so happy to read your wonderful review, and we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience here. We'll be sure to pass along your kind words to the team.

Summary: Had a fantastic 5 nights here. Large comfortable and airy rooms, great facilities, clean and lovely attentive staff. Didn’t use the watermark but it looked great for the younger kids.  10 minutes steady walk to the main gate at Disney, plenty of food options locally (all budgets) and the food in the hotel was good. If we come back we would have no hesitation staying here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for the fantastic review, Dean! We're glad to hear you enjoyed your time with us.

Summary: This is way better than Disneyland hotel. We extended our trip and stay here after Disneyland hotel. Everything is better than Disneyland hotel. It’s newer, bigger room, with bunk beds for kids, better service, friendlier staff, better food options and much better water park. It’s close to Disneyland theme park.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, friendly staff and waterpark. We hope to be your hotel of choice for future Disneyland getaways!

Summary: For everyone looking into staying at this hotel, book your stay! This hotel is fantastic. We stayed 1 1/2 years ago and again now. It’s even better because the hotel staff are even nicer, I didn’t think it was possible! My little one has autism and they were so patient and accommodating. They rushed our room at checkin so that we didn’t have to wait too long and the lifeguards were extremely nice, giving him all sorts of little presents, Destiny and I forget the other girls names, they were all so kind to us. The last two nights we were upgraded to an even larger suite. For our anniversary they had wine waiting for us. We couldn’t have asked for more. They have a few computers in the lobby with the ability to print. This came in handy with our little ones. The TVs had Netflix
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your loyalty, and such a wonderful review! We can't wait to host you again in the future.

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel with spacious lovely rooms!
Summary: Just stayed at this hotel during a recent trip to Disneyland. It's beautiful, so nicely finished and quite luxurious!  The public spaces are perfect, and the room we had was gorgeous, huge, and down at the end of a hall so very quiet. None of the Disneyland "kids running up and down the halls screaming" like you usually get.   Be warned - if you're getting a room to include space for kids, the bunk beds are sized for kids probably 12 or under. They're small, not regular twin-sized bunks.  But the room was HUGE and gorgeous, had two separate showers (and one did have a bathtub), friendly and helpful staff. Easy walk into the main gate at Disney.  Very quiet location for a good night sleep while you're at Disney. I'd highly recommend.  We didn't have a chance to use it, but the
Manager Response: Hello, and thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us! We're delighted to hear you loved our location and found our guest rooms spacious and convenient for your travels. We also love knowing our staff took excellent care of you during your visit. We hope to welcome you again soon!

Summary Heading: Great hotel in an excellent location
Summary: We stayed here as a family of 5 when visiting Disneyland. It was perfect - spacious, comfortable and clean rooms, excellent location and friendly staff. We also hired a car and drove to Venice Beach, Laguna Beach and Universal and this made a great base for there as well as Disney. We used the valet parking which was reasonably priced, quick and easy to use. It takes less than 5 minutes to walk to Disney and has a great pool area. Really lovely hotel for an Anaheim visit - would highly recommend.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Third Stay and Still a Favorite!
Summary: We’ve stayed at this hotel every year since it opened and it is still our go to hotel for Disneyland.  THINGS WE LOVE:  - LOCATION: It’s an easy 10 minute walk to the Disneyland main entrance (attached is a map of the hotel and its immediate surrounding area).  - ROOM: The two queen room is spacious and the layout is incredibly functional, especially for a family with young kids (the bunk bed is a hit with our kids). The eating nook is a bonus. The bathroom has a separate toilet/shower area and sink/bathtub area. There’s an abundant of storage spaces, cubbies and counters for all our suitcases, backpacks and car seats.   - WATERPARK: The swimming pool and water slides provide fun and needed breaks from the theme park.   - BISTRO & SHOP: The food on the menu at the hotel
Manager Response: Thank you very much for sharing this kind review! We're very happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed another great stay with us, and that our team made your visit special. We appreciate your loyalty, as well as your feedback on things to be improved. We will share this with our team as a learning experience, and look forward to hosting you again in the future for a 5-star visit!

Summary: loved the proximity to Disneyland. Pool was very nice, room was spacious, hotel was very clean. Staff were very nice, we were able to watch the fireworks from the deck with a glass of wine. Mimi's restaurant was awesome and right outside the hotel
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel near Disneyland for people with kids
Summary: This hotel is what you would expect from a Courtyard. We had a king suite overlooking the waterpark for a very reasonable rate. The room was clean and large and had two showers which was nice. This hotel is relatively new compared to other properties in the area - some of which are pretty tired. The hotel is very kid-friendly - The room also bunk beds which was a huge hit with my daughter - it made her want to go to bed !! The waterpark area was great for children - with slides and other water features; however the pool itself was very tiny. The hotel has no restaurant - there was a food/coffee bar - but there are plenty of places to eat nearby, including a restaurant in the parking lot. It is only about a 10 minute walk from this hotel to Disneyland security. I give it four
Manager Response: Thank you very much, Kathy! We appreciate your kind review and we're thrilled you and your family enjoyed your time with us. We hope to host you again on your next visit!

Summary: The price was right for this hotel, which is only a 5 min walk to the parks. The water park was great although best suited for younger kids (ours is 13). The hotel is really new and updated, too. We enjoyed our stay!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Waterpark Wins for Hot Disney Trip
Summary: We stayed at this hotel mid week for a two day Disneyland trip.  The park was a 10 minute walk to the entrance, and the waterpark was a perfect break from the heat at ht park.  One night we went back to Disneyland for a parade, but one day we just called it a day at 3pm and spent the rest of the day relaxing.  Clean facilities and very nice staff.  No issues with valet parking (we were concerned because we usually self park).  Definitely pricey for the basic furnishings and for a Courtyard, but we you pay for location and for the water park.  The one bedroom king suite (with a separate bedroom) and bunkbeds in the living area was spacious and the bathroom with a separate shower/toilet area was well designed and also spacious.
Manager Response: We're so happy to read this 4-star review! Thank you for taking the time to share this experience here, and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Fantastic spacious room for family of 4 for 7 days. Perfect for Disney
Summary: We stayed here for the first seven days of our California trip and found it to be a fabulous hotel for the four of us.  We were able to check in slightly early and unpack total our five cases with plenty of space.  It was lovely to be able to do that as we felt so relaxed for the trip not living out of suitcases.  Jeff on the front desk gave us a great welcome and some handy tips.   Facilities are great.  Children (9 and 7) loved the water park which we hit about 4 pm every day after 7-8 hours at Disney to cool down. The water is recycled and feels it but we had no issues with it. Pool never too busy and agree with others the pool attendants are great.  I was also able to do a couple of loads of laundry which was really useful as Disney was very hot and sweaty!    Housekeeping
Manager Response: none

Summary: This maybe the best Courtyard that I have been in.  My kids love the water park that is free with hotel stay.  Walk into Disney, next to Panera Bread and McDonalds.  They have a great wine selection.  I was able to get into my room at 11am.  Great experience the entire 4 days.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this 5-star review! We're very happy to hear that you and your family enjoyed your time with us in our great location, and we appreciate you sharing your experience here.

Summary: The hotel was perfect.  Perfect room layout for a family with 2 small kids, facilities, cleanliness and best of all close to Disney. We chose a Disney view room so we could see the fireworks if we didn't want to go to the park itself. The pool, and water park kept the kids entertained when we weren't doing all things Disney. The room layout was great with a separate sleeping area for the kids, and a huge bathroom with 2 separate showers.  Mimis restaurant near the carpark was great. Food that resembled the real thing, tasted great, good prices and great service.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, convenient location, great stay
Summary: We are long-time SPG members and this is our favorite hotel when we go to Disneyland. We've stayed at the Disney hotels and still prefer this one. Our most recent stay (last week) was greeted with friendly staff, who upgraded us to a corner room that was awesome with our two young kids. Their waterslides/pool was open and the lifeguards were great with the kids. We took a break during our Disneyland trip for 1.5 hours and let the kids cool off in the pools. It is VERY walkable to Disneyland (just across the street) and the rooms are clean and the staff is friendly. We also were happy to see the fireworks from our balcony. They also are great at recognizing your status with SPG and Marriott.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're honored to be your hotel of choice for Disneyland getaways. Thank you for letting us know what keeps bringing you back! We truly appreciate your valuable feedback.

Summary: Such a wonderful hotel! The staff is amazing...friendly and very accommodating. Check-in went very smoothly. They kindly answered our questions throughout our stay. Honored our request for a late check-out so the kids could enjoy the water park for a bit longer. The hotel is clean clean clean!! The 2 queen/bunk bedroom is very spacious. Comfortable beds. The large bathroom with double sinks and 2 showers was wonderful! The water park is so much fun and a great break from the Disney parks. We saw staff cleaning the water park area and slides every morning before it opened. Location is excellent - less than a 10 minute walk to the Disney parks turnstiles. Bistro restaurant is wonderful for an easy quick breakfast. Also nice to grab wine or beer from...can sit outside by the water
Manager Response: none

Summary: We LOVED this hotel. Paige at the front desk went above and beyond to make our girls have a special birthday. We arrived back from Disney with balloons and cards signed by multiple staff members. So sweet!   Their water park was perfect after a long day in the sun. It includes 2 large slides, a splash pad, a pool and a hot tub. Perfection!   The rooms were spacious and clean. Our girls loved the bunk beds and we had plenty of room in the bathroom for everyone.   Randle (Front Desk Supervisor) also helped give us a great recommendation for our family to go eat on our way to the airport. He also printed the directions for our convenience. Again, this is above and beyond service for me!   This hotel is literally blocks away from the front entrance of Disney with plenty of food
Manager Response: Hello, Jennifer! We are delighted to hear you had a wonderful time with us and that your daughters were excited by their birthday celebrations. We love knowing that our staff took great care of you, so we'll be sure to share your praise with Paige and Randle. We can't wait to welcome you back the next time your family visits Disneyland.

Summary: The property is marvelous. We had 2 queens and two bunk beds. Big bathroom that had a separate door to the shower and toilet so someone could shower what someone got ready in the other room. From some of the rooms you can see the fireworks at Disneyland. It is valet parking but the guys were super. It’s in a great location to Disneyland and other attractions like Knotts Berry Farm. The water park is wonderful but make sure you go before the sun goes down it gets chilly fast. We were there in December so not sure about that in the summer. They also have a great hot tub for the adults and they do allow plastic cups for beer or drinks in the area. The staff keeps it super clean. If you get up early enough you can see them out there. Great proximity to stores and eateries. Starbucks
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location with an onsite waterslide park for the kids.  Our room also faces the park so you can view the Disneyland fireworks in a cool air-conditioned room instead of standing or sitting with a sweaty crowd.  The front desk folks are very friendly.  What was missing is a big jug of ice water as you come into the lobby.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review, Maria! We're happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to welcome you back again in the future. We appreciate the suggestion of providing ice water as well. We'll share this with the team!

Summary Heading: Family reunion from Ireland and New Zealand
Summary: We stayed here for 7 nights and could not fault any aspect of our stay. All requests were met and including our families having rooms to each other and bring on the 2nd floor close to the pool.  One recommendation would be to have side tables at each side of the beds. The coffee dock and shop was great and had everything we needed.
Manager Response: none

Summary: So I always use Marriott for family vacations for over a decade now. I am writing this from our room (2queen, bunk bed with view of water park stuff). My wife killed a giant cockroach when we got back from Disney. It was in our bathroom. I expect better from Marriott (not to mention the cost and points I used). See the photo. I picked it up with my nearly 3 year olds 4t diaper...huuuuge.   Ps. The water park is super small and recycles the water so that is sorta gross but the kids love it. The coffee stand / bistro style restaurant is nice.
Manager Response: Dear rhodydan:   Thank you for posting your review. We sincerely regret this reported incident; we have attempted to speak with you following the initial report but have not heard back from you. This incident is inconsistent with our experience at our hotel. Our guests have ranked us in the top 5% of all Courtyard by Marriott hotels for cleanliness. I regret that it was inconvenient for you to allow us to inspect or treat your room and that you were not agreeable to changing rooms. We will place your room off market after you checkout in order to professionally fumigate your room. Our hotel has a maintenance contract with a national pest control company; they inspect and treat our hotel to maintain a pest free environment and they have not previously encountered this pest in our rooms.        Our waterpark does recycle water as do all modern waterparks in California. It is important to conserve water while maintaining the highest levels of pool health and safety. Each water amenity (pool, wading pool, water slides, play structure, and hot tub) have their own separate filtration systems and are treated with a combination of ultra violet light, acid, chlorine, and CO2 and conform to the most recent Orange County health department standards.    I look forward to resolving this issue with and invite you to contact me at bill@anaheimcourtyard.com or by calling the front desk at your convenience and they will promptly direct your call to me.

Summary: We stayed here for our recent trip to Disneyland.  I loved everything about it.  We had previously stayed at the Disneyland Hotel which was great, but this hotel is much more affordable and still offers a lot.  Our kids loved the little water park.  It's large enough to be fun, but small enough that I felt safe letting our kids (ages 10 & 8) roam about on their own while we watched from tables.  It's a very easy and short walk to the main gates, and the fireworks are visible from the pool.  Our room was spacious, as was the bathroom and everything was immaculate.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us. We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and found our guest rooms spacious and our location convenient for your recent visit to Disneyland. We look forward to having you back the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: Great location, the room layout was terrific, and my son loved the water park. It was a fairly short walk to the park, and we picked up Panera for breakfast to eat on the way. We had a room with Disney view and this could not have been better to watch fireworks. I did notice people also watched from the pool deck which would be a good viewing location too. The water slides were perfect for kids and the bunk bed in the room was perfect for our family. I would definitely recommend this hotel if headed to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed July 4th to 11th amazing location great walking distance from park great pool amazing view of fireworks Pizza Hut and Game room was fantastic. Mims next door was good too. Definatly would stay again cost was good too.
Manager Response: This is what we like to hear! Thank you for the kind review. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.

Summary: Overall we had a fabulous time. Our stay started a bit on the rocky side. We had requested early check in and arrived before noon.  At that time, they said our room would probably be ready around 1:00/1:30 and to check back around that time.  We went to lunch at the nearby Panera (a very short walk) and returned.  We were given our wristbands and took the kids to the restroom and got them changed and out to play in the water park.  Many of the attractions were closed due to a child's accident (understandable) as the workers cleaned and disinfected the equipment. The people were courteous and helpful, and kept us updated. Everything reopened, then closed, then reopened again. Meanwhile, inside, we received several different updates, and our room was ultimately ready just a few
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked this trip as a way to slowly adjust from returning from Hawaii on or way back to Georgia.  This hotel is within a 10 minute walk from the front gate of Disneyland.  Our room overlooked the waterpark, which provided us a great view of Disneyland and the Disneyland fireworks in the evening.  The room was very clean, and the staff made sure it was cleaned everyday.  Everyday, we were greeted with a friendly smile by the staff at the front counter.
Manager Response: Hi, Christopher. Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us. We're delighted to hear you and your family enjoyed the view from your room and your stay, and we can't hope to welcome you back the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: This was our first time staying at Courtyard and it definitely won't be our last! From the day we checked in, checked out and a little after, the staff was friendly and oh so helpful. Rooms were much bigger than we thought and appreciated that the room had a keurig coffee maker and mini fridge, to store our Disney goodies i.e. caramel apples. Speaking of caramel apples, we left them at the hotel and only remembered when we were checking in our bags at the airport. This is where i can’t say enough about the Marriot application, and Bobbie Schneider, our contact at the Courtyard. On the Marriot application is a chat function where you can contact the hotel directly and within 15 to 20 minutes, Bobbie responded to our call for help on getting our apples back to us. Within a few
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Would not stay here again, bad business practices with bills, beware
Summary: Unprofessional business practices regarding bill. Booked a prepaid room, received confirmation, then was charged at checkout because they claimed I was never charged. Even showed evidence of prepayment. Dealt with several "managers on duty", wrong card charged for full amount on checkout (which was just to cover incidentals) even though I was assured it would not be charged. After many phone calls & texts, asked them to refund the parking fee for the hassle, they said they credited me but did not. Poor communication, all a result of bad bookkeeping on their part. Do not have confidence in staying in this location, put a very bad taste in our mouth. Would recommend the Hyatt House instead, modern larger rooms, bigger pool, breakfast included for less money, also within walking
Manager Response: Dear willtravelwithkids:  Thank you for staying with us on your recent visit to the Disneyland Resort area and thank you for your feedback.   I apologize for the confusion with your payment. When a guest books a hotel reservation and confirms it with a credit card the hotel will generally just confirm that the credit card offered is a valid credit card and will not charge the card at that time (unless it is an advance payment reservation). When the guest arrives at the hotel the hotel will enter the credit card and reserve funds for the estimated amount of the bill but will still not charge the card. Finally, at checkout the hotel will charge the card for the full amount. I can assure you that you were not over-charged or billed twice for your stay.   The hotel did refund you for your parking fees as a courtesy to you for your troubles. I will e-mail you another copy of your bill and have highlighted the line item on your bill which states: "Rebate - Parking" which shows the amount of your refund.   We have no record of any damaged vehicles at our hotel during your stay dates.    Please contact me if you would like a further explanation of our accounting/bill payment or if you would like to further discuss your experience. I can be reached by e-mail at bill@anaheimcourtyard.com.    Sincerely, Bill Cleaver General Manager

Summary: My husband and I took our almost 3 year old son for his first visit to Disneyland. The Courtyard was fantastic! Our son loved the waterpark. Our room was large enough   to not need to fold down the stroller at night. The bunk beds were perfect for a toddler to sleep in. The bathroom is large and made getting everyone ready easy. We found the hotel to be clean and modern. We would stay at this hotel again on a future vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary: From check-in to check-out the staff was friendly helpful.  With checking in once we arrived was not available, but they stored our luggage and let us know as soon as room was ready.  Polite at desk and bell hop are. Made great food suggestion for breakfast, lunch and dinners.  Pizza Press was a great choice. The room was great size and view of fireworks was perfect.  Water park made the trip an over the top adventures.  All of us love the slides and see who could get to the bottom 1st.  Great area for our 7 year old grandson to meet kids and have fun without worry. Nice area to bring food into lots of tables.
Manager Response: This is what we like to hear! We're thrilled our team was able to make your stay special, and that you enjoyed our great location. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the future!

Summary: We loved our room. It was big and comfy and clean. The staff were friendly. We loved the water park. Everything was great. We weren't thrilled that we couldn't park our own car or use the luggage cart without help from the hotel staff, but that is our only criticism. Everything else was awesome.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Amazing hotel, amazing service. Pool area is wonderful. 10 mins (easily) to disney. Clean, spacious rooms. Great view for fireworks -you can see from the pool if you dont have a view room so i wouldnt pay the extra if you dont want to. Couldnt rate higher.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us. We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your visit and found our room spacious and comfortable. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again soon.

Summary: From the moment we walked in we were greeted with a smile. Great service,valet parking. Located across the street from Disneyland. Easy quick walk to theme parks and downtown Disney area. Have their own waterpark perfect way to beat the heat.  Room was spacious and clean for a family of 5. Loved the bunk beds.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very close to Disneyland entrance, easy to walk down the street and enter the park. The rooms are nice and after a long day the beds were really comfortable. There are a few fast food restaurants nearby and a pizza hut and coffee shop inside the hotel.
Manager Response: From our location to our guest rooms, we're glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you for taking the time to review your stay. We hope to be your hotel of choice in Anaheim in the future!

Summary: We've stayed at a few places along the edge of Disney as well as at some of the Disneyland Hotels themselves and I have to say this hotel has been the best so far.  Even though we only had one room (2 x Queen Bed and 1 x Bunk Bed) it suited our family of 4 very comfortably.  The hotel has an amazing swimming pool (unfortunately only some of it is heated, not all) and young kids can't go down the big slide (even with parents).  It has laundry facilities.. $2 per wash and $2 per tumble dry.  It has a shop with lots of things to buy (disney oriented) and a food place as well.  Unfortunately you have to use valet parking ($20 per day) but still good value.   We did have a few minor issues with the toilet which they sent someone to fix.  One thing to be aware of is that's it's really
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Courtyard Anaheim for 6 days and would highly recommend it. The hotel is very close to the parks which made it convienent to come back mid day for a break. The hotel has a great water park area that our kids loved also. All of the staff were very outgoing and you get the same level service as a Disney Hotel. I would recommend staying here and will stay again if we come to Disney in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us. We're delighted to hear you found our hotel convenient for your recent travels to Disneyland and that your children enjoyed our water park. We can't wait to welcome you back for another five-star stay in the future.

Summary: Our room had a bunk bed and two queens.  The best part was that there were two showers in the bathroom.  So great for our family of 5.  Kids loved the waterpark.  Food here is not the best but a lot of local options to get instead of dealing with the hotel.   Disneyland is literally across the street.  Disneyland doesn't mandate that you stay on property for benefits like Disneyworld.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Disneyland and we were sad to leave! Courtyard provides wonderful customer service although there was a few hours wait for my mother’s room to be ready as housekeeping I found come around 4-4:30-5pm , 7-10 minute walk to Disneyland, Mimi’s restaurant at the end of the car park if nothing from the Courtyards own wonderful bistro menu jumps out at  you, family friendly rooms with bunks, booth style seating and table, 2 showers, laundry facilities, in room massage services and a water park what more could you possibly need/want! We will definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel, horrible front desk service
Summary: I stayed for two nights at this property. When I arrived I was tired cause of the long drive. I tried to do an early check in, the first person in front desk was nice and told me my room was not available,  but the second one gave me an anger look and make me feel bad with her type of voice kind of rude for a front desk person. since they look like sisters (one long hair the other one wich was nice have a short hair) maybe because I'm latino and she was Caucasian I guess.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your candid review with us, Francisco. We truly value all of our guests' input. We're sorry to hear that your stay did not exceed your expectations like we would have hoped, and we appreciate you filling us in on your experience. We will be sure to address your concerns internally, and we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in the future.

Summary: My family and I just finished a three day stay at this wonderful hotel (room 544). My husband and I spent many years in management at high end hotels in the Napa Valley, so naturally our expectations are pretty high. That being said, we were both very impressed with the quality of service, especially from housekeeping. Everyone we came into contact with was helpful, courteous and friendly. The waterpark was exceptional. Our five year old loved it just as much as our two teenagers did. This hotel is obviously well maintained. We never saw litter, stains or anything that was out of order. The location is perfect. We had no trouble walking to and from Disneyland and the hotel, even after very long days of walking in the hot sun. The Bistro was a wonderful feature as well. The food
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us, Polly! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location and outstanding service. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: The courtyard Anaheim Park Entrance was a great location. It was a 7-10 min. walk to Disney which was great.  The room was a great size. The kids loved the bunk beds . Having two showers was amazing for getting everyone ready. The kids loved the water park too. The only negative would be house keeping never cleaned our room before 4:30/5 .
Manager Response: none

Summary: Can not fault this hotel!!!  Rooms are perfect, clean, big and functional for a family - the room we had had 2 x queen beds, a set of bunks and a booth which was perfect for breakfast in the room and snack time!  The staff were always helpful and nothing was ever an issue, even to the point where if your child naps at a certain time they will Make sure housekeeping doesn’t disturb!!  The Bistro in he foyer is reasonably priced and has a good selection for all meals!  We will definitely stay again and recommend to everyone - thank you!!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us! We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and found our guest rooms spacious and convenient for your family's travel needs. Should you return to Anaheim, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you once again!

Summary: Stayed here in a family room for 5 nights and it was amazing. Great staff, clean, convenient location to Disneyland and nearby restaurants, great atmosphere. Staff were helpful with our enquiries to nearby tours and they were very knowledgeable about Disneyland. Having Mimi’s caffè so close, just a short walk from the hotels front door, was great.  Will definitely be staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed for 4 nights in April in a family room (with the bunk beds) with our 2 kids (3 and 5). This is an exceptional hotel for families and seems to have catered for everything.   The rooms were great. Spacious, with all the amenities you would need for a family trip. The staff were so friendly you could have been staying in a Disney hotel and the pool/splash park was a great way to cool down after spending time in the park. The location is so close to the park that you can easily pop back midway through the day and go swimming and it was always pretty quiet during the day.  A fantastic choice if you’re going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Jonathan. We're delighted to hear you and your family found our guest rooms spacious and convenient! We know how important both of those things are while traveling. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary: We just returned from our second stay at this property and it was just as amazing as the first time.. even better since my 1 year old took his first steps in their kiddie pool !!   Staff always greeted us as we entered the building, the had games for the kids to play in the lobby while we waited for our shuttle, the bistro was great for coffee in the morning, they little market was great for grabbing water bottles on the way to the pool.   the pool.... my kids LOVED it once again, we came back to the hotel each day for an afternoon swim and it was a pain trying to convince my two year old to go back to disney lol !!!   Cant wait for my next stay one of these days !!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel very easy to find and valet parking well worth it as they are very prompt and helpful. Reception staff very friendly and efficient. Very knowledgeable of the local area and attractions. Room was ready early which was great bonus and family room to sleep 6 had ample room. Kids loved bunk beds and watching fireworks from window. Room had fridge & microwave which came in handy. Bathroom huge with large walk in shower and bath separate. No issues with this hotel and only 10 minutes walk to entrance to Disneyland. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants excellent hotel and location. Water park added bonus.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, John. We're delighted to hear you and your family had an excellent stay with us and found our guest rooms spacious and our location convenient. We can't wait to welcome you back on your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: Highly recommend staying at this hotel if you’ve decided to stay off property. The rooms are large, clean and up to date on all amenities. We were a family of four, including two teenagers - with plenty of space. Friendly service from valet to check in to the cafe. The food at the cafe is very good, with coffee refills avail for free until noon. After a full day at the park, it’s an easy walk back to the hotel. Great choice for hotel when visiting Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Disneyland go to place to stay
Summary: Going to Disneyland and looking for a good place to stay ? This is your place !!! From the moment you drive up till you leave , they have it covered.  Help to get all your gear to your room. A room with 2 double beds and bunk bed. Mini frig and microwave . Large bathroom and plenty of aver all space. The staff here is the key and the so get it with service. Valet ( only option on parking ) $20 per day with in an out service included.  Cafe options changing from breakfast , lunch and dinner . Available beer and wine . Good in hotel option or plenty of local places to go as an alternative .  The water park is a added attraction and way to keep the little one busy on a break from Disney.  Not the lowest cost option but worth the cost all around .
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this lovely review with us, Russ. We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay and found our guest room spacious and convenient for your family's needs. We can't wait to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is right across from Disneyland.  We could see the fireworks every night from our room.  We stayed here with our two grandkids, and their parents for 4 nights.  The rooms have bunk beds for the kids, away from the main living area of the room.  You can put the kids to bed, and still watch TV or have a conversation without waking them.  The hotel has a water park as well.  A great way for the kids to cool off after a day at Disneyland.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Next trip to Disneyland we are staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great place to stay with the kids
Summary: If you are reading my review, I'm sure that you have checked out the pictures of the hotel. If you haven't, I suggest that you do.   The hotel was very nice. Having 2 Queen beds and a set of bunk beds was very nice for our family of 4. My brother and his family were 2 doors down from us, which was great. The thing that really impressed me about our room was that there were 2 separate rooms with showers in our bathroom. The center room of the bathroom was where the sink was. The room on the right had a full size shower and toilet in it. The room to the left of the sink had a tub with the shower over it. This made it very nice to get everyone ready for dinner and a long day at the park.   Our room had a very nice view of the fireworks at Disney. If you do not plan on still being
Manager Response: Thank you for this 5-star review, Steph! We're very happy to hear you enjoyed your time with us, including our amenities and great location. We'll certainly pass along your kind words to Jeff and the team, and we hope to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary: This hotel was amazing! We are Annual Passholders to Disneyland, we stay on and off the property, however, I couldn't get a handicap accessible room for the dates I needed. We finally booked the Courtyard because of the walking distance to the entrance. I wanted to cut out the loading and unloading of a shuttle, car, or bus. It was so worth it! Short walk and the rooms were wonderful. It really made it easy for our grandmother. The staff was friendly and helpful! Planning to return.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect for a family of 4 or 5
Summary: This is the best Courtyard I have ever stayed at (and I have stayed at MANY Courtyard hotels ). First of all, if you are in Anaheim for Disneyland, this hotel is tight across street from the park entrance. Truly walking distance - even when you are exhausted from a day at the park :) - it is an easy walk. Second - the room configuration and furniture placement is great for a family with kids (up to 4 kids).they have two queen beds and two bunk beds. and two showers !!! Great for family! Clean, nice, well maintained. There is a pretty impressive water slide area, we didn’t have time to use it, but it looks fun! We will be back and will fit the water slides in!  Last but not least, great value- especially compared to the Disney property. Great value!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us. We are pleased to hear you found our location convenient for your recent visit to Disneyland, and we're glad to know our rooms were spacious and comfortable for your family. We can't wait to welcome you back the next time your travels bring you to the area.

Summary: enjoyed having the extra sleeping with the 2 queens and bunk beds. Very helpful for larger families. Great walking distance to Disneyland. Did not pay for the upgrade to have a Disneyland/firework view but was able to see the fireworks clearly from our balcony each night. Would stay here again with our next visit to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for this wonderful review! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us and we hope to welcome you back again in the future.

Summary: It take no more than a 7 mins walk from the Courtyard Theme Park to the Disney gate. You can't beat this convenience if you are visiting Disneyland or the California Disney Adventure parks. Add to that the fact that this fairly new hotel offers smart, clean accommodations that are a cut above the rest of the lodgings in the area and you have a winner. There is a price premium, however.  We stayed in a large one-bedroom suite. It had two queen beds and two bunk beds, easily accommodating 5 people. The bathroom comes with 2 showers, which is a thoughtful touch. The staff at reception was warm and friendly.   If I have one (trivial) criticism it is that the trash bins are rather small. The hotel's café/restaurant has limited offerings but there are dining options aplenty nearby.
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, and we greatly appreciate you taking the time to let us know. We are pleased to hear you found our guest rooms spacious and convenient and our team members friendly and welcoming. We cannot wait to welcome you back the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary: I can’t express how much we loved this hotel! We stayed for 5 nights and it was the perfect first trip to Disneyland! We will only stay here for future trips. The room was amazing. Spacious enough for our family of 5. Stroller parking/spot for souvenirs right as you open the hotel room door. Beds so comfy and the bunk beds were genius for traveling with kids. Loved the spacious bathroom and that there was a fridge, microwave, and table to eat at all in our room! Pay a little extra to get a balcony to watch the fireworks show, you won’t regret it! If the room wasn’t enough, the water park area was a blast for the kids. This hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly! Ate at Mimi’s Cafe at least 3 times. Convenient walking distance to park entrance too! Only constructive
Manager Response: none

Summary: I can’t tell you how many hours I have spent trying to find hotels around the world that can accommodate our family of 5 in 1 room. This Hotel did it with ease. Someone has obviously spent time really getting to the bottom of what a family needs on holiday. We knew we had made a great choice from the moment we arrived. Check in was a breeze and the place is new (unlike many of the tired hotels close to Disneyland) The rooms are big and clean with 2 big double beds and a double bunk. The bathroom has double sinks and a really big shower and even better another shower over bath so there’s no queuing for showers when you’re rushing to get to the parks. The A/C is really good and quiet (unlike many hotels) and then there’s the location - a short walk (through the crowds) to the
Manager Response: Tim, we can't thank you enough for such a wonderful review! We are thrilled you and your family enjoyed your time with us, and greatly appreciate you sharing these kind words and recommendation. We hope to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary Heading: Stop Looking and Book this Hotel Now
Summary: I spent many hours reseaching different hotels close to DL Resort - It didnt take me long to settle on this newer hotel - this is our second trip to DL first trip we stayed at the HoJo ( across the road ) which is also nice. However if your budget allows go for this hotel. Close to both DL Parks.  Rooms are large - easily fitted our  family of five with space to spare, set of  bunk beds for the smaller kids and two Queen beds.  Recommend getting a room with a balcony view towards the theme park, these rooms have great location to see the DL Fire Works without having to visit the park itself. I understand these rooms are more expensive but worth it plus the windows are sound proof or double glazed so once the doors and windows are closed, no noise from anything... Great.  Water
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband describes our visit as "the best family hotel we have ever stayed at."  I agree!  JUST ACROSS the street from Disneyland. 5 min walk if that. The staff was so friendly.  Starting with the phone call prior to our stay helping us understand Disneyland passes and transportation available.  One of your staff called me back with a shuttle quote.  The room was perfect!  QUALITY bunkbeds were perfect and a hit with the kids.  The rooms were spacious as we were not cramped on top of each other.  A small area where more than one person could sit and eat or write as both a micro and fridge made it comfortable.  Another high point was the little cut out when you walked in the door.  This could be for shoes, bags or in our case a stroller.  It is not easy trying to fit a stroller
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this wonderful review! We can't thank you enough for sharing your positive experience with us here, and we look forward to welcoming you back again on your next visit. We value your feedback and suggestion regarding our lifeguard staff as well and we'll share this with the team.

Summary: Our family of 4 (2 adults, 12 yo and 15 yo) stayed here for four nights. This is an excellent choice for a trip to Disneyland. Very close to the entry by the bus area – a 5-10 minute walk. Many places to eat along the way, Mimi’s Café, Panera Bread, McDonald’s, a Buffet Place and we picked many things like water and sunscreen up from The Cove mini-mart that is in one of the hotels along the way.  The hotel is very nice. We had a room with 2 queen beds and a set of bunk beds. The beds were all very comfy. The only thing we noticed was the top bunk has a guard rail that makes a ton a noise if the kid sleeping in it moves around at all. There is also a nice table area to eat at and the bathroom has both a tub/shower combo and a separate large shower. We were upgraded from a
Manager Response: none

Summary: We have just complete a 5 night stay,  had an awesome stay, room was large and having the kids in their own room with bunks was perfect.  They loved the waterslide (only downside was that it was closed twice for sanitation reasons)
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We're thrilled that you loved our guest rooms and our waterpark. Thank you for sharing your feedback and we hope to welcome you back very soon.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, would like to see better food options
Summary: This was a great hotel to stay at for a Disneyland visit.  The room was spacious and clean and the water park area was a lot of fun for kids.  Two things I would like to see improved.  First, the food options were pretty terrible.  There is no room service and no food service by the pool.  There is one cafe, but the food is kind of terrible.  It was very inconvenient to have to rely on outside food with two little kids and this may really impact my decision about where to stay next time.  Also, I didn't appreciate being charged an extra $20 to leave my car at the valet past 4 pm (when, obviously, we would have still been at Disneyland).  The food, however, was the main inconvenience, especially with small kids.  Otherwise, it's a very solid choice near Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent family hotel, super clean, excellent service
Summary: Excellent hotel, super friendly service from every staff member, from valet to Barista to housekeeping. Super convenient 5 minute walk to Disneyland. Haven't been able to write a perfect review in awhile and this was perfect. Would just like to see an additional trash can or recycling bin in room, and bigger soaps. The bars are super small. Otherwise an excellent hotel and well worthy of the premium price/SPG points value. 2 queens AND a bunk bed!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're delighted that you loved our friendly service, convenient location and room set-up. We truly appreciate your feedback and we hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: We were undecided as to whether we should book this hotel or the Howard Johnson (which is next door). I’m so glad we booked here!  The hotel itself is very nice, new and modern. It has a great sized gift shop (with pricing that wasn’t overly inflated), a cute little coffee shop and an awesome water park. With our stroller, it took about 8 minutes to get to security at Disneyland and you’ll pass by a panera bread, McDonald’s, IHOP and Mimi’s Cafe on the way there!  Rooms were quite large and very clean. My only complaint (which is so minor) is that there weren’t enough garbage cans/recycling bins in the bedrooms. Ours were constantly full so we always had a bag beside the garbage bin Itself. There’s a nice size mini fridge and microwave in the rooms and the bedding is super comfy
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a recent trip to Disneyland and we were very pleased with the hotel.  The rooms were spacious and clean, with plenty of room for my two kids and mother-in-law.  My 5 yr old loved the bunk bed!  It is a decent walk to the parks, but totally doable. And this property seems a lot nicer than some of the alternatives in the area.  I would definitely stay here again when visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks for this great review! We're so happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your time with us. We look forward to hosting you again on your next visit!

Summary: We had one of the best stays when we stayed with Courtyard. I have raved about this hotel. Very clean, Friendly Rooms are great size and very kid friendly. Loved the fridge and microwave in the room and the wifi was fast. If we stay in Disneyland we will stay here again. They had the convenience of a store, Starbucks and also the pool was amazing. Very short walk to the park and the inside and outside was beautiful!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great hotel to stay in when coming to Disneyland
Summary: We chose to stay here due to the proximity to Disneyland and it is a great choice.  The family room has enough room for a family of 4 to stay comfortably and the bunks are a great call.  Check in was smooth, staff friendly and helpful and the hotel was clean. A nice touch was to allow the kids to have something from the market after we turned up late following a delayed flight.  There is some dining options nearby - Disneyland, cafe Mimi basically in the car park, Tony’s up the road and the onsite Bistro / cafe.  We are at both mimi cafe and Tony’s and both were good.  The room was serviced to a high standard and check out was smooth.  It’s about a 10 min walk to the front gates of Disney which is super convienent.  The last things is the water park which the kids enjoyed
Manager Response: none

Summary: Travelling from Australia, we recently spent four nights at this hotel. After reading the reviews of another Anaheim hotel that my travel agent had booked for me, that weren't so great i decided to switch hotels and book the Courtyard Marriott theme park entrance. I'm so glad I did. The hotel was modern, comfortable, clean and well presented. Our room had a sliding balcony door, which looked onto the waterpark. Was great for letting fresh air into the room, hotels can gets so stuffy. The staff were friendly and helpful. Very close to Disneyland, a very easy walk. There's a cafe in the lobby thats opens quite late. A little shop that sells your typical traveller needs and a cute little gift shop too.  I was travelling with my adult children and they loved it, but this would be
Manager Response: This is what we like to hear! We are absolutely thrilled that you found your stay with us to be comfortable, and that our amenities and location made for a convenient theme park experience. We can't tell you how much we appreciate you sharing such kind words in this review, and when your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we truly look forward to welcoming you.

Summary Heading: One of the best hotels for families
Summary: This hotel was one of the best we have stayed in with my Family. We are a family of five and having three young boys sometimes can be very difficult but the hotel made sure we were accommodated. Their concierge was so helpful and inviting. Helping us get around and gave us everything we needed as soon as we checked in. It was a wonderful experience just checking in. Once we got to our room we were shocked how spacious and clean it was. It had 2 showers which made our lives easier when having to shower our young boys. The room had 2 queen size bed which were very nice and a bunk bed for the kids. The room was very clean and to a excellent standard. The hotel also has a water park which my kids thoroughly enjoyed and didn't want to leave. We got to the water park a little early
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great family hotel close to Disney
Summary: Our family of five stayed for a week at the Courtyard. The weather was warm enough we took advantage of the pool and waterslide area during our afternoon breaks from Disneyland. Staff was superb. Location was excellent. Downside was there was no free breakfast, but we often grabbed fruit ($1/banana) from the cafe or store. We also could use the fridge and microwave in the room. We were happy there was enough storage space and beds for our family. Two sinks and two showers was ideal. With teenagers travelling with us the location was perfect for a quick walk to Disneyland. Definitely would stay again!
Manager Response: This is wonderful to hear! Thank you for sharing this kind review. We're glad you and your family enjoyed your time with us, and felt comfortable with the amenities provided. We hope to welcome you back on your next visit!

Summary: Stayed 4 nites. Had large room, more than adequate for 3 adults and 2 kids.  The room  had 2 queen beds and a set of bunk beds.   Nice gift shop in the lobby.  Didn't use water park.
