(Temps were in low to mid 60's.) First nite there, we were able to see Disney fireworks from our room.  Was surprised that there was no complimentary coffee or tea available for guests in the lobby. One thing I can never understand, is why hotels don't put out enough towels in their quest rooms based on the occupancy. This very close to McDonalds and Panera Bread.  Great for a quick snack run.  Short walk to Disney.  Our 2 toddlers made the trek easily.  (I was a nervous wreck) Drawback is the street is  wide VERY busy with cars traveling much too fast and too many driveways for cars entering
Manager Response: none

Summary: Just got back from a trip to Anaheim. This new hotel is just within steps from the park.  The rooms are clean, COMFORTABLE, well designed. The staff is pleasant and inviting.  They have a café in the lobby and the food is good! there is plenty of space downstairs for large parties in separate rooms can meet to break bread.  The bath amenities are great. They have a gift store and mini market for last minute items. Can't say enough about this stay. Thank you for your service.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us. We're delighted to hear you found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable for your travels. We know how important that is while on vacation! We're also happy to know you found our location convenient, and we hope to welcome you again the next time your travels bring you to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Ordinary - clean rooms and great pool area
Summary: No nice bar in hotel foyer. Disappointing that after a long day at Disneyland you can’t relax at a ‘nice’ bar with an atmosphere.  Very average facilities in that circumstance.  Around the pool there is no menu and therefore no food served or drinks served....this seems strange as that is where it’s nice to relax around after you’ve been fitting crowds all day - when we’d arrived off the plane all we wanted to do was sit outside in the sunshine and grab some food around the pool but there was NO service around the pool! No kettle in the room. No teabags offered either. Breakfast - lots of plastic knives and forks supplied for fruit. much better at Mimi’s. Basic room but clean.  Great facilities for kids who like swimming and water play - which is why we stayed. I wouldn’t stay
Manager Response: Dear tipprincess,  Thank you for staying with us and thank you for your review. I am glad that you enjoyed our Waterpark area and the cleanliness of our rooms. I sincerely apologize that your stay was not 100% trouble free and thank you for reporting these issues to us so that we can improve our service and amenities. Marriott has 30 hotel brands in its collection which range from luxury hotels such as the Ritz Carlton to economy hotels such as the Fairfield Inns. As part of Marriott's "select services" hotel brands, Courtyard by Marriott hotels do not offer room service, you may prefer our full service hotels such as J.W. Marriott, Marriott hotels and resorts, Renaissance Hotels and others which do offer room/poolside service.   We do provide our guests a kettle and teabags upon request with our Front Desk as our team provides single cup Keurig pods in your room on a daily basis and our Bistro does provide plastic utensils for To-Go orders but do provide silverware for dine-in service.  Please contact me if I can be of additional assistance to you.

Summary: This was our second stay at this hotel and it did not disappoint.  The addition of the bunk beds in the room is perfect when traveling with kids.  This location is so convenient if you're going to Disneyland.  We ate twice at the restaurant downstairs and the food was served quickly and was surprisingly good!  We utilized the pool and hot tub while we were there - both were heated and worked great!  We will definitely stay here again on our next Disney vacation!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room was designed around a family. Our room had two queen beds although we would have preferred a king size.  It also had a bunk bed for two more people.  The bath had a tub with a shower and two sinks and a separate room off this with a toilet and a good sized shower.  Our room had a view of Disneyland although not much to see from there.  We were hoping to see fireworks from there but not so.  We had a good time.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review. We truly appreciate all of your valuable feedback. Should your travels ever bring you back to Anaheim, we hope to welcome you back for a five-star stay!

Summary: We have been staying at this hotel for our annual trip to Disneyland since it first opened.  Given the heavy usage the rooms get (occupancy seems to be almost full every time we are there), they still have a surprisingly clean appearance and do not exhibit any signs of wear and tear.    We always get a suite which ensures that the master bedroom is a separate room to where the kids sleep, and their bunk beds are heavy duty.  And all the beds are very comfortable - even for an adult who is not the most slimly built.  Ahem.  The bathrooms have both a walk-in glassed in shower (for the adults) and a standard tub with showerhead (for the kids).  Given that typically these rooms see no less than 4 occupants, this speeds up showering time in the morning.  The shower exhibits a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A Great Clean, Modern Hotel Minutes from Disneyland
Summary: We had two rooms reserved.  Unfortunately we could not check in any earlier than check in time because the hotel had been full the previous night, but I can understand why.  With so many drab hotels in the area, this is a clean, bright, and modern hotel right next to Disneyland.  When it finally came time that we could get one of our rooms, Lindsay was very helpful in securing them next to each other.  Each room had two queen beds, bunk beds, and a bathroom with two sinks, a bathtub/shower, and a separate water closet with toilet and walk in shower, meaning that you could potentially house up to 6 guests in one room and still have to not fight over the sinks and showers.  The Bistro was up to the challenge of its volume, and the food was very good.  My aunt especially loved the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Zachary! We're delighted to hear that Lindsay and our staff took excellent care of you, and we appreciate you letting us know. We're always happy to be a family's home away from home, and we can't wait to welcome you back for your next trip to Anaheim.

Summary: Stayed November 2017 during Superheroes Race weekend (and beyond). The King room with fireworks view was absolutely perfect for us. Since I was beat from racing the Saturday and Sunday it was nice to be able to stand out on the balcony to watch the fireworks in our jammies. I knew that there would be fireworks nightly during this time so it was worth the extra cost to have the view. The king room also had enough separation so that I could be up early without disturbing my daughter sleeping in the bunkbed in the 'back' of the room.  We previously stayed at the Disneyland Hotel, but the fireworks view was way out of our price range so we decided to go off-property. Our room at the courtyard was large and still looked new and fresh.The entire hotel was very clean and all staff was
Manager Response: none

Summary: We cannot recommend the Courtyard by Marriott’s Theme Park entrance hotel enough. It was a perfect stay. We stayed here this past week for the first time. The bunkbed setup was ideal and fun for the kids. The room was quiet. We never heard any other kids yelling/crying. But, we also came back to the room late. So- maybe we missed everyone else’s bedtime routine.  The pool/waterpark was a blast. They had lifeguards on duty. My son went swimming while it was randomly raining, and he loved it. We have stayed at the Disneyland Hotel before, and (no offense) we would choose this Courtyard hotel over the DH in an instant next time. It is so much closer to the entrance. And, the room and hotel were super clean. Everyone was so helpful and kind. Thanks!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this great review, Allison! We're thrilled you enjoyed your stay with us and we can't wait to host you again on your next magical visit!

Summary Heading: A great hotel close to Disneyland
Summary: This Marriott is really the ticket for a trip to Disneyland.  Short walk to the entrance, the staff was exceptional, courteous, super friendly and accommodating.   The coffee shop had excellent coffee and food and nice lobby and work station.  Would highly recommend.  .  ,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for our annual DL trip in November 2017. It was the first time we stayed off-property and we absolutely loved this hotel! The kids loved the pool and the staff was awesome. Everyone was so friendly and always saying hello and goodbye.  Our room was nice and clean and we had a ton of space. The kids were super excited about the bunk beds! The Starbucks in the lobby is a great perk as well. Next time we visit DL we will definitely stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review! We're thrilled that you loved our friendly staff, family atmosphere and spacious guest rooms. We always love hearing from our guests! We hope to welcome you back very soon.

Summary: This hotel is located across from Disneyland.  To be accurate it is an easy block from the entrance to Disneyland.  I was not expecting much but this hotel was a real surprise.  Clean, modern, exceptional staff from the valet to the front desk staff - - all very polite and eager to help.  We were on the fifth floor facing another hotel and just beyond the 5 freeway.  However, with the sliding balcony door shut there was no noise.    Room was larger than most.  Very modern, spotless.  More than adequate lighting.  There were two queen beds and a bunk bed.  I was told all rooms have bunk beds.  Closet was large with a safe and small refrigerator.  Large desk area and LCD.  Channels were limited but Netflix was available if you have a subscription.  Beds were very comfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for our first trip to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel was clean and modern with all that we could have wanted for our two day, two night trip to Disneyland: fabulous pool area, short walk to the park entrance, enough beds for each person to have their own, and a handful of affordable restaurants nearby. Our room had a view of the fireworks, and our 5 and 7 yr old kids went crazy for the bunk beds and water slides. Every staff person we came across was extremely friendly and helpful. The one thing we noticed that could be improved: the sheets were kind of scratchy and noisy as people tossed and turned. There's nothing the hotel can do about this, but guests should also expect noise until fairly late, especially since the fireworks start around 9pm. This could be disruptive if children need to get to bed earlier, but we
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review! We're thrilled that you loved our pool area, views and staff. We can't thank you enough for your kind words! We also truly appreciate your constructive feedback as well. We hope to welcome you back soon!

Summary: The Website states that Valet Parking is $20 . It doesn't say that Valet Parking is the only option available. My family and I checked in after a long drive around 11:45pm . We pulled up and we were told that we were required to pay $20 for Valet Parking. Our plans were to go to Disneyland in the morning so we figured we would have to pay $20 anyway to park at disneyland . When we returned to the hotel around 5pm after a long day at disneyland we were told we had to pay an additional $20 because we kept our car parked after 4pm . We stayed a total of 8hrs at this hotel and had to pay $40 for parking. It's also a pretty long walk to the main gate of disneyland. Front desk agents have a huge attitude problem and they were not helpful at all.
Manager Response: Hello Damien N: Thank you for choosing our hotel and thank you for your review. I regret that you were unaware of our parking fees; it is our goal to fully disclose our fees in advance so that prospective guests can make informed decisions when choosing our hotel and not be surprised when they receive their bills.   In support of that goal, we state on our website "Parking - Valet parking, fee: 20 USD daily. No self-parking available. On-site valet parking only. No busses or RVs. $20.00 fee added after 4pm on day of departure." We also make the same statement on our reservation confirmation forms and we also list this on the valet claim ticket in bold text, which is much larger than the other text on the ticket. Additionally, the property map, which is handed to our guests at check-in, has our parking policy listed as item number one and we also have a sign at the valet desk that lists this information as well.   Please contact me so if you would like to share more information about your experience or if you have any ideas on how we could improve our parking policy notification efforts. Sincerely,

Summary Heading: Great value for the Disney area
Summary: A great hotel located approximately a 7 minute walk from the Disney entrance. Rooms are clean and modern. We chose a suite for our family of four which was very convenient due to the separate main bedroom. We paid extra for the waterpark view and my tip is ... don’t make this mistake! All you get with the waterpark side of the hotel is extra noise until 10pm. There is no view of the fireworks from this aspect, either. We have stayed at the Disneyland hotel previously and for me, there is no comparison when you factor in the price. Courtyard Anaheim is the number one choice - marginally closer to the entrance and a more convenient room layout for families.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Let me make this easy for you.  Book this hotel if you are visiting Disneyland and have kids ages 2 -10.  You will not be disappointed.  What we loved: - Pool and water park!  Water is warm so can even go on cooler days - hotel is new and in pristine shape - we booked a regular room but they were able to meet our request for a theme park view room!  Hello fireworks! - lots of room and storage space - bunk beds - restaurants super close (Mimi’s, Panera Bread, McD’s) - location to Disneyland, of course.  The hotels that are closer to Disneyland are closer by maybe 250 meters but none of them offer the same room size or amazing pool area.  I am so glad we stayed here and will never stay elsewhere.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're delighted that you loved our hotel so much from our guest rooms to our pool area. We truly appreciate you taking the time to provide us with your kind words!

Summary: This is your best bet if looking for a safe comfortable place to stay while enjoying Disneyland.  The hotel was clean, staff friendly and rooms were perfect for a large family.  There is nothing not to love about this hotel.  I would def stay here than spend the $$$$ on Disney Resort.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel the last week of Jan. 2018 for our trip to Disneyland.  I don't normally write reviews, but felt that this hotel and staffed deserved accolades!  The front desk and valet staff were all very friendly and helpful.  Check-in and out were both quick and easy.  The hotel was beautiful and well maintained.  The kids enjoyed the water park, even if it was a bit chilly outside for the adults!  Our 8 year old daughter loved the robot that makes appearances in the lobby area, Pepper.  She even looked forward to interacting with it after a day at Disneyland!    We didn't eat on property, but did take advantage of the Starbucks coffee spot, so nice!  I came down one morning before heading to Disneyland Early Morning Entry to find there was no one manning the coffee
Manager Response: Thank you for filling us in about your recent stay! We're thrilled that you had such an incredible experience that you took the time to write this review. That means a lot to us! Your feedback is incredibly valuable and we will be sure to share it with our team.

Summary: We stayed in a number of hotels around the park and this is the first one we’ve stayed in twice. For hotels within walking distance to the park this is our favorite. It’s generally not as expensive as the Disney hotels but it is a step above and more expensive than most of the other hotels that are within easy walking distance to the park.   The rooms are well thought out for families visiting the park such as bunk beds two showers, place to eat in the room etc. The dining option in the hotel was a pretty good value for what you got and the hotel was easy walking distance to a number of nearby places to grab food as well. The hotel also has a grab and go nook to grab snacks and various beverages which was nice to have as an option in a rush.   Staff was very helpful and our
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had a wonderful stay in this hotel in late Jan /early Feb 2018. The staff were friendly and polite and went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. The rooms were spacious and modern and spotless (a must for me).  The onsite cafe / restsurant and marketplace were incredibly convenient on rushed Disney packed days. My view was of the highway which might not be considered great by some but, honestly, I don't ever holiday to stay in my room - I believe you can pay extra to upgrade to various views if that's a priority for you though.  The hotel location was fantastic and only a short stroll to the Disneyland entrance and both parks. Couldn't have been more happy with this stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave this rave review! We're thrilled you had such a wonderful experience with us. Please join us again soon for another magical stay.

Summary Heading: Wonderful family place for Disney trip with great staff
Summary: We arrived at 1am after a nightmare of delayed flights and lost baggage. The staff member at check-in (wish I knew his name - 1am on 5 Feb) was absolutely lovely and restored our faith in humanity. On hearing we had no luggage he stopped us buying supplies from the hotel shop and gave us toothbrushes, toothpaste and shaving supplies for free. The room itself was very spacious and with the extra bunk room perfect for a family of 4. Bathroom was huge with 2 showers in separate rooms. View over Disneyland superb. all staff we dealt with over the 2 days were just so lovely and helpful - I would recommend this place to any family looking for a perfect Disney experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Awesome location. Awesome hotel. Awesome staff- manager is outstanding and the gal that checked us in was very attentive and kind.  Would definitely stay here again. Beautiful view of Disneyland sunsets with Space Mountain from the deck.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this wonderful review with us! We're happy to hear our front desk staff and management lived out our commitment to providing exceptional guest services, and we appreciate you letting us know. We hope to have the opportunity to serve you again during a future visit to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great for Families headed to Disneyland
Summary: Amazing spacious rooms. Bunk beds and TWO showers a definite plus for a family. Pool was great, staff was super nice. Hotel is close to Disney. Pricey-but worth it if you plan to spend time in Hotel. Parking is pricey also- $20.00 a day (valet only option), but you can walk to Disneyland and not have to drive and pay Disney parking.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Lots of room, close to Disney and a great Waterpark
Summary: A perfect location for a family visit to Disneyland and California Adventure.....spacious room, great bathroom, excellent staff...and the waterpark as great for the youngsters to play and the slightly older relic (in the hot tub). Highly recommend
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this lovely review with us! We're delighted to hear you found our guest rooms spacious, our waterpark fun, and our location convenient for your recent visit to Disneyland. Should your travels bring you back to Anaheim, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel on the recommendation of family and really liked it. The rooms were large and spacious. The bathrooms were great for a family - two showers made morning prep easy and efficient. Front desk was kind and helpful. Location is fantastic - easy walk to Disneyland. We really appreciated their help accommodating a late departure on a day when they weren't busy. Didn't try out the waterpark as it was under construction, but not a problem for us. Had breakfast one morning and it was nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Still a great hotel for a Disneyland Visit!
Summary: We visited this hotel several years ago and I am very happy to report the standards on the hotel have not slipped at all.  When we arrived we were greeted promptly and helped with our bags.  I do wish that luggage carts were availabe for use without having go through the bellmen, but they were helpful none-the-less.  Registration staff were incredibly helpful and even made some suggestions for dinner.    The room was very comfortable with two queens and bunk beds.  Beds were incredibly comfortable and we slept like rocks every night.  The room was spacious with a nice table for the family and a decent-sized refrigerator.  Bathroom was plenty large with a full-sized shower stall as well as a tub/shower combo which made shower time so much easier.    The walk to the park was short
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this lovely review with us, Michael. We're happy to hear our staff took excellent care of you during your stay, and we appreciate your feedback about our luggage carts. We're delighted to know you found our rooms comfortable and our location convenient, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary: Great hotel, with great amenities. We had a room with 2 queen beds and set of bunk beds. Nice, clean and modern. Microwave in room. Plenty of storage space. Large bathroom. Had 2 baths. Well equipped gym and laundry. Loved the outside fire pit. Pool was closed for renovations.... Macdonalds up the road was closed for renovations. Excellent location. Great value.....
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: What a Great Place for Family!!
Summary: I'm a HUGE Marriott fan so I was excited to have the opportunity to use my points to stay at this hotel.  It is expensive but totally worth the points that I used to stay at this location.  It was a convenient walk to the park entrance.  It is located near Mimi's Cafe and Panera.  This was very helpful because it was not over priced like other potential restaurants in the area.  The waterpark at the hotel was a lot of fun for the kids and the pool was really great.    We stayed in the family suite that had a separate king bed room, a room with 2 bunk beds (4 twin beds) and a living area.  It was fantastic!  There were also TWO showers, double sinks.  It was incredibly perfect for our size family (2 adults, 3 kids under 8).  The "master bedroom" also had a balcony that we could
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us, Cynthia, and we appreciate the time you took to leave us this lovely review. We love knowing that your family found our guest rooms spacious and our location convenient, and we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.

Summary Heading: love the proximity to Disneyland, the water park, but prefer self-parking
Summary: we were pleasantly upgraded to a View Room! so nice - the kids loved looking out the window at the waterpark! Even though it was January, we were able to play in the waterpark for an hour before we left for home.   Suggestion: It'd be really great to have a shower outside to rinse off before we headed home since we had to check out of our room.   We totally enjoyed the short walk to Disneyland and enjoyed whipping by Panera for our Rapid Pick breakfast in a bag! But it'd be really nice to have a free breakfast option at the hotel as well. Many of the competitors on Harbor has a free breakfast of sorts. Even just a continental breakfast would be good, but I'm glad there's a Panera on our way out.   Overall, everything is almost perfect at this hotel except for PARKING! I really
Manager Response: none

Summary: I don't normally take time to write reviews, but the staff at the Courtyard Anaheim definitely went above and beyond to make our experience great.  The hotel itself is really fun, with a great waterpark for the kids, and really close to the Disney Parks, but it was the way the staff went out of their way to make our experience great that made me write this review.  All of the staff was super friendly, but one person in particular, the head of houskeeping Guieshermo (i'm probably spelling his name wrong) was awesome with our kids, and went out of his way to make them feel special one morning during breakfast.  You can go to a dozen different 'nice hotels', but it's that kind of service that makes me want to come back to this Marriott every time we come.
Manager Response: Brandon, this is what we strive for. We are so thrilled to read your review, and we are glad our team was able to make your stay special for you and your family. We'll be sure to pass along your kind words!

Summary Heading: Great family hotel, awesome service, close to Disneyland Park
Summary: Awesome hotel! Room accommodated my large family wonderfully with two queen beds, a couch, and two bunk beds that worked perfect for younger children. Room was spacious with a large entry way, updated and large bathroom, and a big enough closet for multiple suitcases. Excellent customer service who, when we arrived early and our room wasn't ready, offered to keep our bags in the back while we walked over to the park for the day. Staff was all very friendly and gave wonderful recommendations for nearby restaurants and tips about the park. Small snack bar in the lobby which was perfect for grabbing on-the-go snacks. No restaurant within hotel, but a nice mini bar is included in the lobby area as well. Hotel offers waterslides and a fun mini waterpark with a pool that the kids
Manager Response: Thank you for such a wonderful review, Natalie! We're thrilled you and your family enjoyed your time with us here, and found your room comfortable. We hope to welcome you back again in the future!

Summary: This is a great alternative resort to the Disney hotels. The water park is so much fun my daughter loved it. I liked I could lay  by the pool and still see her on all the water slides and splash area. The rooms are very nice we had the king with the bunk bed in the alcove on the corner, such a great setup. The hotel was clean and smelled great. Walking distance to park and places to eat. Will go back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel very family friendly close to everything they great service & facilities the staff where always helpful room was great, could easily walk to restaurants & Disneyland, Downtown Disney & California world wouldn’t change hotel next time
Manager Response: Thank you for such a kind, 5-star review, Craig! We're so happy to hear that you enjoyed your experience with us and we look forward to welcoming you back in the future. Thank you for your recommendation!

Summary Heading: Very Roomy and Close to Disneyland
Summary: The room we booked was corner King 1 bedroom suite with two bunk beds. We only used 1 but thought this will be great for family with more kids.  The two bunk beds are in a separate room (without a door),  A large sitting area has two tables, so roomy we are able to order carry out and had dinner in our room. I believe the room is 900 sqft.  The lobby area has a snack bar, they can fix simple food for you. and its 24/7. So you can take these early rise toddlers there for an early breakfast.  Its in walk distance to Disneyland, and a water park too. I am very happy with our choice. Only complain is I wish they had a restaurant on site
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the first place we arrived in the US, we made it to the hotel around 10:30 am gand we were checked straight in which we really appreciated having arrived from Australia. The staff were all very helpful, polite and friendly. The location to Disneyland was excellent and the hotel was clean with great pools and a gym. The only thing missing was a decent breakfast - starbucks was just very average and a bit disorganized.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing a review with us, Alexandra. We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay, and we appreciate your feedback regarding breakfast. We're happy to hear our staff took excellent care of you, and we hope to welcome you back the next time your travels bring you to our area.

Summary: We stayed at The Courtyard Marriott Theme Park for a week in January. There were 6 of us 2 adults and 4 boys ages 6 to 17. The water park was only open for one day as they were closing for maintenance. The boys used it on the day it was open. It would be great in the summertime and excellent for kids under 12. It’s an easy 7 minute walk to Disneyland and Downtown Disney. The room wash clean and comfortable. There are 2 laundry’s for your washing which comes in handy when traveling from afar. It’s also an easy destination to catch the Lux Bus from. Uber’Lyfts and taxis are also easy to get from this location. There are also plenty of restaurants within walking distance. I would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a great find.  Property is very close to Disney, 5 to 10 min walk.  Property was spotless, it had a very inviting feel.  Room is great, oversized and plenty of room.  Plenty of reviews have commented on the bathroom, big bathroom with 2 showers (one over bath and one stand alone).  There were lots of families around but didn’t notice any screaming, loud voices etc.  Definitely a consideration if visiting Disney!  Also a shout out to Lindsay on the front desk.  She was very helpful.
Manager Response: Thanks for the fantastic review! We're thrilled you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to take advantage of our great location. It's great to know Lindsay made your stay special as well! We hope to welcome you back on your next visit.

Summary: Loved the location of this accommodation so that you can go back and forward to Disneyland.  Plenty of meal options in the vicinity too.  Our room had plenty of space for the 4 of us and a great idea with the two showers.  We didn’t use the waterpark but that looked great.  Having an on-site coin laundry was extremely handy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel from 28 Dec - 2 Jan 2018 being a family of 2 adults and 3 children (17, 15 and 11).  From the moment we arrived we loved this hotel, our room was ready 3 hours early and the staff were so helpful and friendly.  The room was great, bunk beds and 2 queen size beds made it enough room for us all.  The double bathroom was great also.  The laundry facilities were fantastic .. 4 washing machines and 4 dryers. $2 per cycle  The kids swam in the pool and used the spa.  I used the gym which was well equipped and air-conditioned.  Starbucks in the foyer had great breakfast options as well as being open all day until late.  The gift shop was also well stocked.  The location was great ... 10 mins walk to the theme park gates.  Restaurants (McDonalds, PF Changs,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're thrilled that you loved our helpful staff, spacious guest rooms and countless amenities. We truly appreciate your kind words and we hope to welcome you back very soon!

Summary: This hotel is easy to find.  We were greeted immediately upon arrival by very friendly valet and front desk staff.  We were delighted to find that we were able to check into our room early and that our request to be near friends was also honored.  We had a gorgeous room that was overlooking Disneyland.  From our balcony we were able to see the Matterhorn, Space Mountain, and Guardians of the Galaxy.  We had a very spacious room with two queen beds and bunk beds!  We had ample space to put our belongings.  The bathroom makes this a great hotel room for families as it has two showers and two sinks.  We did not need to use all of it, but I can see how it could be greatly appreciated!  We expected to hear a lot of traffic outside but the hotel was so quiet.  I was very happy that we
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Courtyard was wonderful. It took us about 12-15 minutes to walk to the front gate of Disney.  There are several fast food restaurants around the hotel.  One night after Disney, we picked up McDonalds while walking back to the hotel and since the room had a nice little table/booth area, the kids were able to eat without making a mess, while watching their favorite shows on Netflix (which you can log into your account on the tv- great bonus).  The rooms were very spacious.  The kids really loved sleeping in the bunk beds and since there were plenty of wooden slats/guards built into the bunk beds the kids could not fall out of the bed (we let our four year old sleep on the top bunk).  You could fit a family of 6 in these rooms, although we were a family of 4.  We were able to
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location and outstanding service. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: We loved it. Spent a long weekend with family at Disneyland. Love the location, a short, half-mile walk to main gate with ART option, which we did not use. We LOVE the room layout for families: twin bunk bed, with two queens, could sleep 6. Bathroom provides two sinks, a tub/shower, then a separate shower toilet.  Very family friendly,allowing for more than one person to privately use the restroom at a time..  Kids loved the pool and water slides. We did not eat onsite or use the parking structure, but the valets were always friendly and attentive, housekeeping was fine, no complaints from us.  Love the new, fresh feeling of the hotel, would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this lovely review with us, Kimberly. We're delighted to hear you and your family found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable for your recent travels. We love knowing that your children enjoyed our water park, and we appreciate you letting us know. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with another five-star stay.

Summary: Stayed here shortly after the hotel opened up.  Very clean room and accommodating for families.  We had 2 Queen beds and bunk beds.  The kids loved the bunk beds and having 2 showers was awesome!  We were on a higher floor with an excellent view of the fireworks.  After a really long day, it was so great to be back in the room and lay on the bed and watch the show!  The walk is very quick to the front entrance of Disneyland, I would say no more then 10 minutes.  Very convenient.  The pool area was great and very accommodating for younger children.  If you have older children that want to play in the pool it's a bit of a let down as the actual pool itself is very small.  All in all, we would stay again if the price is right.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share a review with us. We're happy to hear you found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable and our location convenient for your recent visit to Disneyland. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a five-star stay in every way.

Summary: I have stayed at the Grand Californian and the Disneyland Hotel, both of which are Disney properties.  This time we took our daughter's family of 5 to Disneyland and decided to save a few bucks by staying at the Courtyard, Theme Park Entrance.  It advertises as being a little closer than it actually is, but a 10 to 15 minute walk will get you into the park.  We had two corner rooms.  Imagine how happy we were to see that not only did the rooms have a set of bunk beds for the kids, but the bunk bed area is totally separated from the main area.  No TVs where the bunk beds were, but for the little bit of time the kids could watch something their I pads provided the little early morning TV they needed allowing us to sleep until 7 AM.  Kids tend to wake early. The rooms are very
Manager Response: We can't thank you enough for this thorough review. We hope to welcome you again soon for another magical travel experience.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a week just after Christmas and had a fantastic stay.  The proximity to Disneyland can't be beat - about a 5 minute walk to the gates.  The room comes with 2 bunks, 2 queen beds, a large bathroom with a tub/shower, a walk in shower and 2 sinks.  The room has a microwave and refrigerator, lots of storage and lots of room for a family of 4 to spread out.  Restaurants likes McDonald's, Panera, IHop and Denny's are a quick walk down the street.  Our room was so quiet, the beds were great and it was very clean - our top 3 musts when we stay in a hotel.  Our room faced another hotel and we could hear the highway at times but if you're a light sleeper a set of earplugs will do.  The staff, both the valets and the inside hotel staff, were always friendly and
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review! We're thrilled our team made your stay special, and that you enjoyed our wonderful location. We look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.

Summary: Our family of five stayed for two nights from New Years Eve.  Our second time at Disneyland but first stay outside the resort.  I can't fault this property. Check-in was swift and staff friendly and helpful.  Our room was spacious and included two queens and bunk beds and two showers.  Short stroll to Disneyland and lots of eating options nearby. We didn't have time to use the swimming pool (which did look amazing!) or the fitness centre.  We ate at the Bistro the first night and the meals, whilst basic were great!  Starbucks coffee in the hotel is a bonus.  Would definitely recommend this hotel and if we are lucky enough to return to Disneyland will would stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: What an amazing hotel. So close to Disneyland, it was fantastic value for a family. We could go to Disneyland in the morning then head back for a swim and fun on the slides before returning to Disneyland in the evening.   The pool and slide area is extremely well thought out and I was highly impressed by the accessible features around the pool. Rooms were a good size and clean. The bunk beds probably only work well for kids under 10. We had a 15 year only who struggled to fit in well.   The only aspect that let it down for me was one of the staff members who was not that helpful. We were wanting to travel to the local outlets and all she could say was to take an Uber. After some research on our part, I found there was a local ART Anaheim Resort Transport system which the hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Amanda. We're delighted to hear you and your family found our location convenient for your recent visit to Disneyland, and we appreciate you letting us know. We're sorry to hear about our associate who did not provide the exceptional customer service on which we pride ourselves, and we will discuss this internally. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to provide you with a five-star stay in every way.

Summary Heading: Excellent sleep, service, stay and cleanliness.
Summary: When you have babies you think safety first.  From the arrival to the valet, friendly people to check in.  All rooms come with bunk beds ideal for families.  The room was impeccably clean. Even the restroom under the sink.  I let my toddler run around knowing the room was immaculate. The fridge came in handy along with the microwave.  The rooms are child safe, a huge plus.  The sheets were bleached and immaculate.  There is no room service but, there is a restaurant in the hotel with great options. We ordered to go and took it to our room.  Now, the best attraction is this mini waterpark located in the pool area.  This is any child’s dream. A great way to keep children entertained. The pools are heated and free towels provided.  This has got to be the best hotel in Anaheim near
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Well-appointed, clean, spacious rooms close to Disneyland's Entrance
Summary: We stayed 5 nights here, and enjoyed our stay very much.  The room we stayed in was clean, and boasted two queen beds, and two twin bunks.  The bathroom had double sinks, with two showers.  A door separated the toilet and one shower from the rest of the bathroom.  There was a mini-refrigerator, and a coffee maker.  The balcony was the perfect size.  The room we stayed in faced Disney, allowing us to watch the fireworks.  The lobby smelled faintly of gingerbread, as you walked in.The Christmas decorations were tasteful, not tacky. The gift shop had a wonderful selection of items.  The water park was a wonderful feature, that my boys didn't use as much as I anticipated; we were at Disneyland all waking hours.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friends recommended this hotel to us for our recent trip to Disneyland.  We were not disappointed.  It's in a great location, just a few minutes walk to the gates.  We could watch the nightly fireworks from our room.  The room itself was unique, clean and very functional for our group.  I would suggest this place is a terrific option to the much higher priced hotels on the Disneyland property.  We will be back.  If I had one criticism it would be in their waterpark where very young children (in diapers) are permitted in their hot tub.  I have never seen this before.  I don't believe it is healthy for such young children and I would never set foot in it for obvious reasons.
Manager Response: We can't thank you enough for sharing your feedback! We're thrilled you enjoyed your stay, from our location to our guest rooms. We truly appreciate your input and we hope to welcome you back very soon.

Summary: A friend had told me about this hotel years ago, so when it came to booking a hotel I chose it for the water park and convenience to Disneyland.   This is the nicest Courtyard I ever have stayed at. We were visiting the month of October so the hotel was decorated with Halloween class.  I loved that they didn't charge an arm and a leg for valet parking. They even allow you to leave your car until 1pm? on the day you check out. The walk from the hotel to the park is 1 mile.   The rooms are perfect for larger families. If you want to be able to see the fireworks from your room, request a room that overlooks the entrance. It's not a pretty view but you can see the fireworks from your balcony.   There are no restaurants in the hotel however you are surrounded by restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: First class service, great food, close to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel is very close to Disneyland, as well as a McDonald's and Panera bread restaurant.  You will definitely hear the Disney fireworks at night, because you are so close.  If you don't get a room with a firework view, they have a patio with a firepit where you can sit and watch the fireworks, and also order food and drinks!    Speaking of food and drinks, the Bistro was a very quick option for food at any time of day (open from 06:30 until quite late).  The food was great quality, Starbucks coffee, and lots of options for picky kids (breakfast cereal, yogurt, plain bagels, toast, bananas, strawberry smoothie, strawberries, Mimi's Cafe muffins & croissants, etc).    The service was outstanding.  They upgraded our room upon arrival just because; I didn't even ask.  Every time
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Exactly what I had hoped for!
Summary: My family of four just returned from a 6 night stay at the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance. It was just wonderful! Our room had a large balcony right on the second floor so we were right next to the water park. Even being so close we couldn’t hear any noise while the glass slider was shut. We had two queen beds and one bunk bed. Plenty of space for my husband, two young children and myself to stretch out. The stroller area near the front door is genius! The staff always wished us a good day and welcomed us back with smiles. The lobby smelled so good and was tastefully decorated for the holidays. My children loved the nutcrackers inside the main entrance and of course the huge teddy bear out front. It’s a short walk from the front door to the main Disney crosswalk. (maybe
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this lovely review! We're delighted to hear you had a wonderful time with us and found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable for your family. We're proud to have provided you with exceptional service, and we hope you'll stay with us again on your next visit to the area.

Summary: Have stayed here a couple times now and likely to stay many more.   The staff is super friendly and always quick to greet and help everyone.  Rooms are geared for families with 2 beds and then a bunk bed.   Rooms had a fridge and microwave and eating area.   Our room had view of the water park.  The kids love this hotel!   They have an awesome water park for children of all ages with a good amount of lounge chairs.  When they say it’s walking distance it really is.   Would say it’s about a 5-10 minute walk.   Disneyland is just across the street where you can even see the rides and fireworks show.  Also there are tons of restaurants within walking distance including a Mimi’s in the same parking lot.  They have a store and bistro in the hotel as well if you are too tired to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Number one hotel to stay at Disneyland!
Summary: Everyone in our extended family of eleven loved this hotel  Pros: 1. Spacious room with 2 Queens and a bunk bed for kids 2. 2 showers in the room for getting ready quickly after park time 3. Reasonable cost of breakfast item at the cafe in the lobby 4. AWESOME water park included for all hotel guests. The kids love it more than Disneyland, amazing! 5. Room to gate within 10 mins, even including pushing a stroller 6. Was able to rent a stroller last minute, thanks to helpful front desk staff 7. Kitchenette in-room for heating up leftovers and serving takeout food 8. Firework view every night, magical!  Cons: 1. Valet parking fee is a rip-off, given they only park your car right next to the hotel entrance  Despite the misgivings, would still go back if we ever visit Anaheim again.
Manager Response: We can't thank you enough for this wonderful review! We're thrilled to know that you enjoyed your time with us, including all of the hotel amenities and our great location. We appreciate your feedback regarding parking as well, and we hope to have the chance to welcome you on your next visit to Anaheim!

Summary: Stayed here with family kids age 3, 6 loved the pool and slides! The stay is super friendly and welcoming. Room clean and soundproof.  There is a place to eat if you need something. And Mimi's restaurant right across parking lot feet away. You can walk into Disneyland and California Adventure about a city block over. There is a McDonalds on the way to the park, Hotel is very nice and clean~  We would stay here again !  The other bonus is the hugging blow up bear for holiday time.   Note there is a laundry room for travelers.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel, very close to Disneyland, spacious rooms and very comfortable.  Waterpark is a bonus. Highly recommend and would stay there again upon a return visit. Should consider including a buffet breakfast, much easier when travelling with kids but overall it was at least convenient having a snack store to purchase items.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share a review with us. We're delighted to hear you found our location perfect for your recent visit to Disneyland! We love knowing that our spacious, comfortable rooms and waterpark were a delight for your family. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary Heading: Perfect stay for a family going to Disneyland
Summary: This is our first time staying at the Courtyard Anaheim for our Disneyland stay. The hotel was comfortable and clean. With 3 adults and 2 kids it made sleeping easy. There was 2 queen size beds and twin bunks beds. We loved the fact it had 2 showers as well. The room was clean,comfortable, spacious, and bright. The hotel was stunning and within walking distance to the park. The staff was friendly. The water park area was fun for the kids. There is dinning in and round the hotel. We will stay here again. We’ve stayed at the Disneyland Hotel and neighboring hotels before and this hotel beats them for price and spaciousness. Highly recommend!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Modern, nice, clean, and close enough to walk to Disneyland!
Summary: Lovely lobby, friendly staff and overall great impression. Hotel is located behind Mimi's cafe definitely close enough to walk to the park. The room was clean modern and nice. I liked that they offered Paul Mitchell. The two showers would have been great but it still was a little hard for modesty. One shower was with the toilet the other was in the vanity sink area all of which shares a common doorway. Loved having 2 queen beds and a bunk bed. Our room on the third floor was cleaned each day by about 4pm. The pool area was great for kids but adults get crowded out by the children. I wish at least the spa was adult only. I totally would stay here again. I think this place is a gem!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this fantastic review, Miranda! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time with us and we look forward to welcoming you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Save Yourself and Stay Anywhere Else
Summary: . I took my family to Disney Land which is supposed to the Happiest Place on Earth. Unfortunately, this is the location of the worst Courtyard Marriott on Earth. As soon as we checked in we were handed a piece of paper saying that the hot water would be down all of the follow day. Doesn't seem that bad except this is Disney Land and the kids get wet and hot and gross. I would have taken my business elsewhere to begin with had I know this but dropping it on me at check in is a pretty poor guest experience. Then we find out the parking is Valet only. That's fine when necessary but they are literally parking the cars 100 feet away in an on-site parking garage. No need to have mandatory valet as there isn't a parking problem. But they decided they could charge $20 a day for it so
Manager Response: Dear benham2017:  Thank you for your review of our hotel. I sincerely apologize that your guest experience did not meet your expectations.   I apologize for the plumbing issues on your arrival day. We attempted to contact all our guests in advance for whom we had contact information on file; unfortunately most bookings made from sources other than Marriott Reservations or Marriott.com disclose mailing or e-mail addresses so unfortunately we were unable to contact you in advance. I can certainly understand your disappointment upon your arrival. We did have a major problem with our boiler room and we were forced to act quickly to resolve it. We choose midday to complete the necessary repairs as we felt that is the time that would hopefully impact the fewest number of guests.  I truly regret the inconvenience which our problem caused you and your family.   We do have valet only parking which we fully disclose on our website and all of our travel partners are aware of. We also include this information in our confirmation email to ensure there are no hidden costs for our guest so I am sorry this information was not communicated properly at the time of booking.  Cellular service is provided by various carriers with varying performance levels. Our location near Disneyland poses problems due to the high volume and high density of cellular activity in the area.  Most of our guests switch their cellphones to Wi-Fi calling in order to overcome any cellular service deficiencies. We have a large amount of band width which automatically increases during high demand periods, and we have access points in each room, in each hallway and several throughout the lobby area. We also provide a help desk through our Wireless provider to assist guests who are having trouble connecting their devices to our Wi-Fi system. Guests’ personal devices may have trouble accessing a hotel’s Wi-Fi system based on settings, previous connections, and a host of other technical issues related to the personal devices. It is worth the time to contact a hotels Wi-Fi service provider when experiencing difficulties as the vast majority of connection issues are related to the devices and settings. Many of our internal hotel services rely on our Wi-Fi so we would know if we were having any issues and the system is monitored by our vendor at all times.   Our front desk agent should have assisted you in a courteous manner and facilitated a remedy for you; I sincerely apologize for his “glazed over eyes”. Our housekeeping department cleans rooms anytime between 9am and 5pm; we do our best to balance the competing needs of early arriving guests, late check out guests, guest who want to return mid-day for a nap or to use the pool. We do encourage our guests in our check-in pamphlet to let us know if they require their room to be cleaned by a certain time. I apologize that we did not meet your needs. The front desk staff should have explained that after 5pm we will be happy to provide limited service and informed housekeeping of your requested cleaning time request for future days.   I apologize that our staff was not able to assist in a more timely manner tracking down the computer that was left behind upon your departure and I certainly apologize that UPS was unable to ship the computer as requested.    It is our goal to have all of our guests feel extremely satisfied with their stay, and I truly apologize we fell short of our goal and did not meet your expectations.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Clean Hotel!
Summary: This hotel is located approximately 1/2 mile from the gates of Disney/California Adventureland.  We stayed here and just walked everywhere.  There are a bunch of restaurants all around - including a place called Garden Walk two city blocks away which had quite a few restaurants.  It was so easy to walk out the doors to get to and from Disney.  We arrived at 5 am, so of course, our room was not ready.  However, Patrick at the front desk did some thinking and was able to find us a room that was ready for us.  It wasn't the type we had reserved, but it was BETTER!!!  It was so nice to have a smiling and helpful person greet us at this awful time of day after flying all night.    The rooms here are roomy, clean and very comfortable.  There is a "Starbucks" here that also serves as a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Marriott Courtyard Theme Park Entrance Anaheim
Summary: Great Stay at the Marriott Courtyard Theme Park Entrance Anaheim. Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Couldn’t have possibly been any more convenient, just a short walk to Disneyland. Very clean, great waterslides, pool, spray park for the kids. Would definitely stay again, if we go back to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this review with us, Chris. We're delighted to hear our staff made your stay a pleasant one and that your family enjoyed not only our proximity to Disneyland but on onsite amenities as well. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary Heading: Perfect Family hotel for visiting Disneyland
Summary: This is a very popular hotel for families visiting Disneyland and for good reason. The rooms include bunk beds for the children, often in a separate 'room' which makes it super comfortable for sleeping after a long day on your feet at Disney.  The main entrance to Disney is less than a 10 minute walk, easy walk for young children and no problem for the stroller set. We arrived by car and the Bell Hops were helpful and welcoming. Well worth a few dollars to let them worry about your luggage. Reception was simple and the rooms were bright and clean. We were lucky enough to have a balcony which overlooked Disney and even luckier that it was fireworks night, perfect view! Make sure you fit in time for the children to enjoy the water-park right at the Hotel. It is included and is
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A wonderful hotel to stay in when visiting Disneyland
Summary: Our family of 4 adults and 2 young children had spent a couple of weeks in New York, and by the time we arrived in Anaheim we were looking forward to a day to chill out and also to be close to Disneyland, where we were spending the final two days of our holiday.  We could not have found a better hotel than the Courtyard Marriott.  We arrived there before check-in time, but we were able to store our luggage and head up to the waterpark which was loads of fun.   The staff are absolutely brilliant - so helpful and friendly.  When our rooms were ready and we walked in we were delighted...clean, spacious and our room had a view of the Disneyland Resort, which was great for watching the fireworks.   There are a lot of restaurants in and around Disneyland, but we just could not fault
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing this lovely review with us! We're delighted to learn that you enjoyed your stay with us and found our hotel comfortable and our staff friendly and helpful. We're also happy to hear you enjoyed your dining experience in our bistro. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary Heading: Excellent value for money, and clean.
Summary: We stayed here six nights and it was exceptional value. The rooms were spacious, the bedding very good, everything was CLEAN, and it was very quiet. We never seemed to have time to use the pool so I cannot comment on that. All the staff were very friendly and keen to make our stay perfect. The only reason I could not give a full five stars was that the restaurant seemed to be run more as a cafeteria, with minimal staff and few meal items that were not pre-packaged or pre-prepared. And it was all pretty much “American Comfort Food”. But there were other places local, or within delivery distance if you didn’t have a car, so there WERE choices. If I was coming back to Disneyland I would be staying here again. Kim W. Australia
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a must stay if your doing Disney in Anaheim. We just spent 6 nights here and the staff was great. The rooms were clean and spacious. Pluss they have 2 queen beds and bunks for plenty of sleeping room. The water park was great to my son spent hours in the park. Plus there was a bug hot tub for the adults to relaxe in the same area while watching the kids. Close to Disneyland walk back and forth. Overall if i was going back would the first place i would pick.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing this lovely review with us, Chris. We're delighted to hear you and your family enjoyed our hotel and found our guest room spacious and comfortable. We know how important comfort can be while traveling! We're also happy to know that your children enjoyed the waterpark. We look forward to welcoming you again on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed in a King Suite with the bunk beds and King bed in a bedroom.  It was AMAZING!!  There was so much room that we didn't feel cramped at all.  It was extremely clean (which would have been a deal breaker for me) and the location was hard to beat.  (Probably as close to the park gates as the Disneyland Hotel if you walk to the gates.)  We went to the pool/hot tub on average 1-2 times a day and it was great!  On our down day, we spent the majority of our day there!  We grabbed a coffee downstairs each day on our way to the park (which was only about a 5 min walk).  We didn't eat at the hotel because we have severe allergies, and we honestly felt safest eating in the park or in Downtown Disney, but there were lots of people who did eat at the hotel.  While we were there, we
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our first trip to Disneyland was wonderful and the hotel stay was no exception. We had called ahead and asked if we could check our bags and swim and relax after our flight and were told, yes, no problem. When we arrived, it was even better...our room was ready and we were able to check in right away with very friendly staff. A gentleman at the front desk also helped us get a quick orientation to the area with good places for quick snacks/delivery that was family friendly and affordable.  The room layout is wonderful with two showers (one tub), two king size beds (extremely comfortable!) and bunk beds, and a corner nook with a table and bench seat. Our room overlooked the water park/pool, but was surprisingly well insulated. For such a popular and crowded family hotel, it was
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share this lovely review with us. We're delighted to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay and found our guest rooms spacious and comfortable. We know how important comfort is while traveling! We can't wait to welcome you back in the future.

Summary: The Staff was so friendly. The room was well laid out, Plenty of room with 5 people staying in it. My kids enjoyed every evening in the pool and hot tub. The room had fridge, coffee maker, Safe and microwave.The beds are very comfortable, I had a great sleep. You can buy wine a beer in hotel and take it by the pool, Its a great way to relax after a long day a Disney. The only complaint I have would be that the tap in the shower is loose so it slides down towards the hot, as it moves down on its own the water gets hotter and hotter. I could not leave my kids alone in the shower because of this. It was annoying to keep adjusting it. Overall amazing hotel!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We chose the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park entrance because we loved the location, the water park, and the rooms seemed spacious and well equipped.  We were not disappointed, the hotel is fantastic, I highly recommend it.  Service is excellent, everything we needed, we got without issue.. we asked for a kettle so we could make oatmeal in the rooms before heading to the parks, no problem they brought it for us..the room also has a microwave and minifridge, and coffee maker.  The little market had milk for the kids, and in the mornings they cafe makes great bagels or yogurt parfaits..although there's lots of places to grab breakfast along the way to the park too.   We were pleasantly surprised with the bathroom having the tub/shower PLUS a full walkin shower.   The TV was equipped
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear you and your family enjoyed your time with us! It's very important to us to know that our team made your stay special, and we appreciate your feedback here. We hope to welcome you again on your next visit!

Summary: Great Hotel. Fairly new ( 2 years ) great for families. Each room has bunk beds for kids, and 2 showers 😃 Staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Close to Disneyland and California Adventure ( 5 min walk ). Would definitely recommend this hotel ❤️
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and was very pleased with everything. Location is great fir Disneyland and our room had view of the park just across the road. Rooms were spacious and well equipped. Nice bathroom with shower over bath and separate walk in shower. Decent breakfast available. Water park was great for kids. Friendly and helpful staff. Overall a great place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great room set-up for families - convenient enough
Summary: The hotel is a good 5-10 min walk to the entrance of Disneyland.  The hotel room we had was some type of suite that had a king bedroom in a separate room with a larger family area with bunk beds, a couch and table.  There was plenty of room for our family of 5 to spread out and lay out suitcases etc.  This was a great layout for that and also included a small fridge to store things.  Room was quiet, our room overlooked the pool area but there were a lot of people out swimming playing at 9pm and we could barely hear any noise so their insulation is great.  The walk wasn't as convenient as I thought it might be but there was a Panera, McDonalds and a few other quick convenience type places to grab food and snacks on the way to the park.  The hotel held our bags when we arrived
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for taking time out of your day to share your valuable feedback with us regarding your recent stay. It's wonderful to hear that you found our proximity perfect for your Disneyland vacation and our accommodations incredibly spacious and comfortable. We know how important comfort is while traveling! Thank you again, and we hope to welcome you back for a five-star experience in every way in the future.

Summary: We chose this hotel because of repeated good reviews on a Disneyland chat I follow.   We arrived well before check in, and there were no rooms ready. We had not really expected there to be, but asked and the hotel stored our luggage for us. We were impressed with the Halloween decorations.  We spent the afternoon at a science museum, and when we returned our room was ready.   The room was very spacious. A nice change for our family of five. Very clean as well.   We changed right away and headed for the water park. The kids LOVED it. Mom and Dad loved the abundance of chairs and umbrellas.   After swimming is where one of our favorite perks came in. The two showers allowed both of our daughters to shower at the same time, which saved us a bunch of time.  And at bedtime, so much
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this wonderful 5-star review, Fawnn! We appreciate you sharing your experience here, as well as your recommendation, and we look forward to welcoming you back again on your next visit.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel near Disney to stay with family
Summary: This hotel has everything a family traveling with children needs and it's right across the street from Disneyland.  Nice new clean rooms with lots of storage and space for everyone. We had a room facing Disney which was excellent. The balcony was a disappointment; it was tiny.  I imagined sitting on the balcony watching fireworks with my whole family when I reserved the Disney view with balcony room, but we could not all fit comfortably out there. Aside from that, the hotel was great.  Pool and waterslide area is perfect for young children.  Customer service was excellent the entire time we were here. We ordered food from the lobby more than once and it was great.  We never needed a rental car because it was a very short walk to the Disneyland front entrance.  I would recommend
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review, Stacy. We're delighted to hear you found our location convenient and that our staff had such a positive impact on your stay. We're also happy to know your children enjoyed our water park. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you again.

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the hotel Monday October 16th because of the very close walking distance to DL. Although we didn’t have kids with us, our standard room was plenty big enough for a family of 6. The room was spacious with 2 queen size beds, 2 bunk beds, a big closet area for storing suitcases, a seating area for eating, a small fridge and a microwave.  The room seemed brand new and very clean. I was most impressed with the bathroom that had 2 showers! The hotel really did a great job of decorating for Halloween too. I was oohing and awwing like a kid! There was a place in the lobby to by drinks and snacks too. The pool area was geared more towards children, but we adults managed to cool off and go down the waterslides anyway.  We plan to say here for any future DL
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check in: 9 September 2017 Check Out: 10 September 2017  Stay at this hotel only for 1 night, We wish we can stay longer.  Very nice hotel, Room have a nice size. Bunk bed for kids. Stay here for our wedding anniversary, the hotel gave us a Chocolate & Wine. Our room was facing the waterpark.  Pro: Staff really helpful and professional.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location and outstanding service. We especially love hearing that staff left such a positive impact on your anniversary experience. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: This is a newer hotel within 5 minutes walking distance from Disneyland. Great sized room with 2 queen sized beds and a bunk. Bathroom facilities included two wash basins, a bath, toilet and also another shower. Enough space that you didn't feel cramped - ideal for a family vacation. Giftware store and general store on site and a cafe for breakfast to eat there or take away before the park. Numerous cafes / restaurants on the way to the park that you pass to stop at for all meals coming and going from Disney. When the weather gets too hot or you need a break they also have a great patrolled water park suitable for all ages. Friendly staff, clean and ideal location. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was recommended to us by our travel agent for it's location and rooms for families. As a family of five we find we often have to book two rooms when we travel anywhere, as many hotels only allow 4 people per room. These rooms were exceptional, we had plenty of room, two showers and they were large enough for all of us.  We found the rooms to be exceptionally clean, beyond any standard I've seen in a hotel. Nobody takes shortcuts here, they offer their guests such great service. The staff were friendly and very helpful, they did everything so well. I can honestly say that this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in. I think it would be because they don't try to do everything, but what they do is done so well.  The food in the downstairs area is reasonably priced and
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us, Claire! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location and outstanding service. We especially love hearing that our staff left such a positive impact on your Disneyland experience. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back in the future.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families visiting Disneyland
Summary: After a transatlantic journey and several hours queuing  to get through border control at LAX, we were delighted to find that we'd been upgraded upon our arrival. Our  family room was excellent, with 2 double beds, bunks, 2 showers, and a 'fireworks' view.  The water park was a big hit with the children- though the pool is small, there is a sizable splash park and a couple of waterslides, all overseen by very vigilant lifeguards.The hotel is a few minutes walk from the entrance to the theme parks, making it easy to pop back during the day to cool down when the parks get very busy and hot.  Hotel staff were all friendly and helpful.  The only downside to the hotel was the breakfast arrangements- at this price breakfast is usually included in my experience, and though a limited
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We're delighted to hear that we were able to make your early travel troubles a little less frustrating. We're always happy to hear when families have enjoyed our convenient location and on-site waterpark. We appreciate your feedback regarding our breakfast offerings. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you again.

Summary Heading: New option close to the parks
Summary: Marriott has added this option next door to its Fairfield in hotel. It is more expensive but offers classic Marriott service at a newer and upscale facility. Staff is friendly and rooms are large. They can accomodate up to six people in the two large bed and two bunk beds (loved the detail). There are two showers too and plenty of space to place you lugagge and belongings, there is even a diner style corner where to sit and work or eat. Coffee maker and small fridge and a safe are also in the room. In the second floor there is a mini waterpark great for kids. It is a valet parking only hotel witha USD 20 charge per day.  The bonus of this hotel (or its sister next door) it is that you are a 5 minute walk from the parks.
Manager Response: We're so happy to hear you had a great experience during your stay with us, Karim! Thanks for sharing this review!

Summary: /We stayed as a family of 6 from 9/30/17 0 10/8/17. Overall the hotel was great for our needs but we had some experiences that also were pretty disappointing.   Pros:  The staff, they must be a great place to work for because everyone we encountered was very nice and friendly.   The water park, the kids had a great time with the waterslides and play area.   Rooms, they are set up nicely, they make great use of the space and had more than enough room for all of our luggage and clothes.   The cons:  The elevators, there are only two for the hotel. Sometimes you had to wait up to 10 minutes to get on.   The filter in the pool, I got my toe stuck in one but was able to free it without injury. The only reason though is because another member of our party got his toe stuck and ended
Manager Response: Dear Melissa98563:  Thank you for staying with us and thank you for your review. I am glad that you enjoyed our staff, waterpark, and room layout. I sincerely apologize that your stay was not 100% trouble free and thank you for reporting these issues to us so that we can improve our service and amenities. Marriott has 30 hotel brands in its collection which range from luxury hotels such as the Ritz Carlton to economy hotels such as the Fairfield Inns. As part of Marriott's "select services" hotel brands, Courtyard by Marriott hotels do not offer room service, you may prefer our full service hotels such as J.W. Marriott, Marriott hotels and resorts, Renaissance Hotels and others which do offer room service. Our pool temperatures and chemical levels are computer controlled and maintained for our guests safety. Please contact me if I can be of additional assistance to you.

Summary: As a Lifetime Platinum Member, I have stayed at many Courtyards - this is no typical Courtyard! Bunk beds are perfect for kids, spacious room, separate shower and tub. Our kids loved the pool because there are so many things to play with! Mimi's, McDonald's, and Panera in the parking lot, with a short walk to Disney. The staff was VERY friendly, and helpful.   Do your Disney shopping at the gift shop - much cheaper prices! And the Halloween decorations added a really cool holiday touch. (Can't wait to see what they do for Christmas!)
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a fantastic stay at this hotel. Arriving late at night it was fantastic to see all the Halloween decorations. We were quickly welcomed to the hotel and made our way to bed. The room size was generous as was the bathroom. We spent many days at the parks and were always welcomed back with a smile. The market was fantastic for grabbing a drink or snack and items were very reasonably priced. Our son loved the pool and water park and forbid adults it was a great place to relax tired feet and legs. The pool area felt busy at times with more kids than adults (possibly not being supervised?) But we were always able to find a place to sit or relax in the water. The beds were really comfortable and we would wake refreshed in the morning ready to tackle another day of walking. We
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your review with us! We're thrilled that you loved our spacious guest rooms, convenient location and outstanding service. We especially love hearing that your son loved our water park. Thank you again for your valuable feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: This is in a fantastic location and we arrived just before halloween. The hotel was well decorated and is in good condition. The waterpark was a hit with our 2 kids and having it on site was such a good way to have a rest from Disney. Is also in a good location for food. The room was good and despite being on the same level as the waterpark (we opened the balcony to the waterpark) the glass glazing was great and we did not hear the kids. The bunk bed had good safety (a railing) and our 5 yo slept there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Completely exceeded all expectations! Can't say enough about the customer service, so friendly and helpful.  Decided to get a rental car our second day, staff arranged and had it delivered to the hotel for us!  We are a family of 6, 5 adults and 1 child.  The room was  spacious with 2 queen beds and a set of bunk beds, also 2 showers.  Plenty of room for all of us!  Unwinding at the water park after a full day at Disneyland was so much fun for our whole family!  Great location, close to the entrance of Disneyland. I would absolutely recommend staying here, and plan to again in the future. Thank you to the Courtyard Marriott for a truly outstanding and memorable experience!
Manager Response: Angel, we are delighted to hear that you had such a marvelous Disneyland experience and that it included staying with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed our spacious guest rooms and convenient location and that our staff was able to provide you with the kind of five-star customer service we pride ourselves on delivering. Should your travels bring you back to the area, we hope to have the opportunity to serve you once more.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for Disney visit for families
Summary: Could not have been happier, big room to fit a family of 5, stayed in the King corner room and kids had their own bunk bed room, lounge area with a small table was great also. The water park was perfect as it was hot so we came back between 3-5pm each day for a rest and swim, kids loved the water slides and small pool. You are at the gates of Disney within 5 minutes and walk past McDonald's and Panera Bread on the way if you need a snack. The staff were super friendly and helpful, I have stayed at a few other hotels on Sth harbour and this is the best! Highly recommend.
Manager Response: none

Summary: OK.. Where to start...  Positives....  Staff are super friendly and always happy to see you!!!!  My son was very jet lagged and had vomited all thru his bed.. Went and seen reception to buy some laundry cleaner and get fresh bedding and was told not to worry she would get someone to come help..
