Large waterpark onsite with all kinds of water gadgets, slides and several pools, along with large hot tub. Lots of loungers and umbrellas. Valet service great - had our luggage stored on day we left while afternoon spent at Downtown Disney. This hotel
Manager Response: We truly appreciate you taking the time to review your excellent stay with us! It pleases us to hear that our team exceeded your expectations and that you found our location to be in close proximity to all of your needs. Should you return to Anaheim, we truly look forward to welcoming you back for another seamless experience.

Summary: We stayed here on our last night in Disneyland.  We were at the Grand Californian for 4 nights beforehand.  We checked in around 1:00 and our room was ready!  Everyone from valet to bell hop was great!  Very smooth check.  My family of 5 was at the pool within 30 minutes of pulling into this hotel.  The pool is great, especially for kids 10 and under.  Great splash area and waterslides, but the actual pool is only 8x10 and 3 feet deep, so small.  Hotel is a 10 minute walk to the parks, which is great!  I paid $300 more per night at the Grand Californian and was only about 5 minutes closer to Disneyland.  The only reason I am giving this place 4 instead of 5 is the following....no pool bar/snack area and lack of competency by pool staff. You have to go to the main floor and
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! We're delighted to hear that you had a seamless check-in and that your family had an opportunity to enjoy our pool. We truly appreciate your feedback regarding the lifeguards and we will gladly pass it along to our team. We truly look forward to welcoming you back for another excellent experience in Anaheim.

Summary: What a wonderful place to stay!  We were greeted at the door upon check in, the kids were given balloons, and the staff immediately offered to store our luggage until the room was ready for us. The rooms were beautiful, and the kids loved the water park- it was a great place to take a rest mid-day after a busy morning at Disneyland.  The hotel is a very short walk to the Disneyland entrance, and there are lots of restaurants close by. We could even see the Disney fireworks from our room!  There is also a cafe on site, and a nice gift shop.  Mimi's is right outside of the hotel, and we had a wonderful breakfast there.  If you are looking for a great family-friendly hotel within walking distance of Disney, this is the hotel for you!
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent review, Emily! We're overjoyed to hear that you were greeted at the door with smiling faces and that you and your family had the opportunity to enjoy our water park. We can't wait to welcome you back to Anaheim for another magical stay in the very near future.

Summary: My husband is a Marriott rewards member and travels often so when we travel as a family we almost always stay at a Marriott property. That being said I have seen my fair share of Marriott properties and THIS one is hands down my absolute favorite family friendly Marriott! (If Marriott reads this, please make more properties like this one.) The rooms and bathrooms were SO clean, the sheets crisp and the pillows comfortable. My kids were over the moon excited about the bunk beds and I was beyond thrilled to have two showers in the same bathroom. Well done Marriott!  Now not only was the actual property impressive but the staff was the icing on the cake. I did not encounter a single unpleasant staff member our whole stay. And the MVP for this courtyard was Katie! She was incredibly
Manager Response: We are absolutely thrilled to read this fantastic 5-star review! We greatly appreciate you taking the time to leave this feedback and share your wonderful experience at our hotel. We're glad that our amenities and service have set the bar and we'll certainly pass these kind words along to Katie. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Kids did not want to leave the hotel! Not even for Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed here last April for our daughter's birthday trip to Disneyland and let's just say, she did not want to leave the hotel. She definitely enjoyed the waterpark, and we are looking forward to our stay next month. Awesome customer service and hotel was clean. Only thing is that I wish parking was free or atleast a bit cheaper.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for this wonderful 5-star review. We're thrilled we'll have the opportunity to host you again next month and that your daughter will be able to enjoy more valuable waterpark time! We appreciate your feedback regarding parking as well.

Summary Heading: Brilliant water park, walking to Disney
Summary: Newly opened hotel only 10 minute walk from Disney gates. (It did feel a long way in hot weather but hard to be closer without staying at grand Californian for double the price!)  Large rooms with bunks for kids.   Space to eat in rooms with a few good take away places near by (pizza especially). In house meals disappointing and over priced (just skip them; get take away).   Outstanding water park. Kids loved it in the afternoon. And still can wander back to Disney at night.   Full marks given good price, location and new. (Will it still be the same in a few years?)
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing this wonderful 5-star review! We're thrilled you and your family were able to enjoy your experience at our hotel and take advantage of our waterpark as well as our great location. We appreciate your feedback regarding the hotel dining as well and hope we have the opportunity to welcome you back in future.

Summary: We stayed here on our visit to Disneyland and we're not disappointed with our choice. It was within very easy walking distance to the park and many restaurants. The staff were fantastic and the rooms impeccable. Beds/ pillows were comfortable and the room had a microwave which is a rarity I have found. The rooms were also very quiet, which is important after spending all day at Disneyland. I would defiantly recommend this Hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review! We're so thrilled to hear that you loved your Disneyland getaway with us. From our location to our staff, it sounds like you truly enjoyed it all. We understand that a little peace a quiet after a day in the parks can be much needed! We appreciate all of your feedback and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: My family stayed at the Courtyard Theme Park Entrance for three nights while going to Disney.  We got there the first day and just went to the water park.  Was great way for my daughters to get out some energy after traveling all day.  First, the people who work at the Courtyard are always smiling and nice.  Second, our room was huge and updated (pictures attached).  We ate breakfast every morning and two dinners at the hotel.  Food was great and staff couldn't have been nicer.  Again, this is the best Courtyard we have ever been to.
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous review! We're so glad you enjoyed your visit - from our prime location and cozy accommodations to our delicious food and welcoming staff, it sounds like your stay was truly special. We appreciate you sharing your feedback and hope to welcome you again soon for another seamless experience!

Summary: It was a little confusing to have two Courtyard properties on the same street, but I should have checked the navigation more closely before starting the drive! This hotel was absolutely perfect for our quick Disneyland getaway. We were able to walk from the hotel to the park entrance very quickly and easily. Our two kids LOVED the room so much. They could not get enough of the bunk beds and were giddy to be able to eat dinner in the little dining space. They wanted to eat all their meals there. It was also nice to have two separate showers in the room. The adults loved being able to pop downstairs to buy wine and beer to cap off our evenings! My only complaint was that it was too cold for us to enjoy the water park, but we will be back for sure to take advantage during warmer
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your Disneyland getaway with us! From our convenience to the parks to our bunk beds, it sounds like our property was just what your family needed. We love hearing that! Thank you for all of your feedback and we're looking forward to your next visit.

Summary: We've previously stayed at Paradise Pier and the Grand Californian and this place definitely beats both in my opinion, way nicer and closer to parks than Paradise Pier and much less expensive than Grand Californian. We had a Water park View Room that looked out over the water park and straight over to the top of Space Mountain across the street. The park was only a 5-10 minute walk away. The rooms were large and clean and we loved that there were 2 Queens and a set of bunk beds to fit our family of 6. The weather wasn't great when we were there so we only got to enjoy the water park for a few hours once but it was a lot of fun and my kids loved it. All around a great place to stay near Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay! It's so wonderful to hear that you found our hotel to be perfect for your Anaheim travels. From our location to our water park, it sounds like you loved it all. Fun is important on vacation! We hope to welcome you back very soon.

Summary: Great spot, right across from the park!.  Rooms were spacious and nicely appointed.  Staff were terrific and very accommodating to any/ all requests. If you were looking for a good spot to stay in while doing Disney- this is it!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous review, Tim. I'm happy to hear you enjoyed our convenient location as well as our staff and service. I hope you'll return again soon for another brilliant stay.

Summary Heading: Very Good Hotel Next To Disneyland East Entrance
Summary: I wanted to take my daughter to Disneyland very early in the morning, so searched for a close Marriott.  Was very surprised to see this property, and was even more surprised to see that it had a waterpark (for kids).  This Marriott did not disappoint:  first, it's conveniently located across the street from the main entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure, so a 10-minute walk is about all it takes.  Second, valet parking only is offered, but your car is in a safe parking structure.  The $20 daily valet charge is much better than Disneyland's parking because you would invariably end up taking a shuttle from the parking lot, as opposed to an easy 10-minute walk.  And last but not least, this Courtyard is nicely appointed with two full size beds AND a bunkbed, mini fridge,
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to leave a review. I'm happy to hear your daughter enjoyed her magical visit and that you enjoyed our convenient location. I hope to welcome you again soon for another brilliant stay.

Summary: Arrived afternoon and our room was ready. Hangout at the pool for the afternoon.  Then hit Disney for the next 3 days. Close walk to the park. Lots of restaurants on the way to the park. Try pizza press for dinner. The hotel was clean and modern.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your Disneyland vacation with us! We're so glad you enjoyed your stay from our pool area to our location. We appreciate all of your generous feedback and we hope to see you back soon!

Summary: Great stay with awesome accommodations. The rooms are spacious for a week long stay in Anaheim. Directly across the street from Disney and easily accessable. The Mimi's next door is awesome and makes your dining needs very easy.
Manager Response: Thank you for your glowing review, Dennis! We're happy to hear you enjoyed our convenient location and hope to welcome you again soon.

Summary: This place is amazing and only about a 5 minute walk away from the parks! The staff is so friendly, they make you feel at home. It's VERY family friendly and despite us having a view of the freeway, we were still able to see the fireworks! I would HIGHLY recommend this place for everyone to stay at!
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous review! We couldn't be happier to hear that you loved our convenient location, friendly staff and family-friendly property. We're so glad you could enjoy the fireworks from your room as well! Thank you again and we hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: They Made Our Disney Experience That Much Better!
Summary: From the friendly valet staff to the helpful front desk, checking in and out was simpleaking and fast. The staff made us feel so welcome and special. We were taking a Disney trip for my youngest son's fifth birthday. Even though most who stay here probably have similar stories, the staff were kind and engaging to all of my kids, as well as appearing excited with my five year old as it was his birthday and his first time at Disneyland. It was refreshing.  The rooms are awesome. We had two queen beds and a bunk bed, with a balcony facing Disneyland Park, so we got to watch the fireworks from the room. The two showers made it extra nice, as we had 6 staying in the room. Cleaning staff did a fabulous job. I couldn't even think of one negative thing to say about the rooms if I tried.
Manager Response: I truly appreciate your excellent 5-star review! I'm pleased to hear that our team went above and beyond to exceed your expectations and that you had the opportunity to enjoy the pool as well as our various amenities. Should you return to Anaheim, I truly look forward to welcmonig you back for another seamless visit.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with kids
Summary: We stayed at this hotel in February 2017 with our 2 children. The kids loved the water park and it was a great way for them to spend their days off from Disneyland. The rooms are nicely finished and a very good size. We liked the fact there there was a bath tub for the kids and a separate shower for the adults. The room was very clean and nicely decorated. My daughter opened the bathroom door on our first day there and the corner of the door sliced her toe open. My husband went to the front desk to ask for some band-aids and he was directed to purchase his own at the gift shop. Two of the ladies that worked at the front desk were generally unfriendly but the rest of the staff were nice and helpful. The larger pool and large water slides had heated water but the kids play area
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent visit to Disneyland! I'm thrilled you and your family loved the water park and well-equipped guest rooms. I'm sorry to hear about your daughter's toe and the service you experienced. I assure you this is not the level of helpful service we strive to provide and I'll be sure to address your concerns internally. I hope to welcome you back again soon for a seamless stay.

Summary: This hotel was great! Nice, clean, very comfy beds (more plush), and my kids loved the bunk beds. The bathroom in the room was awesome! Double sinks, a tub/shower combo AND an additional shower! We stayed in a standard double queen room. All the employees were very friendly (front desk, valet, housekeeping). We only stayed one night. We went to Disney the day of check out and we're able to leave our car with valet all day, just paid an extra $20. We did not use the water park or eat here. We had breakfast at Panera (2min walk). Disney was just about a 10min walk to security but we had a 5 yr old and 3 yr old with us which of course slowed us down a bit. I only have two complaints: 1. Our room was on the 6th floor which was great BUT we were on the freeway side. We had a sound
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay! I love hearing how much you enjoyed our comfortable accommodations, friendly staff and ideal location in relation to Disneyland. I'm sorry to hear about the noise you experienced and I appreciate your feedback. I hope to welcome you back for a five-star stay in the future!

Summary Heading: New Hotel Nearby Disneyland and Resteurants
Summary: New Hotel with outdoor water park. 15 mins walking to Disney Land and the shops nearby.  I like this hotel with very good services. Big rooms with two showers. You can see Disney Land fireworks at nights from your room. Restaurants are walking distance around 10-15 mins. Cleaning services are very good. The Parking fees is little expensive.
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous review! I'm thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your spacious rooms and our close proximity to Disneyland. While I'm pleased to have hosted you, I'm disappointed to hear that you were not fond of our parking prices, as we do our best to keep our prices competitive with our surrounding area. Should you return to Anaheim, I truly hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back for another seamless stay!

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights.  There were 4 of us. We were upgraded to a corner room and had a beautiful view of the waterpark.  One night we were able to see the fireworks from our room.  It was great. Our room had bunk beds and two queens.  The kids loved it.  We could see the Matterhorn from our room.  So cool!   It had the cutest little nook with a table and booth.  We had breakfast there each morning.    Staff was super sweet, friendly and helpful.   The reason I did not give them 5 stars was: 1) the Bistro downstairs food option was sold out of many items on their menu.  The food was passable.  Actually breakfast items were slightly better than dinner or all day dining.  You were able to charge to your room which was nice.  Honestly the food wasn't that great.  Plus it's
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! While I'm pleased to have hosted you, I'm disappointed to hear that the Bistro was not fully stocked during your visit and that you were not fond of our gift shop prices. I appreciate your feedback and will gladly pass it along to our team. Should you return to Anaheim, I truly look forward to welcoming you back for a seamless stay.

Summary: We always have such a great experience at this hotel! My kids love the bunk beds and everyone is happy with the room.. The bathroom is always clean and most of the guests are pretty quiet during our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! I'm delighted to hear that you had a great experience and that your children enjoyed the bunk beds. I truly look forward to welcoming you back for another 5-star experience.

Summary: My mother 71, nephew/godson 11 and myself 43 stayed for six nights, from the very moment we stepped inside, to the day we left, we could not fault any person that worked at the hotel, they went out of their way to make sure we had an enjoyable holiday from start to finish and when my mother had to claim insurance, they made the task of dealing long distance in another country to get the paperwork sorted, thank you.  The location to Disneyland was the best, a short walk to the main entrance, eating establishments to enjoy on the way home, or if we had a 7 hour day at the parks, the bistro had tasty food to pick up and have in our room.  Our room became our haven after a big day at the parks, beds were super comfortable and bathroom catered for the three of us perfectly, nice and
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know about your recent stay! We love hearing that from the moment you entered our hotel, you felt welcomed and at home. It's great that you found our location so ideal for a Disneyland getaway. We hope to see you again very soon!

Summary Heading: Thanks for wasting a day of my life!
Summary: Three days and now six hours of work later, I'm still trying to rectify billing for this stay.  Something fishy happened.  My reservation was changed during my stay (I didn't know this was possible) creating a fiasco I'm still trying to dig out of.    I was unable to checkout prior to physically leaving the hotel (the first time in over a hundred hotel stays).  The front desk was unable to give me a folio/zero balance after ten minutes of trying.  He reswiped my card saying it wasn't in the system (it was) and eventually gave up.  As I had a plane to catch and there was no other staff there, I left.  I returned home yesterday to find that my reservation had been changed, points misapplied, and a large hold had been placed on my credit card.  I was able to get Marriott to
Manager Response: Dear GuyInFargo123:  Thank you for choosing our hotel for your recent visit to the Disneyland Resort area and thank you for your review. I am pleased that we, along with the Marriott Rewards Help Desk, were able to sort out the confusion associated with your free night redemption stays. I also appreciate corresponding with you by e-mail and am glad that I was able to explain the difference between a credit card hold, which hotels apply at the beginning of a guest's stay, and an actual charge to a credit card account which is processed at checkout. I am happy that your last e-mail to me concluded with you stating that my explanation makes sense, that you appreciated our attention to this matter, and that you were glad that the situation was resolved. Please contact me if I can be of additional assistance to you. Best regards, Bill

Summary Heading: Very good resort and close to main gate.
Summary: My wife, mother-in-law and two children 3 & 5 stayed at this resort in November of 2016.  We really enjoyed this resort.  Our kids liked the water park.  Room was great.  Clean and nice size.  Liked the bistro, very convenient and reasonably priced.  Mimi's cafe was just outside the hotel doors.  McDonald's just steps further.  The resort is pricier than others in the area but felt it was worth it.  Staff was very friendly.
Manager Response: I truly appreciate your excellent review, John! I'm delighted to hear that your family had a seamless experience during your stay. Should you return to Anaheim, I'm looking forward to welcoming you back for another magical visit with us.

Summary: This is the fourth hotel we've stayed out while visiting Disneyland and it's the first one we would stay at again without hesitation. With a family of five their rooms with two queens and bunk beds were a perfect combination, along with the extra room in the entry area for shoes and car seats, fridge and microwave and the seating area where the kids ate their breakfast we bought from Panera (which is next door). We bought coffee in the hotel cafe downstairs every morning as well on the way to walking to the park. The hotel is less than two years old and still is in great shape. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and I often observed staff pro actively addressing issues that they noticed or were brought to their attention. The nightly rates were not as cheap as the
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent 5-star review! I'm delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay while visiting Disneyland with your family. Your kind comments are truly appreciated. I  look forward to welcoming you back again in the near future.

Summary: Great location, 5 mins walk to Disneyland entrance. Fantastic size family rooms with bonus double sink vanity and two showers. Spacious and airy. We had great views of water park. Hotel has great advantage spots to watch the fireworks. The hotel is immaculate with family friendly staff. Highly recommended accommodation. Close to restaurants. Great beef burgers and buffalo wings from The Bistro (in house restaurant). Fair prices. Not too keen on the coffee, baristas need more training! Buy bottled water from hotel or anywhere outside Disneyland, cos a 750ml bottle of H2o cost me $4 USD. Outside prices about $1.80 USD. Enjoy!
Manager Response: Thank you for your excellent review! I'm thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, and that our location was convenient to all of your needs. Should you return to Anaheim, i look forward to welcoming you back for another 5-star stay.

Summary: It was a little expensive for two people but other than that, I have no complaints. I am super picky about cleanliness, and it was very clean. It was definitely within walking distance to the park- we did not need a car (I wouldn't have wanted to pay the extra parking fee, anyway).
Manager Response: I truly appreciate your excellent review! I'm pleased to hear that the cleanliness of your room exceeded your expectations and I truly look forward to welcoming you back for another seamless visit in the near future.

Summary: The staff was friendly, accommodating and the rooms were large, modern and beautiful.  I loved the bunk beds and two showers.  The kids loved the mini waterpark and we all loved how close it was to Disneyland.  The only downer was the expensive on-site parking but this wouldn't deter me from staying here again.
Manager Response: I truly appreciate your generous 5-star review! I'm pleased to hear that our team went above and beyond to exceed your expectations and that your family truly enjoyed the waterpark and our close proximity to Disneyland. I hope to welcome you back again, soon.

Summary: Things I love about this hotel (not in order): 1. Waterpark (kids like it more than disneyland) 2. Huge bathroom with 2 showers.  3. Bunk beds.  4. Staff is so nice and helpful.  5. SO close to disneyland.  6. Fridge/coffee maker/microwave  7. Rooms are big and clean This hotel is fabulous.  *one suggestion I have is to put sugar/sweetener/etc in their own separate containers rather than the combo packs. It's so wasteful to open those packs up for one item and then have to throw the other items away.
Manager Response: What an excellent review, Nikki! I sincerely appreciate your kind comments and will pass them along to the team. Should you return to Anaheim, I'm looking forward to providing you with another seamless stay.

Summary Heading: Beautiful, spacious, kid friendly hotel close to park
Summary: Stayed for 4 days. Pros: Short walk to Disneyland. Need to cross one street at traffic light 0.5 blocks from hotel. Very spacious. Large room in our room with two queen and a bunk bed. Large hotel foyer entryway with multiple games for kids, TV's, computers, etc. Two large water park slides and one small water park slide. Plus regular pool, wading pool, and jacuzzi. All heated so despite cool temps kids had lots of fun. Open from 10a to 10p. Decent gym which is open 24/7. Everything appears to be new quality.  Cons: No gluten free menu or allergen menu. No breakfast room service.  Other: Valet parking only which was $20/day.  Overall would stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review, Paul! I'm delighted to hear that you enjoyed our close proximity to Disneyland and that your family enjoyed the queen bed and bunk beds. I appreciate your feedback about our menu, and will gladly pass it along to our team. I truly look forward to welcoming you back for another excellent stay in Anaheim.

Summary: Very nice newish hotel. It comes with several amenities: pool, gym and waterpark! There is also a Starbucks which is connected to their Bistro. We were able to have hot breakfasts each morning before heading out for the day.  With 2 young ones (2 and 4) there was enough room for the 6 of us. There were 2 queen beds (which were in a separate room) and a bunk bed. The washroom was spacious with both a shower and bathtub. 5 minute walk to Disneyland which is great; especially at night when everyone is tired. The room was quite spacious for 6 people and very clean. Housekeeping did a great job each day providing us with the extra necessities we required. Service was quick and pleasant. We would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! I'm delighted to hear that you had the opportunity to enjoy the waterpark, gym, and pool, as well as our Starbucks. I truly look forward to welcoming you and your family back for another magical stay in the near future.

Summary: One of the best places we have stayed in Anaheim.  Great rooms and great waterpark.  5 min walk to main gate and a McDonalds on the way for those like us with kids and a Mimi's Cafe on the property.  The bistro in the hotel was really good too.  We had a family room and the bunk beds were great.  Fireworks from the patio was awesome too.  Will be back for sure.
Manager Response: I'm delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us, Dustin! I truly look forward to exceeding your expectations again in the near future.

Summary: Finally a hotel that can accommodate my husband, our four kids, and myself!!! This place is great!! We have stayed here multiple times and always come back. In fact, this time we aren't even going to Disneyland but we still chose to stay here. I love that each of our kids have a bed. I love two showers so we can get dressed at the same time. I love having enough bath towels so my kids don't have to dry off with a washcloth!!! I love the space in the room so our luggage can fit!!! We've had breakfast on site a few times and the options are great, food tastes great, and it wasn't outrageously priced, thankfully!!! The employees are kind and so accommodating. The snacks in the lobby are fairly priced with a great selection to grab and go. It's better to leave your car here and walk
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review, Nicole! I truly look forward to welcoming you back for another brilliant stay in Ahaheim.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel for a week while taking the little one (5 year old) to Disneyland. Pros:   -Great location - easy walk to Disney -Water park is fantastic for the little ones.  Geared towards young ones vs Teens -rooms are a great size with bunk beds and big bathrooms -A lot of food options around - including Panera Bread   Cons: -rooms are a bit dark if you face the back -rooms gets quite musty/humid as the windows do not open.  I can't imagine how humid it would get in summer. -you can hear the neighbors when they are opening/shutting doors etc  All in all i would recommend this hotel for families.  You really aren't in the room much and the beds/bathrooms provide more than adequate space for families.  I would certainly stay here again.
Manager Response: I'm delighted to hear that you and your family had an excellent stay with us! While I'm pleased to have hosted you, please know that I truly appreciate the feedback about our rooms and will pass it along to our team. I hope to welcome you and your family back again in the near future for another great stay.

Summary Heading: Great waterpark and large, spacious rooms
Summary: When planning our trip, we debated staying on Disney property or going to the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance.  We made the right choice - I highly recommend this property!    I am a hotel snob, and this property exceeded my high expectations. First, the water park is wonderful.  It has a great splash area for the smaller children, larger slides for the more adventurous, a hot tub, and a small swimming pool. As another reviewer noted, it was very clean, and I saw them hand cleaning the slides every morning.  The rooms are also very spacious. Our room had two double beds and bunk beds. Plus, the bathroom had a shower/tub and another shower, which is very helpful when trying to get everyone out the door. The staff were also great - very friendly and helpful.    If you are
Manager Response: Thank you for your generous 5-star review! I truly appreciate your great recommendation and look forward to welcoming you back again, soon.

Summary: We had a great time at this hotel.  The kids loved everything from the bunk beds to the waterpark.  Even though it was Early february, we were able to enjoy the pool because the water was heated, however the kiddie area did not seem to be heated and was pretty cold.  The staff was very friendly and welcoming and accomodating.  The rooms were clean and the kids loved the bunk beds.  My only complaint would be that parking was $20/day and valet only.  Although it was convenient, I don't necessarily like other people parking/driving my car.  also, I like to be able to go to my car without asking the valet to take me/bring me my car especially if i just forgot to get something.  We have stayed at the springhill suites and although valet was available, we were able to self park.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review! I'm pleased to hear that our team exceeded your expectations and that your family had the opportunity to enjoy the pool. Should you return to Anaheim, I look forward to welcoming you back for another excellent stay.

Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here. It's only a six minute walk to the parks, and the hotel has a nice amenities including a waterslide and large pool. Don't expect much on the food front, is there is only one restaurant options. However, the food was decent.   We would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review, Mark! I'm thrilled to hear that you enjoyed our close proximity to Disneyland, and can't wait to welcome you back for another seamless stay.

Summary Heading: Our new preferred hotel, but check this out if you're comparing suite types.
Summary: My family of three recently stayed four nights at the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance. Overall it was a lovely stay, but I do want to share a couple of tips we'll keep in mind for our next visit.  The floor plans for each room type that are offered on the hotel's website are extremely helpful. Based on these, we selected the "1 Bedroom Bunk Bed Suite, 2 Queen, Waterpark view, Balcony." Our young daughter goes to bed very early so we wanted to have a separate living space to hang out in during her naps and in the evenings.  The 2 Queen, Waterpark view, Balcony Suites are located on each floor near the elevators, which was not an issue. Noise from the hallway was limited. What did surprise us, though, was the location of the guest laundry room immediately next to the 2
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid review. I truly appreciate your honest feedback and I'll certainly forward your comments along to our team. I hope to have another opportunity to welcome you back for a seamless stay.

Summary Heading: Beyond Expectations: Perfect for Family Trip to Disneyland
Summary: Overall I would rate Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance 5-  A three star hotel? Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance is more close to a 4 star. This is not only my first stay at a Courtyard, but also my first choice totally relied upon TripAdvisor reviews. In summary, Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance is simply beyond my expectations.  First of all, the distance to Disneyland is really within walking distance, which means you don't have to get up very early in the morning and don'f have to wait for commute bus to Disneyland at any time. It is of great convenience.   We booked a park view room with a king size bed and bunk bed and the room really surprises us. It is so SPACIOUS that it could be extremely useful for families. Room is equipped with double sink vanity and
Manager Response: What an excellent review! I'm overjoyed to read such generous comments. I truly look forward to welcoming you back to Anaheim for another seamless 5-star stay.

Summary Heading: Great Family Friendly Hotel and close to the entrance to Disneyland!
Summary: This hotel is very close to the main entrance to Disneyland, very quiet part of the street across from the Park. Very family friendly with a water park on the 2nd floor. The staff was all so nice and welcoming. The rooms and facilities are very clean. We stayed in a standard room that was very spacious. Love how family friendly the bathrooms are in the rooms, definitely room to move and share. I ended up sick during my stay and the General Manager had the Bistro coffee make me a special drink to help me feel better. The only one downfall was I was very sick but there was no late check out available the day we were leaving and they would not make an exception which I though was a little bit of a bummer since we stayed 4 days at their hotel, so I rated them very good instead of
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family of 6 people stayed here for 5 nights last March (grandma, hubby & I and our 3 kids). We were able to comfortably share one of the family rooms. My 2 older kids LOVED their bunk bed!! Definitely one of their fav parts of the hotel. Grandma took one bed, hubby & I in another and we were able to arrange for a travel crib for our 2 year old. There was enough room for all of us. Loved the Keurig in our room, and it was well-stocked each day. The bathroom had a separate room for shower (amazing) and toilet, with tub and sinks/mirrors outside a door. Perfect for a group! We upgraded to a park view to see the fireworks. However, I found we were only on our room to see the fireworks one night. So it wasn't quite worth it.  There is a laundry room on every second floor. I was on
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: So close to Disneyland for families
Summary: This place is amazing can't think of a better place to stay with kids, I have a 17 and a 14 year old and they love this place, and the water park is amazing, even though it is winter the water is warm enough to swim, and it is literally 5 min walk to the main entrance to the parks. The room where sparkling clean and very well maintained, and the laundry is very convenient.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I feel like i don't know where to begin.... This hotel was amazing!!!! The grounds on clean, well maintained. The Valet guys and gals were beyond helpful, very friendly, offered help to and from the car to the room, answered all of our questioned and they even offer to store your stroller for you so you don't have to keep it in the room. The staff was beyond friendly. They were very helpful, greeted us every time we came and went. Helpful with whatever we needed no hesitation what so ever. Called to get a new hair dryer and more towels and they came very quickly. The room was SO nice and spacious, very clean, had bunk beds for the two little ones which worked out great. Had not one, but two showers and a tub which came in handy. Very close walk to Disneyland and at night after
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for our recent Disney trip. Hotel room was great. Larger than you would normally expect. Location is very handy for Disney - only a short walk to the park entrance. Hotel has small store which was handy. Reception staff very helpful. Mims Cafe next door. We ate there one breakfast and one dinner. Meals were very good. I would definitely stay again when we go back for our next Disney trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: We were very pleased with this hotel. We wanted something within walking distance of Disneyland that easily accommodated our family of five and this hotel absolutely hit the mark. It's about a five minute walk from the entrance to the Disneyland resort and a ten minute stroll to the gates of Disneyland itself.   The hotel itself is brand new with all the mod cons and the room we had was very cleverly designed. We had a king suite with two bunk beds. There was plenty of room for all of us. There was a huge master bedroom with a king sized bed, plenty of storage space and a small balcony. The kids had a separate room with two bunk beds and there was also a lounge room with a dining table for four, a desk, a large sofa, a fridge, a microwave and more storage. There were no plates
Manager Response: none

Summary: we stayed 3 nights. upon arrival the valet was courteous and not pushy. Front desk staff was kind and positive. helpful with adding a room . They knew their job.   The room was smaller than my typical Embassy Suite room but it much more updated and fresh. i would say B+ considering it is made for a family to lodge.  No included breakfast  about 65$ dollars a morning for a family of 6. average food.   the pool is small and the hot tub was fine, the pool park is made for small kids not teenagers.   Due to the staff i would return, but it's a hard sell for an extra $100 a night and smaller rooms and no breakfast .
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel, close to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel room is very nice, big space for family of four. Good location, just minutes walk to Disneyland and number of restaurants in the street. Staff are helpful as well, the restaurant in hotel is pretty good too, overall, really happy to stay there. The only thing disappointing us is weather, we couldn't go to theme park everyday.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved this place!!It is close to dland and some a bunch of places to eat nearby.  The waterslides are pretty awesome too.  The front desk was super helpful with everything.  I highly recommend for families!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was surprised how much I liked this hotel. The staff was just so helpful and friendly.  The room was great - the updated walk in shower was awesome, as was the table with booth, the keurig coffee, and the fridge and mircowave.   We had a fireworks view room and saw a great show Friday night  from the balcony - not sure why they did not have them Saturday - but not the hotel's fault. Sunday we went to the  World of Color show so we did not see the fireworks Sunday either.  The hotel is clean and my husband and I LOVED the hot tub - we made sure and used it every single night.   Oh yeah - and walking distance to Disneyland!!

Summary: I live in Marriott hotels. Last year I had over 125 stays on my account. I've stayed at this property 20 nights in 7 months and it is likely my favorite Courtyard in the US. They are very consistent from visit to visit. The team is great and the place is always spotless. The rooms are a nice size and you are just a short walk away from the front gate at Disney Land.   I do a lot of races out here and I get the same friendly greeting at 4 am as I do at 4pm. I've stayed at other properties in the past on this street and this is my go to location.  Great all around!!!!

Summary Heading: Still is great but a couple of minor details

This time around we had a couple of things pop up. Our room is right next to the freeway so all I could hear and focus on all night was the freeway noise. I highly recommend getting a room on the other side of the hotel. Also, today we came back from a long day at Disneyland to find our room was never cleaned. We didn't leave a sign on the door and we were gone from 8am-11pm so they definitely had time.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney!

It's less than a ten minute walk from the hotel to the security tents at the front gate which was great because we could come back to the room for a quick nap at midday.  The room is large and well laid out with a breakfast nook,  small fridge two sinks,  separate shower room and bathtub with shower as well.  Plenty of closet space and drawers for storage.  My son loved the bunk beds!  There were only 3 of us but the room could accommodate 5-6 folks pretty comfortably.  It was a bit too cold for us to try out the water park but some brave souls were using it and enjoying themselves (a plus for the summer months).  The gym was well appointed and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here over Halloween and it was the BEST !! Stayed with myself husband and 4 children (7,5,3,1)!  When i booked i had requested a pool view which we didnt get BUT that night when the fireworks went off we could see them perfectly from our room !!  We ate at the bistro for breakfast which was fantastic. We also got food there most nights after a long day at the park and no complaints from anyone. (and with 4 kids that is rare to come by!!)  All the staff were always very friendly and smiling !  Now the waterpark.. that was my kids favorite ! Pretty sure they liked it more than Disneyland !!  Hoping to go back Dec. 2017 !!!

Summary Heading: Amazing value with a great Disneyland location
Summary: This is probably the best hotel I have found at the Disneyland resort.  To start, it is nicer than most Courtyards I have stayed at (and I have stayed at a lot of them).  Most Courtyards are kind of dumpy, this one was kind of nice.  Next, it is VERY close to the Disneyland gates (5-7 minute walk to the security checkpoints).  It is actually closer to Disneyland than 2/3 of the actual Disney hotels (and just as nice), but at HALF the price.  I won't lie, this is probably the best thing about the hotel in my opinion.  But to be fair, we did not try the hotel's water park as it was a little chilly while we were there.  On the very short walk to the park are many options for food and drink if you want to grab something before or after the park (Mimi's, Panera, McDonalds, a pizza

Summary: The magic of Disney started for us at the courtyard Marriot at the theme park entrance. Super helpful and friendly As an elite member I often get upgraded when I am by myself but my husband and I enjoyed a quality suite! I stay about 200 nights a year average for work and  approx 188 of those stays have been at Marriot and this is one of the finest! Would recommend to everyone.

Summary Heading: AMAZING Hotel...with just a touch of Disney Magic!!!
Summary: Lovely hotel! We stayed here a few days ago for 4 nights while on vacation to Disneyland. We stayed in the two queens and bunkbed room with a Disneyland view. Upon arriving to the hotel, we were greeted with Holiday cheer. The lobby was decorated beautifully! Loved the Santa hats that the front desk and valet staff wore!   We got to the hotel before check-in time, which was not a problem because they held our luggage for us at valet. We were able to enjoy a couple of hours over at Disneyland before returning to check-in to the hotel and get our luggage.  Everyone at the front desk and valet were friendly and welcoming to us.  Upon entering the room, we were pleasantly surprised by how spacious it was. The bathroom had two separate showers (separated by a door), makeup mirror,

Summary: We stayed for four nights at The Courtyard Marriott and it was fantastic. We arrived late but our entrance was stunning as it was beautifully decorated for Christmas and it smelt great. The hotel reception was very helpful and friendly. There was a A laundry on each level which we found awesome, the gym was excellent and the waterpark outstanding for kids. The rooms worked very well for a family as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our stayed and it went way too fast. The food area to eat at the hotel was friendly, good Starbucks coffee and the food was okay, a bit steep price wise for what you got, especially the wine. Would fully recommend this hotel. Excellent.

Summary: The room itself was fantastic:  bunk beds for the kids and two double beds for the rest of us.  My family of five had plenty of space, which was wonderful.  The downsides?  The hotel is full of families on their vacation of the year, and the staff seem simply tired of it.  There are no upgrades available for Marriott Elite members (even Platinum) and the hotel is quite expensive.  I was able to walk to the theme park pretty easily, but there are actually 5 or 6 hotels which are closer--all of which are less expensive.  Even though I love Marriotts, the next time I go to Disneyland, I'll stay somewhere else.  Other hotels are closer and less expensive, but I counted on the Marriott brand to be worth the cost.  It wasn't.

Summary: Stayed 4 nights with the family including 3 children. Hotel delivers everything the website said it would. Very clean rooms & friendly service from staff. This hotel costs less money and has a better water park than the Grand Californian.  The rooms were immaculate, nearly new and the service was excellent.  Starbucks coffee onsite and no lines like they are in Disney.  The pool area was just as clean and parents were actively watching their children. We will definitely stay here again. Didn't get a chance to do the Bistro, but last year it was very yummy. This hotel has a gift shop and they sell Disney merchandise. They also have a waterpark, but I didn't need to use it since I was there to see the happiest place on earth. The beds were comfy, hotel was immaculate, it was a ten min walk from the front door to the gates at Disneyland. Summary: Rooms are great! Spacious and set up to sleep 6, perfect for our little family. Dual showers, food available at the hotel as well beer and wine. Unless you are going to spend time in the hotel or in the pool, the biggest advantage to an on-property hotel is not having to take a bus or the parking shuttle which all can add a lot of travel time. Since we were not planning to do anything other than spend full days in the park, this was a good time to try a new hotel. Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent thanksgiving week here. The rooms are good size for 5 people. We had a 2queen + bunk bed room and we were comfortable. You can't beat the price for the amount of space you get, great view and the amazing convenience to Disneyland. The room does not have any doors between the bunk bed space and the king/queen bed space. This made it a bit tricky in the morning trying not to wake each other up. Summary: So pleased we picked this place. It's spacious- beds are comfy- configuration with the bunks is great- clean- awesome efficient staff- close to parks. Can't wait to go back! It's definitely a family orientated hotel but then you are at Disney! The waterpark was a total hit and better than we had anticipated.  Fridge in the room is handy plus plenty of room for bags and buggys. The only tiny tiny thing was no kettle but then I don't think most American hotels have this so nothing to mark on and certainly didn't impact our stay.  Would highly recommend to anyone headed to Disneyland. 😀😀😀

Summary: A bit pricey but the location speaks for itself. Rooms are strictly available for check in only at 4pm, any earlier, you have to wait at the lobby or go elsewhere. Hotel is pretty new and everything looks well kept.

Every single staff member is friendly and helpful (especially those in the bistro) and the pool area was paradise for my 3 year old twins!   Great location, great food options (love that Panera bread is now open next door), great wifi, great hotel. Will be back next time for sure!!

Summary Heading: Where to take your kids when the park is HOT
Summary: We were booked at another Marriott and then the day before we found out t was going to be 92 degrees at Disneyland while we were there - the second week in November! I called Marriott and they cheerfully changed my reservations to this hotel.  This is a business man's family hotel - what I mean by that is it's the same quality as when daddy gets dressed up in his suit and goes on a business trip, but this time everything is put together with the understanding that the family is in tow expecting a good time, and the only suit daddy packed is the kind you swim in.  When I got miserable hot at Disneyland I said, "Let's go to the water park!" We crossed the street and we were back at the hotel. Everybody was happy.  Note that we were able to swim all day including our check out day.

Summary: My family and I stayed here for a week during summer to visit Disneyland. As this is a new property, the hotel is nicely decorated and well appointed. There is a nice pool area although it is more for smaller children and not teenagers. The hotel is quite expensive.

Summary Heading: Great hotel and great customer service from Savannah!

It was easy to walk to Disneyland every day which made the trips hassle free. Also easy access to restaurants and quick uber ride to Walmart for any supplies. All the staff were really helpful and friendly. on our last night we left our phone in an uber car. in our panic Savannah at front desk took control and contacted the driver and arranged to get it back - using her own uber account to organise and staying past her shift until we had it back. It was beyond what she needed to do or we expected - so very very helpful and we were so grateful. Thank you again. Would highly recommend!!

Summary: We loved this place. Room bigger than expected- 2 queens and a set of bunks, 1 toilet but two showers and 2 basins. Perfect for our family of 5. Staff were all helpful and very friendly. Summary: The hotel is ideal for large family groups with a great selection of room types. This worked great for our extended family stay.  The only things I would note are the bunk bed room don't have doors and the toilet couldn't be accessed if adults were showering.  This wasn't an issue.  The beds are all comfortable and the bunk beds are large enough for an average size adult.  Some people have commented on traffic noise from these suites but we didn't think it a problem as for us it was a low background noise.  We appreciate no noise from other rooms or hallway,

Summary: We stayed here for three nights with a pre-schooler and a baby, and had a great time. We had a one-bedroom suite, which was plenty of room for us. The room was clean and comfortable. There was a microwave and a mini-fridge, a separate shower and tub, and very comfortable beds. The hotel is not fancy, but is nice and our pre-schooler loved the pool. Good sound-proofing in the rooms, and the staff was incredibly friendly. One complaint is that our room did not get made up the first day of our stay. The location is perfect - 5 minutes to Disney, with plenty of restaurants in walking distance. If not staying at a Disney resort, I would put this as a first choice.

Summary: We had an awesome time at the Courtyard Marriott in Anaheim. It was an easy walk to Disneyland so no stress trying to organise transport. The kids didn't want to leave, it was great to let them run and have a good time while we relaxed on the loungers. The rooms were a great size, very family friendly and having a tv with Netflix capability was an added bonus. It would pay to double check when your room will be ready as we had an early flight so when we arrived at 9.30am we were told our room wouldn't be ready until 4pm... they worked their magic and we were in at 12.30pm. Overall a fabulous place for the family, would love to visit again

Summary: Hotel is clean with lovely big rooms and 2 seperate showers, it's very modern and has a fabulous waterpark for those moments not spent at theme parks. Beds were probably the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel and with 2 queen size beds and a bunk in our room, our family of 3 had loads of room to relax and to re-energise after long days on our feet. The short walk to the parks is also a major bonus.

Summary Heading: Highlight of our trip to Disney!
Summary: Don't even bother looking at Disney Hotels, this is the place to stay!  Literally across the street from the main gate of Disneyland.  Beautiful lobby and outdoor space to sit and relax.  Small area in the lobby that serves food and starbucks coffee, as well as a gift shop that includes snack foods.  Purchase your disney tickets at the front desk and skip the line ups at disneyland.  Rooms are huge, include bunk beds and a sitting area with table to have meals.  We had a balcony with fireworks view, it was amazing and well worth the price of the upgrade.  Our daughter LOVED the waterpark!  When we were at Disney she asked to go back to the waterpark at the hotel, it's that good!  I had a great time at the waterpark as well, taking her down the 2 large water slides, playing on
Manager Response: none

Summary: I couldn't say enough good things about this hotel. It is in a great location with a 5 minute walk to Disney, is thoroughly clean and has friendly staff that look happy to be doing their job. I have read comments about the balconies on here, yes they are standing room only but that's better than no balcony and allowed us to open the sliding door for fresh air each morning. Yes the main pool is not very deep or large but It's better than no pool. If the pool was bigger it would then take away space from the deck chairs or the water park and considering its above the parking garage they probably couldn't go any deeper. My children are 17 and 15 and were more than happy with it. Coffee maker in the room was great and it was no problem at all for them to deliver a kettle as I'm
Manager Response: none

Would stay there again if in anaheim.

Summary: We stayed here for my daughter 1st birthday. The hotel is very nice and have good waterpark at the pool. It's only 5 minutes walk to Disneyland and surrounded by a lot of restaurants. The room was quite big and clean, but the king size bed wasn't available, so we have to sleep in separate bed which is not really convenient. The breakfast is ok perhaps need to  put more selection for the cereal. Others thing I was asking bowl to use for microwave but they only give me plastic one and said that's the only they have.

Unfortunately, we only have a few King rooms in our hotel so those need to be reserved well ahead of time.  We will review our cereal offerings to ensure we have a wide selection. We do have small microwave's in each guest room but we do not offer a full kitchenette and do not offer cutlery or dishes. We hope to have the honor of hosting your next visit to Anaheim!

Summary: We loved the hotel and the kids absolutely loved the swimming area! The room was very large, clean. We stayed to go to Disneyland but our 2 and 4 year olds would tell you that their favorite part of the trip was the pool. We also had no problem walking to Disney, even with young kids in toe. It was about a 10-15 minute walk for us. We didn't have a firework view (they cancelled them anyways), but you can view them from the pool deck. Overall it was a great stay, the water park was awesome and we would definitely stay again!

Summary: very nice hotel with lovely amenities such as waterpark, souvenir shop, convenience store and beautiful patio with fire pit in the   smoking area. But there are plenty of restaurants nearby as well all within a few minutes walking distance. Disneyland was a five minute walk across the road. The Honda sports centre was only a ten minute drive, so we were able to attend the Hockey. would recommend this hotel to everyone and especially family's.

Summary: Large comfy rooms in a great location, right across the road from Disneyland. Friendly and helpful staff. The pool area is average though as it's really only suitable for children with the main pool being extremely small, you could really only fit about 20 adults in at a time. Still a great motel.

The big selling point for this hotel is the water park located in the open ended courtyard.  My kids loved it.  They played until exhausted after the 6 hour drive down from Northern California.  The next day, after doing Disneyland all day, they couldn't wait to get back to the hotel and go in the hot tub and ride the water slides some more.  Same thing the next day.  Of course mom and dad sat in the hot tub with adult refreshments.  Our room was nice, we would have liked a better view, but someone has to face the freeway and Howard Johnson's.  The room was billed as a partial fireworks view, and that is true.  If you go

Summary Heading: Great new hotel and fun waterpark

The bathroom was a fantastic size with a separate tub/shower and walk-in shower (so helpful to have after the waterpark or for getting ready in the mornings).   My kids loved the waterpark and wanted to go there instead of Disneyland on the first three days of our trip. There are two fun water slides, a small pool and hot tub. It was great to stay here compared to the other South Harbor Blvd motels we have tried before. That said, the price is much more

Summary Heading: Loved the location and the rooms!

Our room included two queens + bunkbeds + separate shower and bathtub facilities.  The beds were comfortable and although there were only two of us the room could clearly accommodate a family of six.  The room also included mini fridge, microwave, flat panel with Netflix/internet TV and multiple sinks. Manager Response: none

Bathrooms are nice and big, rooms are nice and big, there are decent food venues  close by and overall it is the best place we found close to Disney that isn't a Disney property.  If you are traveling with your family you will find this to be a family friendly hotel.

Summary: We stayed here 10/7/2016-10/10/2016 and had a fireworks view room with 2 queens and a bunk bed. Room was nice and spacious. The view of the fireworks was amazing! Summary: Other reviews have described the rooms, amenities and facilities which are all of a high standard and make this hotel an excellent choice for a visit to Disneyland, particularly with children. Double bathroom sinks, bath/shower and separate second huge walk-in shower. Fridge, microwave, lots of drawer and closet space. The water park is AMAZING and was wonderful after a long hot day of fun at Disneyland. Manager Response: none

Summary: Most of our time was spent at Disneyland......so the Hotel was under used for what it was  deserving of. The short amount of downtime we had at the hotel was exceptional. Summary: We stayed for four nights for the express purpose of visiting Disney, like almost all the occupants. On paper, the hotel ticks all the boxes. It is clean, has all the amenities, and good sized rooms. The water park area is great for kids. The location over the road from Disney is ideal. The staff were generally fine. There are limited eating options on site; there is a small cafe open only certain hours which actually had very helpful and friendly service, but it is quite limited.The on site laundry was greatly appreciated.  It is perfectly acceptable accommodation which serves the purpose of visiting Disney, but does not offer any specific joys in its own right. It didn't seem to me to offer spectacular value for money, but that may be region specific. You could do worse.

The hotel only opened last year so everything was wonderfully fresh, new and modern. I should have guessed that a hotel across the street from the main entrance for Disneyland would be heavily booked and that the only way to get an upgraded room is to book it beforehand. Manager Response: Dear Honored Guest: I am so sorry that we were not able to make your granddaughter's 1st visit even more magical by upgrading you to a Disney view room. We truly value your loyalty to Marriott and appreciate the many nights you have stayed with Marriott to earn your Gold status. We do upgrade our elite guests to suites and preferred views whenever possible. Many of our suites and preferred rooms are booked in advance and we do have to honor our Elite guest requests based on status with the highest priority going to our Platinum guests; so it does make it impossible to meet all the requests for those room types. I think a lot of people have the misconception that hotels keep a few of their best rooms in reserve but we allocate those rooms every night; I doubt that we have ever had a vacant Disney view room since we opened! We are now on the ART route (Anaheim Resort Transportation) so you can buy an ART bus ticket to go to or return from the Disney Resort if you are too tired to walk. I hope you made many magical memories with your family while visiting the Disney Resort area!

New hotel so things were clean, beds were comfortable, plenty of sleeping options with our room (2 bunk beds, 2 queen beds).  A lot of sitting options in the room. All staff are so nice and helpful a big shoutout to Jonathan in the dining area, nothing is never a problem always has a smile on his face and willing to go out of his way to help anyone. We noticed this every single time we ate there. You made our stay very welcoming. Would definitely return again.

We were on 5th floor and could see Disneyland from our room & the fireworks. The water park was a huge bonus and a lifesaver as we arrived amid a heat wave in September! Well done Marriott!!

Summary Heading: Great Customer Service that "anticipates" rather than "reacting!" Great Hotel!

The staff "anticipated" rather than "reacted" which I LOVE that!  The mini restaurant/coffee area was outstanding as well as the desk agents.  We obviously loved Disneyland but this hotel made it even better.  The location was perfect 1.5 blocks from the main entrance.  We WILL be back!

Summary: We used to go to Anaheim constantly pre-kids (we love Disneyland!), but it had been years since our last trip, and I was surprised to see a highly rated hotel that we had never stayed at that was across the street from Disneyland. We arrived on a Monday, planning on doing Tuesday at Disneyland, and played for hours at the pool area. Manager Response: none

Summary: Can't say enough about this great hotel. Staff were friendly, helpful, and courteous. It was our first visit to Disney, so walking distance was perfect for our kids and it was in close proximity to other restaurants and convenience stores. The water park was great, kids loved it.   Lastly the little bistro downstairs has a great selection of food morning and night!  We will definitely recommend to anyone coming to the area!

The room itself: We stayed in room 318 just a floor above the waterpark which I'll come back to, was great! 2 x queen size bed and 1 x bunk bed with 2 x showers (1 that was a shower/bath) with 1 x toilet and a big vanity. My kids loved the bunk beds and the proximity of the hotel to restaurants and the parks/Downtown Disney were very nearby. The water park was clean and large enough for the kids to enjoy and the grounds of the hotel were very clean. I'd definitely recommend and stay again if we are ever in Anaheim!

Summary Heading: Highlight of our Stay at Disneyland
Summary: We loved the hotel.  It's new and clean.  The rooms are large and include a mini-refrigerator and a microwave.  The location is very close to the entrance of Disneyland.  Our toddler absolutely loved the water park.  It's not for everyone.  The pool area is geared towards children.  The main pool is only 3'6" deep and small.  It's among the more expensive hotels in the area.  It worked for us because we wanted to ensure that our room wasn't 'dated' or 'worn'.  Also, we wanted the water park for our daughter.  Some people have complained about the lack of an on-site restaurant but I don't get the criticism.  There is an onsite Bistro - but literally just across the parking lot is Mimi's cafe which is a very good restaurant (better than most hotel restaurants and cheaper).
