Summary: We were really looking forward to visiting this hotel when we planned our August 2016 visit to Disneyland. Since it was new, (1 year old) and had the great facilities (re:  water area), we took the plunge and booked an extended stay (9 days).  We had a very enjoyable stay - great location (10 minutes and we were at the park), water park was large and even though it was busy, it never felt overly crowded.  Rooms were large enough for our party (5) and the bunk beds were great - everyone had a bed!  Great that there were also laundry facilities on site.  Never tried the restaurant as there are too many options.  Only "draw backs" were the fact that parking was by valet only (and a daily charge - I didn't mind the service and the guys that worked valet were great, it's just that I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: GREAT property. Super clean, friendly helpful staff, FUN water park, VERY close to the Disney parks.
Summary: This hotel was great! So very clean. Spacious rooms. We had 2 queen beds with bunk beds and a large bathroom with a tub and shower over head and another shower separated by a door. Great for a larger family. The water park was VERy fun, our toddler loved it and did not want to leave. The staff was very friendly. Cute little store inside the hotel and VERY close to the theme parks. We walked back and forth easily. I love this place!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: One of the best hotel for a disneyland park visit
Summary: Great size of the room, two queens and a bunk bed, perfectly fit my family (two adults and two children), separated shower room makes morning rush way easier. If you have a family with young children, this is the perfect choice for you, my two daughters really enjoyed the waterpark. Walking distance to the park, very friendly folks.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance, in May 2016 and loved every minute of it. The rooms were impressive – they were spacious, clean and well appointed. I was travelling with family and we occupied 2 rooms, but had I known how large the rooms were, we probably could have stayed in the one room. Each room had 2 queen sized beds, and a “kiddie sized” bunk – it was delightful. There was also a bath and shower combo, plus another shower in each room, which was super convenient. As well as the usual desk and other in-room amenities, there was also a Keurig coffee machine (with take-away cups and lids), a refrigerator, microwave, and a lovely table with bench seat and overhead lighting.  One of the best features of this hotel was the ability to see the Disneyland
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for family very close to Disney
Summary: Water park is a hit with the kids. Very close to Disney entrance and you don't even need a car. Lots of eateries around the hotel.Rooms are huge & very clean! Staffs (Savanna, Shelby & etc) are the best! and friendly. . Hope to be back very soon!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Waterpark is a blast for the kids. Clean suites. So close to Disney entrance also!!! Staff are extremely knowledgable and friendly. We enquired about purchasing some groceries and staff noted Vons had free delivery for first time customers so we ordered our groceries for delivery and the hotel even stored it for us so we didn't have to wait around to take delivery!   Only downside is you have to valet your car but suspect this is to control authorized parking only and to generate additional revenue - nice service though.  Would stay here again!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Absolutely the best option for off park accomodations!
Summary: My sister in law and all our kids just returned from our stay at the Courtyard Theme Park Entrance. This hotel is essentially brand new with every amenity possible. We have stayed in several off park hotels in the past, and this one BY FAR surpasses them all.  First off the service at front counter is awesome. Friendly, helpful and accommodating. Randall was the best!  The location is 5 min walk to Disney entrance. Perfect for mid day breaks from the hustle bustle.  The water park is more than just a hotel waterslide, it was so much fun for the kids (age range 6, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15) all of them loved it!  The gift shop and small concession as well as breakfast counter were all reasonably priced and stocked a variety of items we needed/wanted throughout our stay. From band
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fabulous room with good options for sleeping. We travelled as a family of four with two teenage daughters and it was great for them to have a bed each after two weeks sharing a queen in other hotels. Plenty of storage in the room too. Bathrooms were great and we were grateful to have extra towels every day. The rooms are spotless and housekeeping were brilliant at coming in to clean when we wanted them to. The fridge is a good size and the table and chairs were a bonus. Our firework view was amazing and we could here the music too. The lifts do get busy at check in time and at the end of the day but we never waited more than 5 minutes. The coin laundry was a godsend after two weeks travelling and decent price too. It took us 10 minutes to walk to Disney so we didn't need to use
Manager Response: none

Summary: We booked a fireworks view room, and it was huge! I would recommend it - there are bunkbeds in a room to the right of the (huge) entrance, and a bathroom (with separate bath and shower areas) plus king bed and eating area to the right. Bed extremely comfortable, which is always a big concern for me. It's all so new and clean and shiny! I couldn't book through travel agents as the hotel was so new, so booked with Marriott online - no problems at all with the booking. Staff friendly and keen to help. Mimi's breakfast is so good, very handy. Short walk to the Parks in the morning. Ticked all the boxes for us :-)
Manager Response: none

Summary: The family an I had a great stay. The staff was kind. Room clean and spacious. The kids loved the pool/water play area. I will come back again. Close to Disneyland. Several restaurants within walking distance. Target 5 minutes from hotel which was helpful I forgot a few things at home.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Twice this place has been home!
Summary: We came last year just after the property was built. There were a few hiccups as with any new construction, but the staff was very friendly. This year all seems well and we are happy. This is a great place for families and the water park is a bonus.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had been watching the reviews of the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park for several months and it definitely lived up to the positive reviews. The hotel was modern, very clean, staff were very friendly and helpful. We also got an early check-in which was fantastic and allowed us to unpack and hit the water park /pool. The rooms are very spacious, lots of storage and the bunk beds were a hit with our 6 and 9 year olds. The beds were very comfy and we didn't have any issues with the sheets. The water park/pool were amazing. We spent several hours each day cooling off. There have been several comments about the size of the pool. Yes it isn't overly large and is only 3'6" feet but that was perfect for our 6 year old who is a weak swimmer. It did get full at times but then we would play
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked this hotel after reading many positive reviews and was not disappointed. It is THE perfect hotel for families visiting Disneyland and CAP. The rooms, laundry facilities and the water park were great but the best feature, Starbucks!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Brilliant for Disney and smaller kids
Summary: Stayed for 9 days in King-Bed suite (seperate bedroom and living room) and have almost only good things to say about the hotel. Missed a 5 Star rating by a tiny bit but first the good: - staff is very helpful and knowledgable - no complaints there - room is spacious, bathroom is modern and everything is very clean - pool area is amazing for kids, not much for older kids to do though - so close to Disneyland, just a quick stroll really Small things we missed: - given the hotel has such a great pool, we would have welcomed a place in the bathroom to hang up wet clothes or a swimsuit dryer near the pool - the sink in our bathroom was making weird noises and despite a couple of calls no one was able to fix - washer/dryer seem expensive but maybe we are spoiled (4$ for washing and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a family, but horrible sheets.
Summary: Great hotel for a family! Clean and near Disneyland! Walking distance to restaurants and the location is great for those coming from the Long Beach Airport. The water park was great! My kids loved it. My only complaint were the sheets. They were horrible. It was like sleeping on a beach. The fabric was probably washed so many times that the fabric was peeling and felt bad.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We are Disneyland season pass holders and have stayed at quite a few hotels in the Anahim resort area. This hotel has the most comfortable bed I've slept in in Anaheim hands down. The hotel has a beautiful and soothing decor and atmosphere that is relaxing and welcoming room for a restful night's sleep. The staff was friendly and professional. It was quite nice that the laundry room was open 24 hrs which helps for those with little kids who may need to do wash after a long day in the park. This was a wonderful and restful stop in Anaheim, we will return for sure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The outside of the hotel is deceiving. The rooms are super large. My room had two showers and two queen size beds and a set of bunk beds.  Immaculate room overlooking water park which is a kids heaven and parents dream. It's amazing. The staff here are gracious and you can walk to Disney 5 minute walk. It's awesome. There is plenty of food close by. My kids love it and the best thing is there a laundry. Yay!! Just came back from San Diego hotel and there is no laundry or late night inexpensive eating.  What a gem.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect family hotel, so close to Disneyland!
Summary: We stayed back in June and just loved this hotel!   Location is perfect. a short walk to the Disneyland entrance, close enough my 5yr old could do it in the heat and at night i could carry him home asleep!   McDonalds, ihop between hotel and parks with a few extra eateries made brekkie and dinner easy and cheap. Mimi's right out front (within the carpark) was excellent, we loved our meal there.   The rooms are so fresh, modern and spacious. We loved having the bunk for the kids and the little couchette for some extra seating. Added bonus of the 2 showers made it great for the busy mornings.  Several laundry rooms which were easy to use and could easily purchase powder down in the convenience store within the hotel. Laundry doesn't take a holiday unfortunately! ;)  The reception
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is a short five minute walk to Disneyland, there is no need take a shuttle.  We had no problem checking in and the staff did everything to accommodate us to give us a firework side, unfortunately they could not at this time, but Kyle was very helpful in letting us know where we could watch the fireworks.  One staff member told us that the staff was made up of either ex-Disneyland workers or Disneyland Enthusiasts and would be more then willing to help out.  The room was very clean with a huge bathroom, this hotel accommodates "blended" families that will sleep up to six people.  Two Queen beds and a set of bunk beds.  The room came with a mini-fridge and a microwave.    The swimming area was incredible the kids spent hours there.  We will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Awesom hotel & leave your car at home !
Summary: This is our new favorite hotel when visiting Disneyland !           We took the train from Santa Barbara to the new Anahiem train station & got a cab to the hotel ($16+tip). Arrived about 11am so we planned on leaving our luggage with the valet but , suprisingly, our room was ready! I booked a corner room that had a large living room, separate room with a King bed, and another open room with 4 bunk beds. The bathroom is perfect for all members of the family; sink & bathtub/shower in one part & toilet and huge, stunnining, walk-in shower behind a seperate door. The Keurig coffee maker is a huge plus ! Housekeeping service was prompt and excellent.          There is no room service or free breakfast but the cafe in the lobby lets you phone in orders until 11pm and the food is
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great hotel, five minute walk to Disneyland. Room was big with two queen beds and bunk beds, two showers, big closet, fridge and microwave, small table for eating. Pool area more for little kids but my 15 year old boy enjoyed the water slides and water dumping bucket. Very clean, staff very nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm pretty much a Marriott loyal, but I'm happily surprised every now and again when we run across a really great location. This location is one of the best Courtyards I've been to. Very family friendly, and literally right across from Disneyland's main gate. It's a valet only hotel due to lack of parking but I didn't feel like it was outrageously priced considering. They have a great gift shop that carries about everything you could need. The cafe downstairs is perfect for coffee and morning snacks. The decor and room were all fresh and modern. And it wasn't too noisy!  The best part was the fireworks view from our room. You can't go wrong there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the second time staying in this hotel for our family.  It is in an ideal location to enjoy disneyland.  It is only a 10-15 min walk to the park which makes it great for getting there first thing in the morning to enjoy the park before the heat and crowds get too intense.  We leave around lunch time and hit one of the many restaurants on the way back to the hotel.  After getting back to the hotel,. The fun continues with the water park that rivals many independent parks.  The kids looked forward to the water park as much as the park.  It was an outstanding hotel and the rooms are setup well for a family of 4-6.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Top Ten Reasons Why this is the Best Hotel for a Family with Kids at Disneyland
Summary: I'm picky about hotels but this Courtyard by Marriott vastly exceeded my expectations. We were traveling as two single moms with 4 kids between us, and it was PERFECT. Here's the top ten reasons why:  10. It was fresh, clean, and modern. No dingy carpet or scary bedding. The lobby is large and bright, the bedding in the rooms is all white, and everything looks new.  9. There was a well-stocked gift shop and food area, where you could even buy bottles of wine. So convenient! I ended up buying all the kids different super hero water bottles here so that each would be enthusiastic about bringing their own water into the park.   8. Bunkbeds and a giant wave photo mural on the wall -- how fun!  7. Paul Mitchell amenities -- shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soaps. A very nice touch and a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great for younger families but not a regular hotel for others
Summary: Went with my 17 year old daughter. The pool area is for younger kids and not adult friendly. Children are even allowed to cannon ball in the hot tub. Regular pool is very small. There is a starbucks like restaurant but no seated service or room service and it has very limited hours. The rooms are large and new and had a bunk bed in it. We had the fireworks viewing room but fireworks were cancelled for 4 out of the 5 days because it was slightly  breezy. On the 5th day when they did do the fireworks they were spectacular. You can buy wine at the starbucks location in the evening and drink it by the outside fire pit again dominated by children. And as previously stated they are very close to disneyland and the staff were excellent. The new carpet still smells and did irritate my
Manager Response: none

Summary: Basically chose this hotel for two main reasons: 1.)  Outdoor pool/park  2.) Sleeps 6 in a room.  The outdoor pool was jammed pack full of guests (summertime) with few chairs, towels, and very cloudy water. In fact, the actual pool was the size of a one-car garage filled to capacity.  Our room has a bunk & two doubles which works perfect for our family. We also had a partial view of the nightly fireworks.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: HUGE suites, great location and fabulous staff
Summary: Very clean! Our suite had bunk beds in a separate area and a king size bed for us. Our balcony allowed us to have a great view of the fireworks at Disneyland. The bathroom was spacious too, a shower over a bath, double vanity, plus another separate shower and toilet.   The entrance into the suite was larger than some cheap hotel rooms! The reception staff always made us feel welcome and assisted with direction when needed.  They even assisted with identifying an amazing bird we spotted on our balcony. There is a shop and mini mart, great for purchasing breakfast supplies and snacks. The pool itself was small but the waterpark area was great for families. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk to the theme park entrances. Lots of food options within a few minutes walk. A fantastic
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very close to main entrance  to Disneyland.  Walking  distance.  Huge rooms,with big bathrooms. Great  service,  nice pool area with water slides. Can see fireworks  from pool area. Valet parking. Good customer  service.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Bad taste in mouth after while checking out.
Summary: Staff was great until the last day during check-out. We noticed some food from the Bistro was charged to our room on August 4 for around $40. We know we didn't make this charge as we don't make a habit of charging things to our room. In fact, the only time we went down to the Bistro was for coffee and I paid for it with cash. I believe it was a bit over $20 and that was on he morning of August 5. Anyway, back to the charge that was not ours. The staff at the front desk, after consulting with someone at the Bistro for a long time came back and indicated that there was nothing that she could do and that it was our charge and that we had to pay for it. I asked for the manager who said the same thing. He was convinced there was no error and that a room key and a last name had to be
Manager Response: Dear Malmelmer: Thank you for your review of our hotel. I appreciate your taking the time to communicate your views. I sincerely apologize for the problem associated with your check out; we did not handle the situation very well at all and we certainly did not treat you like a valued guest. We have a supervisor's meeting scheduled for this Wednesday and will review this with the team so that we are better prepared to handle this type of situation in the future. Please contact me if you would like to further discuss your experience with me. Once again, thank you for staying with us and thank you for letting me know about this incident.

Summary Heading: Affordable family friendly hotel very close to Disneyland
Summary: From the moment we checked in we felt very comfortable and were happy that we had made a great choice for the start of our family vacation at Disneyland. We could see the Fireworks from our hotel room balcony. We had two very long days at Disney and it was great to be able to come back to our hotel room and everything was picked up straightened up clean and fresh and we were able to relax and unwind. the black out curtains are wonderful allowing us to sleep in a little longer and the three boys were rested ready to tackle another long day at Disney. the hotel has all the amenities that a family or anyone would need. The staff are very friendly and attentive and wanting to help and assist in anyway. If we come back to Disney we will definitely stay at this Courtyard by Marriott
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay close to Disneyland
Summary: This was the first time for our family staying off property and we didn't know what to expect.  This hotel definitely delivered.  The staff at check-in was great.  We got a complimentary room upgrade to a pool view.  The staff also assisted with our stroller rental.  We were able to see the fireworks from our hotel.  This hotel is fairly new and extremely clean.  The kids loved the bunk beds in our room.  The walk to Disneyland was a piece of cake.  There are plenty of restaurants along the walk so you don't have to only eat park food.  Nice lobby area with a small food/coffee kiosk and hotel store.  Excellent hotel pool.  This hotel gets 5 stars for excellent customer service!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great family choice walking distance to Disney
Summary: As the last leg of our family holiday before heading back to Melbourne we wanted to do 3 days at Disney over 5 days. This place fit the bill perfectly with its watersides as it gave our son something to do on the off days for a couple of hours. The fireworks can be seen from the pool deck at night. The bathroom setup is good for families as rooms 2 separated showers. Good mid-level option for a holiday.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed one night in the Courtyard as part of a two week trip to California and thought this was the best hotel of the whole journey! It wasn't the most luxurious or fancy but had a great location, just 10 minutes walk to the entrance of the Disney parks and on the main road with restaurants and convenience stores just a couple of minutes away.  What really set the property apart from the other similar hotels was the onsite waterpark. It isn't big (really just a couple of slides and a water play area) but is well maintained and great for the kids to play at for a few hours. I would also recommend using the hot tub after a day of walking around the parks - great way to relieve the pain and aches of the body.  The rooms are big and spacious. Having a twin queen bed and a double
Manager Response: none

Summary: A very non-typical Courtyard.  Our room had two queen size beds and a bunk bed.  We had three kids with us and they really enjoyed not only the room but the water park!  Bath includes both a shower and a tub separately then a sink area so lots of room.  Microwave, coffee maker and fridge in room so you can pack your own snacks.  Restaurants are close by so meals are easy.  And the water park was great fun although the pool itself is a little small.  Also walkable distance to Disney entrance.  There is an up charge for rooms that face the fireworks, those didn't happen either of the nights we were there so I would have been upset to pay extra for that.  You can easily walk to a great area to see them.  Valet parking is required so be certain to add that to your calculations.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Roomier rooms, friendly staff and an AMAZING water facility for kids just one block from the Disney and California Adventure gates, in the main street, near all major restaurants and facilities that you might need while in Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best family hotel for Disney, ever
Summary: I cannot recommend this hotel enough.  1. Location - the hotel has a fantastic location about a 10 minute walk to the entrances of the Disney parks, just steps to Panera which is great for breakfast, and just off the highway.  2. Quality- the hotel is excellent quality. The design has really thought about what guests need out of their hotel. A great water play area, bunk beds, two showers, dual sinks, plenty of space for all the things that families need like suitcases and strollers. Places to put things down after a long day, and give kids a snack. Extremely clean and new.  3. Staff - the staff was superb. Extremely helpful and kind. They go out of their way to ensure you're pleased with your experience.   Overall a fantastic experience. I cannot recommend it enough if it fits
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here on a family trip to Disneyland. It is about a ten minute walk to the entrance. We got the room set-up that had a bunk bed and a king in another bedroom - it was such a good idea! We had restful sleep without visitors. The rooms were very spacious and clean. The beds were comfortable. The waterpark was the big draw. It is perfect for families, especially with smaller children. Our guys, at 9 & 11, were near the top age range I would recommend (although we went on the big waterslides, too!) There was one of those very shallow, no step entry pool for tiny ones, and a kid-sized splash area with great water play.

Summary: Booked a really great family room for our stay - kids loved the bunk beds and we loved the huge room with the fireworks view - these were spectacular so I would definitely recommend this room.  Splash park with slides was a bonus, even though the swimming pool was quite small - still, it's a good place to cool off and relax in after a tough day at Disneyland.  Location is only a few minutes walk to the theme park entrance so handy if you have little ones.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family of 4 with 2 adults and 2 (16 & 21) year old kids stayed from July 23 - 27. We booked a fireworks view room with 2 queen beds and a bunk bed. We were given a room looking directly at the Disneyland park with a fantastic fireworks view. Our room was on the sixth floor with a balcony. The room was very nice and very spacious. The bunk beds were full size and fit my 16 year old comfortably. There were only 4 drawers in the room, but there was a shelf in the closet that we were able to put our clothes on.We could also hang clothes in the closet. There was a small table with a pretty big corner bench/booth to sit on. The bathroom was spacious with a tub/shower and sinks with a counter in the main part of the bathroom and a door into another room where there was a shower with

Summary: Great location easy quick walk to Disneyland.  Large rooms for family, clean and modern outdoor pool area is gr8 for kids and to watch fireworks at Disneyland if you're room doesn't face that way. Staff were friendly and helpful.  Brought my Disneyland tickets at hotel saved standing in line.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good hotel, below average front desk
Summary: Location is pretty good, close to the main entrance. Overall the hotel is quite new and spacious. We basically stayed for the water park which served well for a break during the summer heat. Front desk and overal service experience is pretty average. I am still trying to get hold of my bill which could not be produced for some reason. also check in was super late at 4pm. prices hike in high season.
Manager Response: Dear TribbleM: Thank you for your review; we truly appreciate hearing from our guests. I apologize for the problem you are having regarding obtaining a copy of your bill. This should be a very easy thing to do; please contact me at 714.254.1442 and I will be happy to provide you a copy. Best regards, Bill Cleaver, General Manager

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, not on property, but convenient
Summary: Stayed here with my family for a week, while visiting Disneyland. Short walk to Disney. Kids loved the water park. Mimi's Cafe in parking lot made good food close by. We love courtyard Marriott hotels, except there's no room service.  Parking is valet only, so no self parking. Accolades to Paige, who always made sure our room was in order and accommodated any special needs we had.
Manager Response: none

Summary: There are many positive aspects to this hotel as a base for visiting the park: the rooms are spacious and well equipped and will work well for families with several children; the park entrance is only a short walk; the pool provides a welcome distraction when it is too hot in the park. There are limited onsite options to eat but a good range of alternatives are close at hand if you venture out if the hotel. The things that have disappointed are the price which did not represent real value for the money; the failure to organise a smooth transfer between rooms (we could not be accommodated in the same room for both nights of our stay); the road noise from the highway which was intrusive, we stayed on the 6th (top) floor) in two different rooms (633 and 615) there may be better
Manager Response: Dear Guy P: Thank you for your review; I appreciate your taking the time to provide feedback on your hotel stay. I sincerely regret that you had to change rooms during your stay and that you found the highway noise to be intrusive. Our partial fireworks view rooms offer a great view of the fireworks; the only complaints I have had about these rooms is when Disneyland does not launch their fireworks due to wind conditions. It may be that your were here on a day when Disneyland did not launch their fireworks show. Please contact me if you would like to further discuss your experience. Best regards, Bill Cleaver, General Manager.

Summary: What a find! Close to the two Disney theme parks (easy 10 minute walk). Really pleasant and airy reception area. Decent hotel gym. The pool area is fantastic for younger kids but isn't a swimming pool as such - no real lap pool. Best of all was the room/suite - there were five of us - two adults and three teenage girls. The room was modern, smart, well-appointed, roomy and comfortable. The beds were super comfortable and the air conditioning was fine, not too noisy. The girls had bunk beds, which were loads more comfy than sofa beds and a real step up from the old-style hostel/backpacker bunks. This is not a Disney hotel and so you don't quite get as much related to the parks themselves as you would from staying in e.g. the Grand Californian. But in terms of comfort, value, and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our family of five stayed for three nights while we visited Disneyland.  For the price, it was fantastic!  We had a suite with bedroom for the adults, living area with bunk beds for two kids, and a couch for the third.  There was one bathroom for the whole suite but it had two showers.  It would have been nice to have two separate bathrooms, but it worked for us.  The water park is nice, but know that the pool is extremely small.  We only went one afternoon.  It's a 15-min walk to Disneyland/California Adventures.  We had breakfast by the lobby one morning and found it to be convenient and good for the price.  It's nice that the coffee in the hotel room comes with disposable cups so you can take it to go.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for 3 nights with two teenagers and two younger children in a 2 queen, 1 bunk water park view room on the 2nd floor.   Our room was literally looking right onto the water park at the same level on the second floor. However, we did not hear excessive noise at all. We also liked being on the same floor as the water park because we didn't have to wait for elevators to go up/down.   The reviews are correct, there are really slow times with the two elevators, especially with the baggage carts and big strollers. Being such a new hotel, I'm not sure why there aren't two sets of elevators.   There is valet only parking, $20 when we were here. Not really a big deal because we were not needing in and out service, but it did seem like the valet was well staffed.   All employees
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Accessible room bathrooms are a safety hazard.
Summary: Unless you need one, refuse a wheelchair accessible room: You may not check-in with a disability, but you may leave with one... The drains and floor inclination aren't properly installed and you get water everywhere when using the walk-in shower, no matter how careful you are! I had to dry everything up and lay down towels in the meantime, hoping I wouldn't slip and crack my skull open. I've added some pictures of the issue which you should be able to see under the "Bathroom" label. While José at reception wasn't too helpful when I asked for a room change, the next day Art was very diligent and was able to get me a room change - Unfortunately I had to be out of a room for a number of hours. Upon checking out, my bill reflected a full charge for the 4 nights I stayed with my
Manager Response: Dear F_Javier_N: Thank you for your very valuable feedback! I truly appreciate your information and apologize for your shower experience. I had my general contractor come out to the hotel today to inspect the shower in your room and we did find a problem with the tile slope and drain position. We inspected all of our accessible rooms and fortunately only this one has a problem. Because it is an ADA room, we will need to consult with an architect and engineer to create a corrective action plan and then implement it as soon as we can acquire the appropriate building materials. I think this is a great example of the benefits of guest communication with hotel management. I strive to have all my rooms, amenities, and service personnel 100% perfect for my guests but unfortunately I don’t always get everything right. So I am truly grateful to you, and for all guests who take the time to let me know when there is a problem, so that I can learn from my mistakes and make it right for the next guest. Please contact me if you would like to further discuss your experience. Best regards, Bill Cleaver

Summary: Stayed here in July, parks very busy but hotel very welcoming and good quiet air con which was much needed due to temperatures of 34 degrees. Family suites with two doubles and 2 bunk beds ( big enough for a 6 ft 4 in don't I sleep in. A 5 minute walk to park gates past a macdonalds which is lucky as no restaurant at hotel except for a coffee shop in lobby. Mimi's in car park is excellent restaurant - can recommend the guacamole
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great family option right outside of Disney Parks
Summary: We stayed at the Marriott Courtyard Theme Park Entrance for a quick Disney vacation over a holiday weekend.  We chose the Marriott because of its proximity to the Disney Parks, its sleeping arrangement, and the water park feature.  All-in-all, it was a fabulous stay that compares very favorably to my personal experiences at both the Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian especially when you take price into account.  The Courtyard is designed with families with kids in mind, and it executes it really well.  Our room came with two regular beds in addition to a twin bunk bed … four mattresses in total that provides all sorts of sleeping arrangements even if you have a large family.  For our family of four, it was more than adequate.  The bathroom has a double sink as well as a
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room i stayed in here was massive and had plenty of space in it for a family of 3-5. The beds are good and the bathrooms are great also and come with separate shower room. Staff were very helpful also. It is a bit overpriced, like all things in California, especially near Disney. It is a great location for Disney and this is one of the reasons why i stayed here. It is a short walk to the main park entrance. I would recommend this place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed with the family for 2 nights and was very pleased. Nice big room with bunk beds and modern amenities including coffee maker. Bathroom was spacious and very modern, and had 2 showers! We had a room near the freeway and this was a little noisy as a result.   Wifi is free and they also have a really good water park - not huge, but great to cool off in after you've been to Disney.   Hotel has a shop which stocks a variety of essentials and gifts but be warned that you cannot charge items bought here to your room. There is also a "bistro" open morning and evening serving Starbucks coffee as well as snacks and drinks. There is no traditional breakfast offered in the hotel.   Location is great, no more than 10 minutes walk to the security line at Disney and the walkways are
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great for the family and right across the street
Summary: We have stayed here twice for a Disney visit and the hotel is great. You can leave you car there, walk across the street and you are in Disney Resort in 5 minutes. Restaurants are close, the rooms sleep 6, and it has a great water slide park for the kids. Best location we have stayed at for a Disney visit ever.  To maximize your experience at Disney, plan on getting to the parks about, 7:45am. The lines are much shorter earlier in the morning.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed between 5-11 June and couldn't fault it.we have two boys aged 7 & 8 and they loved the watersides & pool area which we used every day. We had a spacious room (corner room in the 3rd floor). There are laundry facilities so we could do some washing ($2 U.S. dollars per wash/dry. The staff were helpful and polite. For us it was a 8 minute walk to the main entrance to Disneyland (noting that from the main entrance to the actual gates is another 5 min walk). There are a few places to eat along the way (McDonalds,Panera, Pizza ) and there is a Target 4 miles down the road (I took a taxi to get there -cost between 11-15 U.S. one way).We did not eat onsite at the hotel. I would definitely book my next stay here.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is in a good location – 10 minutes walk from Disneyland, although there are nearer hotels. The room is big with a separate bedroom containing bunk beds. The bathroom is huge with 2 showers, which was very useful. The waterpark is great for children but the pool is tiny. We had a Fireworks view room overlooking Disneyland, it was great to watch the Fireworks from our balcony. The only issue we had, is that this hotel is advertised as having a bar, but unfortunately this is not the case. The bistro does serve beer and wine but is only open until 10pm. Mimi’s next door has a full bar but closes at 11pm. This is probably not an issue for most people, but was for us as we like to end our day with a nightcap. Overall I would recommend this hotel for families with children
Manager Response: Dear Lynn M: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We hope you had an enjoyable stay. I will review our webpage to make sure it accurately describes the services and amenities of the hotel. Once again, thank you for your feedback! Sincerely, Bill Cleaver, General Manager

Summary Heading: Walk to the parks, enjoy on-site water park, and family-friendly rooms
Summary: We hotel-hopped for 2 weeks enjoying 5 different properties and this was a family favorite.  The bunk beds were a special treat for our two boys (13 and 8).  We were able to check in a bit early and enjoy the awesome water park before heading over to California Adventure in the evening.  Word of warning....have water shoes!  The deck around the pool, water slides, play structure is VERY hot. There also is not much shade.  Hopefully that will be addressed by the hotel management.    This resort is a shorter walk to the parks than the on site parking structure and probably Paradise Pier hotel.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Clean, new, and we loved that the bathroom had to separate showers (travelling with teen girls). Great for families. Only thing I would say is the breakfast at the hotel took a bit of time and got to us cold. It would be better is they had a buffet or continental breakfast option for a quick meal before heading out. Mimi's cafe right next door was AWESOME food and great service as another option. Pool is small but was not busy ever, water park was great and the kids loved it. Great view of the fireworks from the pool deck as a bonus. Walk to Disney gates was 5-10 mins depends on your pace.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent three nights at this Courtyard. Amazing location just across the street from Disneyland. The hotel doesn't offer free breakfast (as with other Courtyards). But there are many restaurants close by. Our bell-girl suggested Pizza Press and we loved it.  The valet team was great. We love that we can text them before we go downstairs for our car. The front desk staff was nice.   We love the pool, and the hot tub. The water slides were smaller than I thought, but they were good size for adults and kids. We enjoyed our afternoon spent at the pool and wished that we had more time to spend there.   We had a laundry room on our floor. Each load only costs $2, so it's very reasonable. We love the bunk bed in the room and I love the extra tub in the bathroom for my little one.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights with family, the only good thing about it was the location and the waterpark, also the size of the room we got with bunkbeds. They didn't have room service in the evening when we asked for pillows since ours smelled of pee, they told us to come get them from downstairs..? Ridiculous. It was wayy overpriced for what it offered. No breakfast included either.
Manager Response: Dear TripAdvisor Reviewer / Hotel Guest: Thank you for your review. We truly value all our guest feedback and use the information to improve our service and amenities. I sincerely apologize that you objected to the pillow cases. We did investigate this issue and found that our ironing machine was operating at too low of a temperature which caused the pillow cases to come out slightly damp. This dampness caused the pillow cases to smell musty; we have corrected the problem and thank you for alerting us to this problem. We do offer our guests the choice of picking up items at the front desk or having the items delivered to the room - I apologize that this was not clearly communicated to you when you made your request. Also, as you mentioned, we do not offer a complimentary breakfast. We understand every guest has their own preferences and requirements and we offer the Bistro as a great alternative to the complimentary breakfast buffets at other hotels. At the Bistro we offer fresh made to order items at la carte pricing. Please contact me if you would like to discuss your experience with me. Best regards, Bill Cleaver

Summary: We drove here and stayed for five nights while on Easter break and the place was booked solid. We met my parents there and had our three young kids (7,7,9). This place exceeded our expectations! There is no restaurant service in the hotel. Mimi's Cafe is outside the front door and Panera and such is around the corner. You can pick up pizza and bring it back to the hotel while walking back from Disney. I met another lady who had Safeway deliver groceries (smart idea!) We loved their bistro (Coffee, yes!) that had inexpensive ($5 for breakfast or quesadilla, kids salad, etc)  food for the kids. Tip-Call in the evening and place your order and then pick it up. Bistro is very busy in the am so they don't take calls. They also had a shop where you could buy milk, snacks, soda, etc. I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Finally a full-service hotel across from Disneyland
Summary: The overpriced hotels inside Disneyland have finally met their match! Although we love the Disney resorts, it's nice to finally have one with an equally nice pool area and facilities without the high cost. And pretty much all of the other properties along Harbor Blvd. within walking distance are basic motels, with exterior corridors and small pools surrounded by a concrete slab and parking lots (with the exception of the Howard Johnson next door). This hotel is about a 7-8 minute walk from the park turnstiles, slightly shorter than the walk from the Disneyland Hotel. The walk felt pretty safe, as the sidewalks up to the hotel were busy with people late into the night.  The kids enjoyed the pool deck with several large and small slides and a splash area. The pool itself though
Manager Response: none

Summary: Right outside Disney's main entrance, clean, charming decor, store, waterpark, and Mimi's Cafe outside the entrance for breakfast...and although not the cheapest, still a reasonable rate for what you get! The best part (for me) is the bunkbeds in the rooms! (This means I don't have to hear my kids complaining about having their own bed, or about their sibling kicking them in the night.( ;)
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved this hotel! Perfect location across from the Disneyland Entrance (5-10mins walk). We had a family room with a separate room for the kids with bunks... A must if your wanting some privacy after long days at Disney. The room was beautifully clean and maintained. The staff wonderful and always friendly. Breakfast was available at a cost, and was very family friendly priced for the location. The added bonus of the hotel having their own water play area, meant that we had some down time and the kids were kept busy! We would stay here again and are already looking at dates!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A classic Marriott close to Disney
Summary: This is a hotel for families who probably have young kids. There is a very nice open fun water park placed one floor up so that it has excellent privacy but the pool is small so not really more than a dipping pool for older children or adults (as we were). The rooms (we had 2 queens) are spacious and contained an iron & board, coffee machine and refrigerator and a self-service laundry is on every floor. We had 3 nights in really comfortable beds, required after 12 hours per day foot mapping the features of Disneyland. As with many Marriott hotels the food is not the principal expertise of this hotel chain. An in-hotel bistro is only open for breakfast with a not particularly varied menu and then not open again until 5pm. There is the perennial food market which is small and
Manager Response: none

Summary: This motel opened in mid-2016, therefore, everything is clean and sparkling, and keeping it in this condition is a priority by employees. The employees were always ready to help the guests and answer questions. There is a business section with computers and printers for guests to use.   The room was comfortable and provided nice space for the number of people the room allowed, which was six. The grandchildren liked the bunk beds and the fact that we could view the fireworks unobstructed from the small room balcony (other rooms do not have this viewing availability). The pool area offers fireworks viewing but we did not use this. Be sure to still attend the fireworks at the park because there is music and animation added to the event. Also, sometimes due to wind or other factors,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked this hotel mainly because I thought my grandson would like the water-park on site and I was right. We spent the first day at the pool area and had a ball. I am happy to report that the hotel more than lived up to my expectations. We booked a room with 2 queen beds and bunk bed. The beds and pillows were great, we slept so well. The room was very quiet too considering we could see the freeway.  We had a fireworks view room with balcony and that was fun too. There is a table to eat at, fridge, microwave and coffee maker. The bathroom worked out well for us. Plenty of storage. The staff was very friendly, we always got a smile and a hello when coming and going. The valet staff was very nice and helpful too. This is a very nice hotel and everything about it is first class.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice, but could have been great
Summary: The hotel was very nice. Clean, new, and nice sized family suite. Our kids loved the waterpark. The location is fabulous and our room had a clear view of the fireworks.   But check-in was very slow. The clerk tried to upgrade us, but couldn't get the system to work. He failed to give us the green bands for the waterpark, so after getting the kids in the pool, we were told we had to leave and get our bands...not cool.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Super clean & new hotel with all the amenities!  Spacious rooms w/ balconies. Bath + shower + double vanity. You can only see DL fireworks on one side though (not ours near water park gate). Fun water park. Pool is a bit small though. Nice lobby & market. Great little bistro to grab n go as well. Even serve alcohol later in day. Great staff. Easy walk to parks, 9 min to gate. Decent food all around as well (panera, mcDs, etc). Great bang for your buck here!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Modern, clean, great facilities and close to Disneyland!
Summary: After staying at another Anaheim hotel for our first 6 nights, we found the staff here to be so much friendlier, more helpful and welcoming.  We stayed in a family King suite with a bunk bed for the kids in the main room, and a separate bedroom for parents.  The hotel is modern and very well equipped, with an outdoor fireplace for cool evenings and a café in the main lobby.  There is no room service but every family friendly restaurant you could imagine is within close proximity.     It was good to have a microwave supplied, but for some reason hotels here don't supply any containers, bowls, mugs or cutlery for actually preparing food or heating milk.  Remember to bring your own.  The two best features of this hotel is it's close and convenient location to Disneyland (a 5 min
Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived on the 4th, everyone was great. My brother flew in from the east coast a few hours earlier and the hotel made sure to put our rooms next to each other. We got the Queen bed with the bunk beds. I was surprised at how big the room was, and the big walk in shower was a added bonus. Wednesday we had to leave for my grandmas memorial service and hopped in the rental and had a flat tire. We were running late and I asked Brian Schinski, the guest service coordinator, who was out front if he could get me the number for the local Americas Tire. I work for Discount Tire and know they could get the repair done quickly. Brian handed me their air pump and said we could borrow it for the day that way we could make the memorial. Nice job!! I thanked him the next day. My kids loved
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were very excited about this hotel but found it to be rather overpriced with a lack of concern for its customers.  We tried to add on an extra night at the beginning of our stay at the last minute but it was booked.  We asked for a wait list, but they had none.  We called back after cancellations, and were offered a room at a higher price.  I realize this may be common in the hotel industry but it wasn't a weekend night, and they obviously had a cancellation -- so why charge a current customer more, especially when integrity is one of your core values?    When we arrived, the valet did not offer to take our bags -- we had to ask for it.  And our room was not made up one day when we returned past 3pm.  We were out since 8am.  Valet parking at $20 per day was high compared to
Manager Response: Dear Donna D: Thank you for your review of our hotel; we appreciate hearing from all our guests and use their feedback to improve our services and facilities. The hotel does sell out during peak vacation periods which makes it difficult to accommodate a last minute guest request for an additional night. Our rates, just like the airlines, are based on demand and change dynamically. Price integrity is very important to us and we offer our guests the best available rate at the time of the inquiry; we coordinate those prices across all our distribution channels and offer the Marriott Look No Further Best Rate Guarantee. I am pleased that you received my apology letter and the gifts which I sent to your room and am sorry that we could not make you happy. Sincerely, Bill Cleaver

Summary: Let me start off by saying I researched this hotel for months before our stay. It did not disappoint . The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. We loved watching the Disney fireworks from our room, but I do not recommend paying extra for this because the view from the pool area was just as good. We ate each morning in the Starbucks area and had a great start to our day. Every person we came in contact with at this Marriott was helpful and personable. The "water park" was fun for my younger daughters 8&10, but a bit of a let down when it came to the pool. It is more of a wading pool and very small. We are a family of 5 with three daughters 8,10,&17. Not one time did the room feel small. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Disneyland and wanting a nice hotel to stay
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for families
Summary: Walking distance to Disneyland !  We drove there from San Diego.  Had family visiting. Once we there Disney shopping and food places all within walking distance. The kids loved the bunk beds and adults had two queens. The water park was a bonus for kids while adults relaxed
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay within walking distance of DisneyLand and restaurants.
Summary: Large Clean Room and bathroom were large and could accompany a family of six comfortably as it had two queen beds and bunk beds, and the bathroom had two sinks, a tub with shower and a large separate shower.  Our grandkids loved the pool and water park where we spent one day between our days to DisneyLand and Adventure Park.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had two nights at this hotel and it was lovely! The staff were more than helpful and the room was extremely large and comfortable.. You are within walking distance to Disneyland and California adventure park! We even caught a cab down to Huntington Beach and had dinner which was lovely! The cab fare was about $55 each way
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close, clean, great sevice, and great for a small family.
Summary: I check how clean it is as soon as I walk into any room. Really clean and spacious rooms, perfect for our family of 3 kids, 10-7, and 5, my wife and I and her mom. Plenty of room and the staff was excellent! Polite, coutious, and not looking for a tip overy minute of the day. Pool was quiet and really nice. Stayed ina  balcony room, nice but being at the parks was way better.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is convenient and well managed.  The furnishings are very uninteresting but functional, and rooms are huge with no lack of space. The pool and water slide give the kids some down time after disney and everything works well.  Is it worth the costs no not really as it is just an average hotel at a higher price, and far better prices can be obtained not that further out from the park gates. The hotel also does not have any nice eating places within it only a very average cafe. The gift shop is overpriced but staffed by charming people, but does stock all the little extras you may need.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is amazing. I am usually grossed out about the lack of cleanliness of hotels. However this hotel was so clean and I enjoyed our stay so much we are already planning our next vacation there. The staff at this hotel was super friendly and always had a smile. The Waterpark here kept our kids entertained for hours and we enjoyed sitting outside. If you plan on staying here make sure you book at least 4 months in advance because the hotel quickly fills up and the price increases a lot. The parks are a short walking distance from the hotel. The only thing I would change about this hotel is them offering continental breakfast for free. Also, if you have a car you spend a lot of money tipping the valet. Overall it was one of the best vacations. There were 6 of us staying in
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Courtyard Anaheim from 6/20-6/23.  I can't say enough about the wonderful service that we received from the valet to the front desk.  From the time that we arrived our valet/bellman, Brian, greeted us warmly and took care to help us with our bags up to our room.  He also provided great local information which I found to be helpful and a nice personal touch.  I also wanted to compliment the entire front desk and single out Jonathan and Charmaine for providing exceptional service.  The property is new, fresh and big with super comfortable beds and plenty of space to rest and unwind from a long day at the Disney parks.  I would highly recommend this Courtyard to any family seeking exceptional service and an awesome property to stay at during their Disney vacation.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great hotel, good location to Disney
Summary: We spent 5 nights while visiting Disneyland. Hotel is about 10 min walk tongue gates.  We had a king room with bunks for the kids. The room is nice and spacious and it was good to have a king bed not the typical twin double as is typical in many US hotels.  Pool and waterslide was a bonus but too hot to use when we were there over 40deg each day.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Awesome, nice, clean and huge room
Summary: Super nice hotel, clean, comfy and huge room. Just 6 mins walk to Disneyland park. No Complain at all. Easy check-in and out. Free in room Wi-Fi, but super slow. Water park is an awesome addition to our Disneyland trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here when we were down for Disneyland. The room was clean and really nice. There were 2 beds in the room and bunk beds for the kids. There was a huge glass shower and another shower with a tub on the other side of the bathroom. There's a gift shop, restaurant and Starbucks in the hotel. The kids loved the water park here. It has a pool, a wading pool, hot tub and water park with water slides for the kids. They loved this area. I did too. It was nice to come back and cool off in the middle of a hot day in Disneyland. Only a 5 minute walk to Disneyland. There's a Mimi's nearby, Denny's, McDonalds.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Loved everything about this hotel except for the price of a glass of wine. 😁  Starting with the valet service, which was friendly and efficient. Valet parking is NOT an option and is $20 a day. Being that close to Disney, you can understand why. The check-in desk is always staffed with friendly, helpful people. We spent four nights there and the good service was continual. We had a handicapped room at the front of the hotel where the Disney fireworks were spectacular. It had probably the best roll-in shower we've had. The bathroom is large with no problem turning a large power chair. We asked for early cleaning as my husband needs to nap and it was always clean when we returned. The A/C was quiet. You couldn't tell it was running. You can hear noise from the hallway, but we
Manager Response: none

Summary: Went and booked this trip on short notice. This hotel is not upscale but extremely clean and family oriented. Very close to the Disney theme parks entrance within 10 minute walk. Great Lobby, Rooms are Clean and have a small balcony to enjoy the fireworks in the evening. It has its own mini waterpark which is not crowded during the day since everyone is Disneyland bound all day long so pretty much we had it for ourselves. Kids had a blast not having to wait in line for the water slides. The same it goes for the fitness room. A+ I highly recommend this place. Starbucks is ON downstairs every single day. Check in Check out was a breeze👋👋👋

Summary: Can't say enough about this fantastic property!  Courtyard gave every consideration to the comfort and enjoyment of their guests and really focused on the needs of a family visiting for theme park fun.  The rooms are spacious and perfectly appointed.  We were in a queen guest room--two queen beds, bunk beds, dining table that seated 4--what a perfect set up!  A real bonus was two showers--one with a tub and one that is a walk-in.  The room had a small refrigerator and a small microwave which was so ideal for preparing meals in the room.  All the staff was fantastic from the valet to the cleaning staff to the lifeguards at the water park--yes a water park!  It was so nice to come back to the room after several hours at the park and hang out in the water park to cool off and
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great family room ~ we had two queen beds and a bunkbed for the kids. One problem: my mattress was old and had a dip in it. The sheets that were on my bed the first two nights were "pilled" (meaning little balls on them) which annoyed me. However, the staff was very helpful and friendly. The pool was great on the last day, though we only had a hour to visit before checkout (it opens at 10 and checkout is 11). The location was good (as short walk to the park entrance) but there is not a complimentary breakfast, so plan on eating out or paying in the lobby.

Summary Heading: Great stay just minutes from Disney Parks
Summary: We just finished our 1 week stay at this hotel for our family vacation. We had a  great time and enjoyed the hotel and places close by.  Our room was not facing the Disney  fireworks so our view was not the most ideal however you could see the nightly 9:30 fireworks show from the pool area. The room had 2 queen sized beds plus bunk beds which worked nicely for us. The beds were comfortable and there were plenty of pillows. The TV was in view of the 2 queen beds and the table seating area however not the bunks. There was lots of storage area in the room as well.  The bathroom had a large stand up shower in the room with the toilet and a bath/shower combo in the section with the dual sinks. The bathroom was very clean. Summary: My family spent 2 nights at this hotel last week.  We arrived early in the morning and even though the check-in time is late afternoon we were in the room in less than 10 minutes.  Our car was parked immediately and the bellhop took the luggage with us to the room.  Every staff member greeted us with a smile every time we walked through the lobby.  The rooms were clean and the bunks were great for the kids.  It is only a short walk to Disneyland.  We stayed at a Disney hotel last year and this room was better.

Summary: We heard about hotel this from a family who stayed here last fall and we did our research and we are so glad we stayed here compared to the Disney property.  This is a first class hotel and it's less than a 10 minute walk to the property.  The rooms are spacious, comfortable, clean and quiet.   We enjoyed the water park a couple of times during our visit and it was a great break for our daughter and the heat.  What a benefit of the hotel to come back from disney and play in a great water park.      Each room has a refrigerator, microwave and place to sit and eat.    We ate breakfast at the hotel's quick service bar.  We were able to get yogurt, oatmeal and great coffee.  It's in partnership with Starbucks so think Starbucks with hot food.  The hotel has a great gift shop and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The most perfect hotel for families...period.
Summary: I can't say enough about this hotel.  First, you are so close to Disney.  There are a lot of restaurants along the way too if you don't want to eat in the park.  The room setup was awesome, my kids loved the bunk beds.  Our room also had two showers which was so much more convenient than a standard hotel room.  The waterpark was great, we only did that one night as we were in the Disney parks most of the time.  There should be more hotels like this in areas where families frequent.

Summary: The entrance to Disneyland is a very short walk away. Very clean rooms. The pool was under maintenance, so I cannot offer a review. It was disappointing that we couldn't utilize the pool after a long day at Disneyland. The staff was very knowledgeable and courteous.

Summary: What a clean beautiful hotel.  Helpful staff, great price and waking distance to Disney.  Book it !  5 adults and a baby and we had plenty of room.  Two showers in the room was so terrific so we could get to the park in a hurry. Weather did not cooperate but the WaterPark looked great.

Summary: Just can't say enough about this hotel. Of course it is not a luxury hotel but it is super nice. The rooms are very spacious and extremely clean! The suite was ideal for our family and comfortably slept four adults and a child. The location was an easy five minute walk to the parks. The staff was amazing! Our grandson got sick and he hotel recommended a pediatrician that came to our room!! Saved our trip!! This is my new hotel for Disney!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Generous size room for a family
Summary: The two of us stayed here 5/31-6/2/16.  It was a very clean and spacious room for with 2 bunk beds and 2 queen beds.  I wish we could have had some more kids to enjoy the slide and park size pool.  The deli was handy but open only mornings and evenings.  Enjoyed the fruit cup and yogurt for breakfast and good coffee.  We also ate at Mimi's located in front of the hotel and it has a great selection of meals.  Only drawback in my estimation was I thought the walk was a little farther away from the entry.  Probably takes about 10 minutes. Otherwise, great hotel at an above average rate.

Summary: We stayed here with our 4 grandkids.  It was a very easy walk to Disneyland.  The kids enjoyed the water slides and water spray area.  The regular swimming pool is VERY small.  I really liked the fact that since there are 6 of us, we could all stay in one room.  That is so rare.  Most hotels won't allow that many in one room.  The bathroom was large.  It had one area with the toilet and enclosed shower, and the other section had the sinks and tub/shower combo.  Our room had two queens and a set of bunk beds.  Very nice.  Highly recommend this hotel.  We bought one breakfast downstairs, but it was kinda pricey.  After that we just stopped at the McDonalds on the way to the park for pancakes.  I would highly recommend staying here with kids if you are headed to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I think we chose the perfect hotel! The staff were amazing but most especially Savvanah who went out of her way to find us a room to have a nap in, after a fourteen hour flight and an early 6am arrival.   We chose a king size corner room which is the size of an apartment. It had a seperate kids room with a set of bunks.  The room also had a fridge,microwave and a coffee machine. Room also had balcony and fireworks view. Beds were amazingly comfortable 😄  The walk to the parks was easy (less than 10 minutes). A cold snap meant we didn't get to use waterpark more than few hours one afternoon but kids loved it. Gym was well equipped for hotel gym.   Starbucks in the foyer offered easy and well priced coffee and breakfast options. Little market and shop in foyer that stocked few
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is the nicest Courtyard Hotel I have seen. It is very conveniently located to Disneyland. The facilities and rooms are very clean and well maintained. The room is large and set up well for families with 2 queen beds, bunk beds, tub w/ shower and additional shower, microwave and fridge.   What really made them standout though is the high level of service they provided when my 12 year old son got sick right before we were due to catch our flight home. They helped us get a doctor to come to our room to see if my son could fly home. He couldn't due to an ear infection so the Courtyard extended our stay the needed 3 days at a reduced rate. Additionally they checked on us to make sure our son was feeling better. We will be back again to this hotel and highly recommend it for
Manager Response: none

Summary: I had a lot of points so we booked just a one night stay. I had been longing to stay here and now was my chance!  I checked in with my mobile app and asked for a 12:15 check in time and my wish was granted. I have always really liked all Courtyard Marriott's but this one was the best. This one was very well done and decorated. I loved the Spanish style all throughout the hotel and it felt expensive.   Very smart with the rooms being able to accommodate up to 6 people. They were very spacious and comfortable. Big plus having a fridge AND a microwave!  Waterpark was fabulous. Kids spent hours and hours there. We asked for a late checkout and our request was once again granted so we got to spend more time at the waterpark the next day.   All the staff was so nice and Friendly. I've
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed three nights at this Courtyard for a family holiday to Disneyland. The kids absolutely loved the room and the water park, and didn't want to leave. The hotel is new - just over a year old - so you have the advantage of everything looking and feeling like its brand new.   The rooms are large, each easily sleeping six. We stayed in a room facing the water park, with two queen beds and single bunk beds. There is a nice seating area, almost like a breakfast nook, to eat or just relax, which is a nice touch. The room also includes a microwave - an excellent inclusion when you have hungry kids - a mini-fridge and a coffee maker. All you need short of a small kitchenette. I especially loved the large bathroom with separate shower and bath areas - this meant you could have one
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: An absolute MUST for the Disneyland bound
Summary: I don't even know to where begin - how about this is the first time I've not felt claustrophobic staying in a hotel room with our family of five?! There was so much room! The Marriott thought of everything for their guests...big rooms, a big bathroom, big fridge, a microwave, bunk beds, and fabulous location. The staff is awesome too! Friendly, accommodating, and always have smiles on their faces to greet you after your long days at Disney. The pool area looked amazing, I can't believe we didn't use it. (First time to Disney so we maximized our time there) I will say that the walk to and from Disney wasn't bad but at the end of a long day, it sure felt a lot longer than 5 - 7 minutes. Other than that, it was a near perfect stay. You'll definitely want to book this hotel...you

Summary: This hotel is central to everything. An easy stroll to Disneyland and transportation. The service is fun and friendly with quite young staff. The pool is nice and heated for the cooler weather whilst we were there. The self-laundry and room was perfect for our family of 5.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for Disney close to the park
Summary: Let me start by saying that we normally come to Disney once a month and do not stay overnight, on this occasion we stayed for the night, here are the main   1. Price is great, for one night stay for what you get, very good! In a standard room had 2 queens, and bunk beds which the kids went crazy over (they love bunk beds), sleeps 6 very comfortably, Gold!  2. Room is new, bathroom very nice, had separate bath and shower, was a small fridge, safe and a large TV with your basic channels and a few extra and connection to Netflix. Free wifi of course which worked great streaming when we wanted to.  3. Downstairs there is like a cafe, not open all day but for large portions of day, but there is a Mimi Cafe right across parking lot from hotel and a Panera bread close by as well, there
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful Hotel Close to Disney Parks
Summary: We were a party of five adults staying for four nights in June 2016.  The location of the hotel is terrific because it is just a ten minute walk to the parks.  We arrived on a Saturday evening, and the check-in procedure was quick and easy.  The staff at the hotel were very courteous and friendly.  They answered our questions and gave us recommendations for restaurants and ways to get around town.  The room was spacious, and was furnished with two queen beds and two bunk beds.  We were able to stay in one room, where in other hotels we would have required two.  We appreciated the refrigerator and microwave, so we were able to take leftovers back with us.  We also liked the free wifi.  The bathroom was also large, and had two separate showers (one walk-in, and one tub.)  This
Manager Response: none

Summary: December 2015, great sized room with bunks and 2 double beds as well as room for a couch and table!!  Check in was a breeze and a good 3 hours before check in time. Wifi was perfect even without the faster upgrade. bathroom was great, shower over tub as well as a separate shower and all beautiful!! Had a child get a tummy bug on the 2nd to last night of stay and the reception staff were fantastic at making sure we had everything we needed, with extra towels, bags and even a plunger for the blocked toilet.  Great location, fantastic water park and awesome little shop with everything we needed.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect spot for your Disney Stay !!!!
Summary: From the moment we arrived I knew that I was going to be happy with our choice of accommodations !!! After much research my husband decided to book the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park Entrance ... and so glad he did !!!! We are a family of 5 ... dad. mom and three adult kids that still enjoy doin' the family vacations with their parents ... ages 26, 24 and 21 ... the room was perfect ... two queen beds and a set of bunk beds .. a large bathroom area with a tub/shower and a large stand alone glass enclosed shower .. worked perfectly for us !!! Clean .. comfortable .. close to the Parks !!! Great lobby area .. excellent breakfast ... inviting !!! I have to say .... the staff at this hotel went far beyond to provide GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE !!!!! Thank you for making our stay a pleasant

Summary: We stayed in a suite with a king bed and a bunk bed with a huge bathroom (fitting a spacious shower as well as a well-appointed bathtub (with shower) and two basins). But the real reason we chose to stay here was the firework view the suites offered, available on our own balcony and, over the three nights we stayed, was absolutely sensational!  We did hope we could check in earlier on arrival just after 2pm. Standard check-in was 4pm.  We were offered to spend the time waiting for our room at the Waterpark on site but decided to kill time in Mimi's Cafe which was right in front of the hotel. Returning to check in on 4pm, things were smooth. The suite was spotless upon entry. It had a very modern decor with wallpaper and comfy carpet.  While the hotel claims to be at the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Tasteful new hotel across the street from Disney!
Summary: Felt compelled to write this review!  It's a beautiful, spotlessly clean hotel with excellent customer service.  I had to make several calls in the days prior to arrival to confirm several details and I always encountered a knowledgable, friendly and patient staff member.  Our room was awesome and big!  The walk to the park was so easy and at most 10 minutes.  Do not give merit to some of the really low reviews.  Everyone is entitled to their opinion but giving this hotel a 1 star rating??!!  Some people are incapable of being happy or satisfied.
