Summary: Never book by Westjet vacations this hotel.  You will get the worst room which is a view of highway even if they have a better room.  A lot of sirens and highway noise were bonus for my five night stay.  I asked to change the room after one night stay but refused because of Westjet vacation customer.  Feels like not very welcomed eventhough I paid double compare to other hotels.  Not worth the money!  The hotel itself was ok.  Pool was very small.  Not really close to disneyland than I thought (At least 10min walk)  My previous stay was Spring hills suite maingate by marriott booked by Westjet at half price of this hotel.  But I got a fireworks view room, very quite, friendly staff, free parking, complementary breakfast every morning.  Walking distance to disneyland (15min) but
Manager Response: Dear Eunbae: Thank you for your review of our hotel; we truly value your feedback and will use it to evaluate and improve our facilities and services. WestJet Vacations is a valued partner of our hotel. We are working with them to determine a way to allow them to book all of our room types; there are technology limitations, which we are working to overcome. I apologize that you were affected by these limitations. I wish you had contacted me during your stay so that I could have assisted you and personally arranged a satisfactory resolution. We all work hard for our vacation time - I encourage all hotel guests who are unable to resolve their issues to speak to the General Manager during their stay so that the GM can intervene and use all their resources to make it right.  Please contact me if you would like to further discuss your experience.   I agree with you and think Springhill Suites is a terrific hotel. Marriott offers many different types of hotels that offer a range of amenities and services so that our guests are able to find just the right hotel for their needs. Springhill Suites offers a free breakfast buffet while the Courtyard offers the Bistro which offers Grab n' go snacks to sit down meals that are priced and ordered separately. So whether you like the convenience of a buffet at Springhill Suites or prefer the freshly prepared food options of the Bistro at Courtyard, Marriott has a hotel that is just right for you.

Summary: Very nice new hotel.  Stayed 3 nights in May.  The first night I arrived I had only been in the room for 5 minutes when a front desk person knocked on the door to hand deliver a letter from the General Manager explaining and apologizing that Maintenance would need to be in the room the next day between 10 - 2 to install new blinds.  He apologized for the "inconvenience".  Since I would be out of the room anyway, there would not be any inconvenience but they credited my account $50.00 anyway.  This was typical of my whole stay.  The entire staff seemed to go out of their way to be accommodating.  Room spotlessly clean and comfortable, especially the bed.  Great view of the nightly fireworks.  I would highly recommend this hotel.  New, modern, short walk to Disney, friendly and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A new hotel that doesn't function
Summary: We had a family of 6 in a double queen room with bunk beds. ROOM 429. Had a view or the fireworks and the freeway. The road noise was overwhelming it sounded constantly like the patio door was open. The walls were also relively thin for being a new hotel. Could hear people above us and running up and down the hallways above and on our floor.       Mattresses were hard as a rock. SO uncomfortable. The kids bunk beds were way more comfortable and that is where my husband and slept. The white sheets were so cheap and over used they were pilly and they only got changed once on the last day we were there. Apparently hotel policy is to only change the sheets once every three days unless otherwise requested. Very un hygienic from a traveling perspective.        The refrigerator does
Manager Response: Dear Brandy W: Thank you for your review of our hotel; we truly value all feedback from our guests. I sincerely apologize that you were not satisfied with your experience. As a hotel manager, I don’t think you can ever be too old to learn something new or be too good to improve so we will review your comments and make improvements wherever possible. We do have a computerized system for tracking guest service requests and I have all of the requests which you made. We will examine each item to see if we can improve our processes or our guest communications.  We do show that we successfully completed all 16 of your service requests within an hour and the majority of them within twenty minutes. Some of the mechanical inspection items took longer because they required inspections in several locations and because we could not find any problems. All air conditioning systems, exhaust systems, and refrigerator systems were working correctly.   I did provide you with Marriott Reward bonus points and an apology via e-mail and invited you to contact me by telephone if you wished to further discuss your stay. It is our goal to have all of our guests feel extremely satisfied with their stay. I truly apologize that you felt I was not interested in resolving this matter to your satisfaction.

Summary: Visited with the family, we had 3 rooms all together which was great.  Rooms are large and well appointed.  Just a 10-15 minute walk to the parks.  No restaurant, however there are plenty of restaurants within a short walk.  Fridges available in the room to use, small shops in the foyer which have most things you need.  Pool area super for the kids.  Overall great place for a family holiday.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for four nights as part of a Disney vacation. Had the one bedroom King suite with bunk beds in living room. Room is large, spacious and everything is brand new!! Loved the bathroom set up with two showers. Comfy beds. Great, heated water park. Nice gift shops. Location is perfect - walk to theme parks, restaurants, etc. Wish they offered complimentary breakfast though and that parking wasn't valet only.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: WOW! Got so spoiled here, amazing!
Summary: Big room, 2 queens and 1 bunk. My mom, dad, daughter and myself slept well. Just a few hiccups, hotel booked two taxis for us on the same day, we could only take one obviously! Young staff, looked inexperienced in hospitality! Restaurants good, but not open all the time. 10 min walk to Disneyland. Good free wi-fi, nice water park. we had a standard 2nd floor room. Used the laundry, no issues. Housekeeping had a few lapses but nothing to ruin the holiday. Overall, we were quite spoilt and felt quite comfortable in the room. Would recommend to family and friends.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Family Friendly, Good Alternative to Disney Hotels
Summary: We usually stay in Disneyland hotels, but for this trip, both Disneyland Hotel and the Grand Californian were fully booked very early on.  We booked this hotel given the positive reviews, and we were very pleasantly surprised when we got there.  The rooms very nicely appointed and spacious, the staff was friendly and helpful, the pools were fun for the kids, and it did provide an excellent view of the fireworks.  I also liked the design of the bathroom, there was a separate door for the shower/toilet and the sinks/tub.  It's practical for a family sharing the room.  We also liked how brightly lit and cheerful the hotel was in general. Given the price advantage vs Disney hotels, this was a very good deal.  Regarding the distance to Disneyland, if you walk briskly, you can get to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good sized room but not great overall
Summary: We booked a suite and I called to be sure fireworks view.  Rep helped me change to room she assured me was fireworks  view but when arrived was told no suites are firework view.  Kids were crying, bummer start to our trip.  Staff not helpful with this.  Location a bit further than expected from Disney- not a super quick walk back and forth.  Also overall felt staff not very friendly and helpful at times.  Room a good size but layout weird so we had to walk through living area (where kids sleeping) to bathroom.  Maybe bathroom should be off main bedroom instead?   Bistro good for breakfast and snacks.  Very friendly staff working there all the time. Pool and slide fun for kids. Housekeeping did a great job-room always cleaned promptly and very well.
Manager Response: Dear Amy G:   Thank you for choosing our hotel as your host to the Disney Resort area; I hope you and your family had a great time and were able to make many magical memories. I am sorry that you received misinformation regarding our suites; it is my goal to have all my guests leave feeling delighted and satisfied that they received the accommodations they reserved.   Hotels will normally construct their room descriptions to include a premium view or amenity for those rooms that have these features (e.g. “Twin bunk bed, 2 Queen, Fireworks view, balcony”) so that guest know what they are booking. If the room description does not include such information it is a safe bet that it is a standard room without any special view or upgrade. The best people to contact to confirm this type of information are the on-property front desk associates who are happy to answer these types of questions.     I also apologize that you did not enjoy the layout of the suite. It is difficult to build a room which will be universally accepted as everyone has their own preferences. We do have pictures as well as a graphic room diagrams available for each room type which can be viewed at Marriott.com to assist our guests in choosing a room or suite which will best meet their individual needs and preferences.   I hope you will return to our hotel on your next Disney Resort vacation, please contact me personally so that I can arrange your visit and answer all your questions.   Best regards,  Bill Cleaver

Summary: The property is VERY nice and the water park feature for,the kids is great! Don't believe the reviewers that constantly repeat that it is "five minute walk to Disney". It is not. Not that it is bad, but just don't be over optimistic. I timed it carefully. From our room on the 4th floor, to the park entry line is a ten minute walk. Not bad, but at the end of a long day at the park...... We didn't mind that much, but older folks or very young kids......  Rooms were great and I was VERY surprised that there was little or NO noise from hallway or adjacent rooms! Big plus! Clean, and very helpful staff. Shout out to Brian at valet/check in. Great help. Very nice!   Only downside (besides cost on the night side) is that we had constant sewer nasty smell coming out of the bathroom
Manager Response: none

Summary: Having strayed at Grand Ca and Courtyard Entrance.  Really was happy with Courtyard.  Friendly staff and great location. The pool/waterpark is oriented toward afternoon sun. Very exceptional in this area the Grand CA orientation get little sun in late afternoon in the fall.  Walking distance to grove mall and restaurants.  You can request a room that has a view of Disneyland fireworks. The pool deck has great view of the fireworks show.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great Location to Disney! The rooms are super spacious,the waterpark is superb,the staff are friendly and welcoming.Lots of restaurants around for meals.This hotel is great for kids of all ages. Great view of the fireworks from the pool deck.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We've stayed in many hotels here in Anaheim and this one is by far the best. I never want to stay anywhere else. We have 5 kids ages 1-12 and stayed in a two queen, one bunk fireworks view room for five nights. (I'll go for a suite next time). The pool and slides were so fun that the kids were willing to come back from Disney the last two afternoons and rest/swim in the afternoon. There are some decent eating spots on site or within 2-3 min. The walk was doable for the whole family, 4 days in a row. Staff was friendly and helpful. It's more expensive than other hotels in the area, but worth it in my opinion.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm not the kind of traveller that would normally stay at a Courtyard hotel. But took a chance with the amazing reviews on trip advisor.  And it paid off. Terrific hotel. 5 to 7 minutes walk from Disneyland. Friendly young staff. Large comfortable rooms with bunk beds, a bath and a shower, Kureig coffee maker and small fridge, tv with built in Netflix. We had a regular room but ended up with a great view of the fireworks. Modern laundry facilities for a few dollars on every other floor. Water park was terrific - had to laugh when my 7 year old said it was the best part of the trip.  Modern lobby with a restaurant that served decent food, and a little food shop for basic items. We stocked up on food at the nearby Walmart grocery store which worked well.  There are also a number
Manager Response: none

Summary: I booked 3 nights at the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park for myself, my daughter and my two sisters. With this many people, there can always be a potential issue when moving around each other in one room. I was so pleasantly surprised! The room I booked had 2 queen beds and a bunk bed, providing sleeping room for everyone. The bathroom had a large shower in the bath area that included the toilet. Then, there was the vanity area that included 2 sinks as well as a bathtub and shower. The room appeared clean and appealing. Looking over the waterpark was not only fun but the position of our room allowed us a fantastic view of all the Disneyland fireworks in the evening.  The hotel staff was fabulous! As we walked into the lobby each night, we were greeted by staff members.  I would

Summary: We stayed for our 4 day Disneyland vacation. Our room had a twin bunk bed, 2 queen beds, table, desk, mini fridge, kurig coffee machine, large closet, and large bathroom. It was nice and spacious for our family of 5. Our room was up above the pool area, and we could see some of the fireworks from Disneyland. It's a bit of a walk, I wouldn't take the kids any further away from the gates on foot. I don't know if there was a shuttle to the park gates, we didn't ask and it wasn't offered. When making the reservation we were alerted that the pool/splash pad would be down during our stay- but they offered use of the HJ hotel's water park across the street which we thought was a nice alternative.  The housekeeping wasn't the best, it was obvious they were in a hurry leaving bunks

Summary Heading: Nice but expensive option for Theme park vacation
Summary: Our family stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in early May.  First off, the staff were fantastic, likely the best I have seen in a chain hotel. Top marks for the team.  The rooms were spacious, we didn't feel crowded at any time. The kids loved the bunk beds. I loved that the king room a Had the bunk beds tucked away towards the entrance of the room. It kept the kids further from the window if they happened to be sleeping before the fireworks.  Cleanliness: the rooms looked to be clean, but we did find some hair in the bed, I never addressed this with housekeeping at the time, but did notify the manager afterwards. Summary Heading: Perfect family hotel for a Disney vacation
Summary: Totally impressed with this hotel if you're going with your family to Disneyland. Our room was great with two queen beds and a set of bunk beds. There was a table with seating for 4 in the room and even the bathroom had two showers. The splash pad and water slides were a kids dream come true. The hotel was clean and had a great little cafe with tasty ready to go eats!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here before the Tinker Bell Half Marathon.  We were a group of three women and got the two queens and bunkbeds.  We were very comfortable.  This room has two showers and two sinks.  I asked for early check in and was able to check in about 10 am.  The room was great and really quiet.  It is a quick walk to Disneyland/California Adventure.  The night before the race, we went to bed about 8 pm.  The fireworks woke us up but the hotel was quiet.  Enjoyed our stay here!

Summary Heading: Fantastic  place especially for a family
Summary: Plenty of room and the availability of bunk beds, bathrooms with 2 showers etc makes this a great place for a family! Extremely clean and well maintained. The staff was friendly and polite to a fault, obviously customer service is something they are paying attention too.  Easy walk to the parks. I would highly recommend.

Summary Heading: A Clean Relaxing Space To Return To
Summary: We chose this hotel because it was new, spacious, very close to the Disney entrance and didn't appear on any bed bug register! We were thrilled with our room and as much as I love Disney, at the end of the day, it was wonderful to return to our oasis.  We asked for a water park view room. We thought this would be a great way to gauge the best time to go down to it. We were given room 554 and were thrilled on the first night to also be able to see Disney's fireworks from our room. I had wondered what the noise level from the pool area would be like but the soundproofing is excellent as we heard nothing when the doors were closed.  We loved the layout of the bathroom area including the two showers which made getting ready in the morning very easy. We were supplied with an
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a very spacious suite with a king mater bedroom and 4 bunk beds in a separate room.  The suite had 2 showers which made if great for the group of us to get ready in the morning.  The hotel is located less than one block away from the main entrance.  I would stay here again on my next visit!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: My husband booked us here for our anniversary trip to Disneyland.  It is a very quick 5 minute walk to the parks.  We arrived at around 12;15 and our room was ready.  We had a room with a partial view of the parks from our mini balcony.  There were 2 queen beds as well as a bunk bed, making this perfect for families who are visiting Disneyland.  There was also a shower as well as a tub/shower combo.  The room was very clean and our room was always clean and towels replenished after coming in from the parks.  We were greeted both coming and going from the hotel.  They also have a water park/pool area - while we did not utilize this it is a great place for families to get away from the parks for a bit.  They also have a small convenience store with items for purchase as well as a
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'd stay at the much cheaper Howard Johnson across the road as if you're staying in Anaheim you're spending all your time at the parks or asleep.  2 lifts for the whole hotel so massive queues which is not great when you are tired from Disneyland. They should open the stair well so people can use that, we tried to but you can get in but not out! Swimming area is great for little kids only, 6 slides is a marketing ploy, really it is 2.
Manager Response: none

Summary: To keep it short, I won't list all the nasty globs of who knows what we found around the room, and I won't list all the things we wiped down with 1 whole pack of Clorox wipes. I won't list how many crumbs, rubber bands, and hair we stepped on. I will say that housekeeping did a good job changing sheets and towels, aka the BARE MINIMUM. Beautiful hotel and logistically efficient layout. But lack of attention to detail by housekeeping makes it feel grubby and uncomfortable. Oh, and lots of lint balls on sheets, seems they wash the towels and sheets together? Marriott needs to train housekeeping way better, especially in high traffic locations.
Manager Response: Dear Adriana L:  Thank you for choosing our hotel to host your visit to the Disney Resort area and thank you for your review; we truly value your feedback and will ensure that we learn from our mistakes so that future guests do not encounter any problems.   We have researched the events which lead up to your experience and have found out that the housekeeping supervisor and housekeepers both made critical mistakes in preparing your room. The housekeepers cleaned the room but did not do a thorough job. The housekeeping supervisor entered the room, viewed the room, and immediately went to the telephone and entered a code which changed the room status from vacant/dirty to vacant/clean in our property management system. As she was entered the code she noticed that the room was not cleaned properly but received a call to attend to an emergency which was happening in another guest room and left the room before changing the status back to vacant/dirty.   The front desk was unaware of the mistake and saw that the status of the room was vacant/clean and checked you into the room. After clearing the emergency from the other guest room the supervisor went to go back to your room but you had already been checked into the room. The housekeeping supervisor realized her mistake but failed to report the situation to her manager.   I sincerely apologize for our mistakes and assure you that this was an isolated incident and certainly a violation of our standard operating procedures. Proper disciplinary action and additional training has been provided to those involved in this incident and a departmental review meeting has been conducted. I am happy that the front desk was able to provide a discount on your room for you but invite you to contact me directly if you would like to further discuss this matter. I can be reached at bill@anaheimcourtyard.com   Sincerely, Bill Cleaver

Summary Heading: Great place - but lets just keep it out secret...
Summary: Stayed in a lot of hotels near entertainment venues. This is one of the best. We had a double queen with bunks adjacent to our Son and family. He had the King Suite with a King and bunk in an adjoining section. Similar to a Residence Inn. Kids sleep in a separate room. What's not to like about that.. Our rooms had a connecting door. Great for the mornings when Mom and Dad want to sleep in and they know Grandpa and and Grandma are awake.  Easy walk to the park. Food near by.  Kids loved the water park. They are 6 and 9. Perfect for their age. Teens would be disappointed in pool. But they dont sleep in bunks anyway and they hog the pool and make life miserable for the rest of us. Just a sidebar.. Overall this is one of the best values you will find near the park. But do not tell
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not bad, not great. Has positives and negatives. 2 bunk + King room, thought we were getting a kichenette but perhaps that's our mistake. Nice and close to DL. Waterpark quite exposed and didn't really work for older kids. Good valet parking, nice restaurants adjacent. Very clean and modern.
Manager Response: Dear DanAuckNZ:  Thank you for choosing the Anaheim Theme Park Entrance hotel as your host hotel for your visit to the Disney Resort area. I hope you and your family were able to make many magical memories during your visit. We appreciate your business and truly value your feedback.   I know how frustrating it can be not to have your expectations met and I apologize that you were misinformed about this hotel having kitchenettes. None of our rooms have kitchenettes; if you have the time and inclination I would appreciate it if you could send me an e-mail and let me know the details of how and with whom you booked your reservation (Marriott.com, through a travel agent, Internet booking agent, wholesaler, or other) so that I could make inquiries and ensure they have our correct information and ensure that other guests are not mislead (bill@anaheimcourtyard.com).   I am happy that you enjoyed our valet service and found our hotel to be very clean and modern. Please let me know if I can be of further assistance to you. Best regards, Bill Cleaver

Summary Heading: Big rooms. Awesome waterpark. Bad food options. Basic room amenities.
Summary: Stayed in standard room mid-april. Overall this hotel was great and we'd return again. Some good and bad points to note... - waterpark was amazing. It was incredibly hot when we were there so this was a life saver. Water is very cold though so if it wasn’t so hot our daughters wouldn’t have been as enthusiastic about it. - actual swimming pool and hot tub quite small so these were very packed. - amenities in room very basic. E.g. no tea, just Kurig coffee dispenser.  - rooms large for standard rooms but fridge very small, would be nice to have a mini-kitchen given it’s a family hotel at Disneyland. - hotel staff not helpful. They didn’t know the answers to many of the questions I asked (e.g. cost for stroller rentals they offered at hotel.) - elevators very slow and often lined

Summary Heading: Waterpark, Theme Park and Updated Digs!
Summary: We just got back from our stay in Anaheim which ended in us staying at the Courtyard Anaheim Theme Park entrance. We initially had only one night scheduled at the end of our trip and loved it so much we booked another night.   Normally we stay on Disney property, which we find convenient and cost comparison wise depending on time of year the Courtyard property is around the same price for the stay. Although there are some difference makers. One very stark difference is that the rooms at the Marriott are larger and have some really great amenities. Bunk Beds and 2 queen beds make for spaced out sleeping accommodations. My family thought the double duty bath of a stall shower and bath tub shower combo made getting ready a little less stressful. In the morning we were able to enjoy
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Spacious room, great location, friendly staff...
Summary: We experienced one of the most memorable vacations last week and one of the main contributing reasons was this hotel. The location of the Marriott Courtyard couldn't be better (it was a 10-minute walk to Disneyland main gate, approx 0.3 miles), the room itself was spacious and clean, the beds and pillows were soft and comfortable, and the bunkbed was a bonus: our boys loved it! The front desk staff was very friendly though housekeeping people were somewhat grumpy when they brought us the extra comforters. The pool and waterslides were fantastic! We would have spent an entire day there instead of at the park had the temperature been hotter. The water was pretty cold in the little kids play area but the hot tub made it tolerable. Our kids would take turns going down the slides and

Summary Heading: LOCATION...... Brand new, large rooms, wonderful Bathroom layout.
Summary: Best bathroom layout ever. Double vanity and shower/bath in the main room. Through an internal door within the bathroom, you'll find a free standing glass shower and the toilet. So 1 person can shower and dress, whilst others can be at the vanity preparing for their busy day in Disneyland. The waterpark looked amazing, but we were too busy to enjoy. I used the laundry facilities, which were well designed. Although the gift shop sells laundry liquid, I packed my own. I met the General Manager who was lovely, and he advised the hotel will soon be installing a retractable clothes line over the bathtub. That will be wonderful for those wet swimming clothes. Summary Heading: Great stay, but there's always a "but"!
Summary: Nice new hotel. Very clean, great staff, friendly. Short walk to the Disneyland park entrance. Loved the waterpark & pool for our 3 kids (ages 8-13). Hubby and I enjoyed the fire pit on the patio just outside the bar/snack area. We grabbed some Starbucks and kept our tootsies warm by the fire. We were surprised that there were 2 showers in the room (1 stand up Shower, 1 Shower/Tub combo) -- worked out great for our party of 6. Manager Response: Dear Butterflykisses12:  Thanks you for staying with us and for your great review of our hotel; I am very pleased to know that your enjoyed your stay. I apologize about our valet parking policy but wanted to explain some of our reasoning. We exclusively offer valet parking for a several reasons: of course we want to make money (I would be remiss if I didn't admit that) but convenience, safety & security are also very important to use. Anaheim is one of the safest resort destinations in the USA and we want to keep it that way. Each car which is left with our valet team is photographed front, back and both sides at valet registration, this process documents each car and license plate (this alone turns away many questionable people). This process also documents the condition of each vehicle at check in. Our valet team ensures that no valuables are left in cars which helps us prevent possible crimes before they happen. Our garage is primarily used only by our staff so we can detect and question people who should not be in the garage. Surprisingly, SUV's with 3rd row seats are a major target for criminals throughout the USA, since we control our garage when we park SUV's we back them up against concrete walls which prevent the 3rd row seats from being stolen out of the tailgates. Our valet policy is intended to help protect our guests from having anything negative happen to them while staying with us. One additional note, we only have one bank of guest elevators but there are two elevators in that bank and they both travel from from the 1st to top floor. Sorry for the long-winded answer but I wanted to provide you with our thought process behind our policy. Please let me know if I can be of additional service to you or answer any additional questions. Have a happy new year!

Property Located is right across from the Disneyland Park, 10 min walk to the front gate. Right in front of the hotel is a

Summary: On this trip it was my Wife, Granddaughter and myself.  Our Granddaughter is 8.  This is the first time that we have stayed in this hotel as it is very new.  I have got to tell the staff are extremely nice.  The hotel is new so of course it is very nice as well.  We had a corner room high floor pool and Disney view.  Since it was a corner room it was a bit larger very well appointed.  Two Queen and the bunks, the bathroom has a tub and shower with two sinks very nice.  I would highly recommends this hotel to anyone going to Disneyland with children.  Our Granddaughter really enjoyed the waterpark on the second floor.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Best hotel we have ever stayed in while visiting Disneyland!  The staff always greeted us and were very helpful when checking in early.  We had 4 seperate rooms and they were able to accommodate our request to put us all together.  The rooms were spacious, clean and were a great set up for our families. Disneyland was a quick walk and we were able to go back and forth during the day.  The pool and waterpark was great fun for the kids, even in the middle of November.  This is our new go to hotel for our family Disneyland trips!
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights in November 2015 and it was the best hotel stay I have ever had. From the moment we arrived we were greeted by extremely nice and helpful staff. The gentleman who helped us with our bags and the gentleman who checked us in were so nice, and really made us feel welcome. The room was very clean and very nice. Having the bunk beds makes for a very comfortable stay. Also having the 2 bath/shower was very helpful. Are room was cleaned everyday before we came back from the parks for a mid day rest. Our first night my husband and I had a couple beers downstairs at the bar and the bartender was awesome and we enjoyed a relaxing time after walking the parks with our kids. We also had dinner from the bistro on our last night. My husband had the
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stumbled on this hotel after searching several days of sold out options. We were taking a family trip to Disneyland and needed something within close walking distance. Four adults and four children including grandmother over 80 and a 3 year old and 6 week old.   This place was great! It's very close to the main gates and restaurants. It's a new hotel so everything was clean and in good shape.  Upon arriving the valet was very professional and polite helping unload our cars. Check in was a breeze. We were on the sixth floor which offered great views and unlike other hotels we did not hear hallway noise or noise from surrounding rooms. We got a room with bunk beds and two queens which worked out perfectly. The beds were comfy and provided with plenty of pillows and blankets.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loved the pool, staff was great.
Summary: I almost don't want to write a review cause then everybody might start staying here.   Had a great two nights.  My son loved the water play / slide area as much as Disneyland.  Water was a bit chilly but he didn't care.  Facilities are really nice, bathroom by the pool.   I took the kids by myself.  I felt completely safe here.  My teenagers went across to the park.  I felt safe letting them walk back by themselves.   Parking is valet and it's $20 a day.   The other thing after we checked out, I wanted to keep my car there and I was told I would be charged another $20 after 2 pm.  Would have been nice if it was 6 or 7 pm.   We loved the room had 2 beds and a bunkbed, we didn't all have to squeeze into two beds.  We all got our own bed.  Bathroom has two showers which is a little
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here while participating in the Avengers run at Disney. It was a convenient and safe walk to the starting line. Overall, I'd say this is our new go-to when planning a Disney weekend.  The staff has the enthusiasm of a new hotel staff and the rooms are spacious and modern.  I chose this hotel for its pool but was too busy at the parks to check it out.  Our room was a double queen standard with bunk beds. It was an awesome room for families not just because of the bunk beds but because there was a walk in shower AND a tub and shower. There was also a very cool booth like area to chill or eat or whatever.  Really, quite nice.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: highly recommended! A nice oasis and a great place to relax when Disneyland tires you out.
Summary: We are a family of 6 and were making our first trip to Disneyland. Our stay at the hotel was fantastic from the moment we arrived until the day we left. The service of the staff went above and beyond our expectations. We arrived early from the airport and the hotel allowed us to check in hours earlier. This was great as I had originally assumed they would only have us store our bags and we would have to come back at check in time. Instead, we checked in an were able to relax and frolic in the waterpark while the most families were at Disneyland. On the day we left, our flight was in the evening and we were able to check out in the late afternoon and enjoy the pool some more. This service essentially gave us an extra day at the hotel at no extra charge. The staff was attentive

Summary Heading: Great family hotel for a stay at Disneyland
Summary: We were very impressed with this place...here are the pros:  - Friendly, helpful staff - Clean, huge room with bunkbeds + King (there are 4 of us) - Bathroom had one shower and the toilet behind one door, plus another traditional tub/shower plus two sinks - Near restaurants (Mimi's Cafe, Pizza Press, iHop, Denny's)...plus McDonalds for breakfast! - Great pool/waterpark - with 2 larger slides, plus a splash park and wading pool for toddlers - Keurig for decent coffee, plus microwave & fridge - Free wifi -You can see the fireworks from the deck! (depending on the room) - It is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel lobby to the flowers by the Disney train station in the park.    Cons: - To be honest, I would really need to get picky to find a negative...  it was that good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a brand new hotel. My wife and I took our daughters (7 and 10) to Disneyland for 3 days. We stayed in room 206, and it was Fantastic. This room had a king bed and bunk beds. The room was large, it had separate sleeping areas for the kids and adults, a table with seating, and the bathroom had 2 separate showers.  Since this hotel was brand new, the facilities were really nice and clean. The front staff was attentive and friendly. There was a nice little gift shop in the lobby that had very reasonable prices.  The pool area was nice, it is a bit misleading from the pictures. The pool is small and the water slides go into a small holding tank (not sure how else to describe). The water feature was fun and so were the water slides. The only knock on the pool area is that it
Manager Response: none

Summary: Staff were welcoming and cordial.  Room was spacious and the bunk beds were great for our 6 person family.  Kids enjoyed water park 2 times, plenty of oversight at pool, 3 pool attendants (1 up at slide) and a hostess walking around keeping things safe. Fireworks room balcony was worth it!  Thanks Courtyard!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice New Hotel in a Great location
Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights last week while we were going to Disney and California Adventure.  This new hotel is a short walk to the parks.  The room was very nice and had a fireworks view (unfortunately Disney cancelled the fireworks on the couple of nights that we were planning to watch from the balcony).  We had the room with 2 queen beds and a set of bunk beds.  There was also a booth type area with a table.  The staff was very friendly and helpful with answering any questions we had.  Our son enjoyed the Water slides and spray park area.  I will stay here again if we come back to the Disneyland area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family of 4 (including a 7 month old and 6 year old) arrived here at around 11:30 am. After a long journey we were all exhausted and some of us were dealing with motion sickness from the long flight and drive. We were immediately told that our room was not ready yet. I explained that we were not feeling that great, and could we perhaps have a courtesy room while we waited for our room to be ready. I was told this was not an option. The woman at the desk promised to advise us as soon as our room was ready. So we waited in the lobby. There is a Starbucks in the lobby but it was closed. It's only open in the morning and evening. About 2 hours passed before I went back to the desk and asked a different employee (I guess the original woman we had dealt with had gone on break) if
Manager Response: Dear jensam80:  Thank you for your review and for choosing to stay at our hotel. I sincerely apologize that your room was not available for an early check-in when you arrived at 11:30am; the front desk agent should have notified me that you had arrived and were not feeling well so that I could ensure that you received a room as soon as possible. I encourage all our guests to check-in using the Marriott Mobile Application; you are able to check-in prior to arriving at the hotel and you receive instant updates when your room is available. I am happy that you enjoyed the view of the fireworks and waterpark from your room and that your son enjoyed the bunk beds. Our room prices are dynamic and change based on special events as well as overall demand; rates which are available on one day are not necessarily available on the next day. We certainly did not mean to insult you by quoting you our rates and I apologize that we did not explain this to you in a satisfactory manner.

Summary Heading: Fantastic for kids, great location, large rooms
Summary: Stayed for four nights with the kids for a trip to Disneyland.   This hotel is in a great location, right across the street from the park. The walk over is very easy. We could see the fireworks from our room. The hotel is brand new, and very well designed.  The rooms for this hotel are great for families. Our room had two queen beds, plus a set bunk beds. There were only four of us total, but our kids still wanted to sleep in the bunk beds. Plenty of room for a family of five or six. The bathroom was laid out with both a tub/shower combo, and a dedicated shower to help speed up the mornings getting ready to go to disneyland.   The other big feature of this hotel is the pool / waterpark. They have several big slides with a lifeguard at the top, as well as a splash park area, and
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights over halloween. Family of 4 with 2 boys 5 and 7. The rooms though standard size have a great set up for families. Plenty has been said about them in past reviews re showers, bunk beds etc so I will leave that. But will mention that the rooms now have an in-room safe which I do not believe they did upon opening. The safe fits a standard laptop not a wide screen. WiFi worked well and the amount of devices are not limited. We had 4 devices going on a couple of occasions. I would agree that the shower area could use a couple of hooks so people could actually reuse their towels. Summary: We had a great experience.  We were greeted by Margerito and he set the tone for our whole stay.  He helped us with our bags into the hotel and into our room.  He made sure we understood all the amenities and was able to answer any questions we had.  Every staff person we encountered from the front desk to the valet made sure you were taken care of.  We stayed on the fourth floor and had a view of the waterpark.  The room was clean and the extra shower was so nice.  The location to Disneyland is great and the walk was easy.  The one item I would like to see different would be another hook in the bathroom to hang items on.  I definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again.  Thank you so much for the awesome experience.

Summary: We have always stayed on property but with a group of 6, it was going to Be very $$ so we decided to Give this place a chance and WOW we were amazed at how great the hotel is, the staff and the location.   At first a bit weird waking from the other end of the Carpark instead of downtown Disney but it is literally 5-7 mins walk to the gates.  The rooms are spacious. The bunks a massive space saver and practical for Families and the bathroom has 2 showers so getting everyone ready was a breeze.  Pool area is great fun, however I imagine in summer would be roasting hot as not a lot of shade cover. Summary Heading: Great Location, Friendly Staff, Wonderful Accommodations
Summary: We had a GREAT stay at this hotel! I was with 2 other friends and we arrived well before a normal check in time. But there was already a room available for us which was awesome. Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was so spacious, very ideal for families. Everything in the hotel was new, clean and comfy. Everyone having their own bed was a huge perk. Having 2 separate showers was also very convenient for 3 girls all trying to get ready together every morning. Located about a 5 minute walk from the Disneyland park and close to other restaurants. I normally stay at the same hotel which is almost next door to this location but I think I will make this my new preferred hotel for Disney vacations.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were not originally scheduled to stay at this hotel and I'm SO glad we found out about this hotel and were able to change our reservation.  The hotel itself is gorgeous-definitely not your typical Courtyard Marriott.  There are 5 of us and we had plenty of space in our 2 queen room.  We loved the seating area in the corner where we could sit for snacks, to watch TV, etc.  We had a fireworks view room which was a bit loud around 9:30 every night but fun to watch from our room.  The big hit, of course, was the water park!  My kids probably enjoyed that more than Disneyland itself.  I would like to see the water park better staffed. Manager Response: none

Summary: We arrived at the Courtyard after a terrible experience at another local hotel, what a wonderful change in every way. The front desk staff was amazing and helpful (Maddie). The rooms were great, a wonderful place for families and couples. Awesome pool area, and great fitness room. We would stay here anytime and recommend to everyone! Great hotel!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a night while visiting DIsneyland. Everything was well organised, clean, the beds were really comfy (except for a constant creak everytime the bunk bed wobbled) The staff were lovely and we had exceptional assistance from the General Manager on a late check out issue. 5 minute walk to Disneyland but my kids just wanted to play in the water park all day!

Summary: We had a very nice stay at this new hotel.  Check-in was easy, service was good, room was clean. The family suite with two bunk beds was a great size for our family; however, the space wasn't as functional as it could have been. Whoever designed a bunk bed room for up to 4 kids with NO DOOR on the room that is directly across from the bathroom made a huge mistake. It made it very difficult for us to move about the suite while our kids were asleep at night or in the early morning because they could hear our every move (from the two doorways in to the room with no actual doors) and/or light would enter their room from the bathroom and living space. In some ways, it felt like we were sharing a room with them which defeats the purpose of a suite. The living space is a great size,

Summary: This hotel just opened in august and is really new and fancy. The rooms are spacious with bunkbeds in each room. They also have two showers per room which was a first. All tiled floor to ceiling and spotless new. A fridge and micro in each room was handy. The staff was very nice and flexible with certain policies. They must have read the reviews cause they had three staff in the water park at all times helping enforce safety which made a huge difference for those parents who dont give a rip about their kids behavior. The pool was spotless and i agree mostly oriented for 10 and below which is the disney crowd. I didnt like the valet parking but they were really nice i just prefer to be able to park and check out whenever. In fact marriot i wouldnt mind paying the valet price for

Summary Heading: Courtyard Anaheim enhanced our Disney stay
Summary: Celebrating my granddaughters first birthday at Disneyland,  we had a 3 night stay,  as a family of five.......mom, dad, a 2.5 and a one year old, and nana. Excellent accommodations:  a large room with two queen beds, bunk beds, and enough room for a  "Pack and Play" playpen we had brought along.   There was plenty of storage,  an eating nook,  microwave,  roomy refrigerator,  a Kerig,  and wonderfully large bathroom,  with a large double sink  vanity, with well-lit mirror, a  shower/tub, and another roomy shower.   All were  greatly appreciated, with everyone trying to get ready to go to the Disney park. Summary Heading: Great hotel but I have one gripe
Summary: We just got done staying 8 nights at this hotel. The rooms are great for families and worked out really well. It was really quiet and the main areas were really clean. All staff that we ran into were great and the gift shop is really great with lots of items to purchase. My main gripe about this hotel is housekeeping. They take FOREVER to clean the rooms. Our room was never cleaned before 3PM any of the days that we were there. It became an issue because it was so hot that in the afternoons we had to come back to the hotel to rest and take showers. We always would get back and the room had not been cleaned yet. So most of the time we just asked them to give us new towels and empty the trash.
